title: What is your favorite K-pop band? - Quora

response.answer_text: prepare yourself for a long list! I’Il put actual kpop groups in the beginning and then at the end put some soloists I stan for fun cause why not? MCND  I really like their personalities, and they are very unique from other boy groups. They seem to get along well and have awesome content. They also have very talented rapper and vocalists. Such a sweet fanbase. CIX  Awesome discography. What else can I say? Also a really supportive fanbase. I hope they do quite well in their next comeback. Stray Kids  They are quite talented and I like their music videos. Also Chan needs to sleep. As do all of them. As do like every other kpop idol. Blackpink  Gosh, they all look so good in this photo. I honestly really like their music. Every song is so iconic. DKB  They are such good dancers. I also got really interested in them cause two of them do a lot of acrobatics stuff and it was really cool watching them practice in a vlog. BTS  Absolute icons. Mamamoo  I really like their personalities a lot. I sometimes struggle to get into girl groups cause it’s hard for me to connect with them, but I immediately could like this group. GOT7  Once again, I really love their personalities. Also, can we get some better treatment for them please? OnlyOneOf  Pure visuals. Also I really enjoy their dance covers. Teen Top  I really like this group. They deserve so much. They have a very kind fanbase (from my experience) and I think they have some amazing foot work in their choreography. Winner  People really don’t appreciate these guys enough (although their fan base is so chill and kind). Absolute kings of the tropical party concept and sad songs. (G)I-DLE  Their discography is top tier. Also, absolute queens. Woo!Ah!  They’re such a chill group, yet so talented, yet so underrated. Oneus  KINGS! KINGS! KINGS! Check out their Road to Kingdom performances! They are so talented! Great fanbase! TXT  Check our their recent comeback. I really liked it. 1the9  This is the only temporary group I’ve ever stanned and I’m sure glad I did. They’re a really underrated group, but they have such a nice fanbase. The Rose  I really like Woosung’s voice and they’re overall a really good band. I also feel bad about the whole company situation but hopefully they figure that out :) Jannabi  Amazing vocals and instrumentals. Check out their cover of Viva La Vida! It’s really good. They’re also quite funny. Ok so now, I’m gonna go into soloists… BIBI  She’s so beautiful and talented. I really like her songs, especially Kazino and Binu. She has a lot of potential. One  He’s very unique, with kind of a grunge sound to his rap. Ash Island  Such a talented man. Also Jay Park trying to get him to have answers longer than one word is such a mood. Zico  Check out his new song, Summer Hate. It’s really good. Actually so is the whole album. And every album of his. DPR Live  I love this guy so much. I watched his documentary about the making of his new album and it was so good. Check out the video for his song, Legacy. It’s crazy good. (Also my profile pic) Gaho  Honestly on of the best voices in the whole kpop industry right now. What an icon. Lee Hi  She has a beautiful voice, personality, and visual. I hope the world treats her well because she truly deserves it EaJ  I’m so hyped for his album. Him releasing the songs one by one is really killing me. Woodz  Them visuals tho. Also he is so talented. Check out the song, Buck, on his new album. And like the whole album, too. It’s all so good. Kim Woo Seok  Red Moon is SUCH an underrated song. And thoooose visuals!!!! Blue.D  She doesn't even have an album out yet but she’s already an icon. Check out her covers cause they’re really good. Jamie  Her personality is everything to me. She also has a beautiful voice. Bewhy  He’s such a good rapper. He can rap crazy fast. Check out his new album, Neo Christian. Even if you aren’t Christian in any way, you’ll love it. Sokodomo  I feel bad about his (kind of) scandal during High School Rapper. He is so unique and talented. The scandal wasn’t his fault so I think everyone should forgive him. He’s really fun to watch perform! Bol4  An amazing voice that I just couldn’t turn down. Henry  So I don’t agree with all his opinions, but you can’t deny he’s an amazing singer and a talented musician. AleXa  She is an icon. Like this girl’s talent is crazy. She’s serving straight visuals up and her gorgeous personality just makes her even more beautiful. Also Kitty Run is a major bop and my favorite song of hers so far. I can’t wait for her next comebacks!! Chungha  Came here for Snapping, stayed for everything else. She is so good. Mino  So I know I already put Winner and since he is part of that group, I don’t have to put him again, but this is just gonna be me advertising his song Okey Dokey with Zico. It is underrated. It is such a good song. It is catchy. It is iconic. You should check it out. so ya that’s all who I stan. Keep in mind, that if a “soloist” is already in a group that I stan, I won’t put them in the soloist list(other than Mino: special man, special case) a.k.a. Jennie, the members of Mamamoo, Jackson Wang, the members of Winner, the members of BTS, Woosung, the members of Stray Kids. if ya got this far, then thanks! Hope you enjoyed. Check some of these people out. It’ll be worth it, trust me!

BTS! I love them first and always. I’ve answered in a previous post why I love BTS, I will copy and paste the response again here: ————————————————————————————————————————BTS is my absolute favorite. Here’s why: Not to put the other groups down or anything, but BTS always has that air of sincerity and genuineness.BTS has always stated that they are musicians before anything else and their music comes before everything. Despite being international idols they are humble and modest. They don’t let fame and ego get to their heads.BTS is the first group that wasn’t a part of the big three (YG, SM, and JYP) to win a daesang at the MAMA Award. Their company is BigHit, which is really small compared to companies like YG which has BIGBANG, CL, G-Dragon, PSY – all super big $$$$making idols in Kpop. BTS won Artist of the Year at MAMA and also won another daesang, Album of the Year, at MMAs. That’s two daesangs in just the span of one month or so. It’s a really, really big deal for BTS, a group that debuted just 3 years ago, to win daesangs like that. Especially since they are not from the big three, which means they have had to rely on their own work and the work of dedicated staff to get to that level of success.Of course all Kpop groups are hardworking, no doubt – but the effort, dedication, and love put into by BTS is beyond outstanding. They stated that in their early debut days they struggled with affording meals and generally had hard time getting by because their company is so small and not as wealthy as the big three companies. And still, they didn’t give up and focused on making music that they wanted to put out and worked really hard. Members like Jimin practice dancing hours, well into midnight just to get choreography right.They always talk about how much love and gratitude they have for their fans, ARMYs. Even at their acceptance speech for winning Artist of the Year at MAMA the first thing that Rap Monster said was “ARMY,” even with all the emotions and shock going through him. These guys really appreciate their fans from the bottom of their hearts and don’t take them for granted.They write a lot of their own music and are truly multitalented. Members like Namjoon (Rap Monster) and Yoongi (Suga) write a lot of their own raps and produces a vast number of songs for BTS (for example, Suga wrote/produced Tomorrow, Just One Day, Boys with Fun, Let me Know, so on). They really do put a lot of their own emotions and thoughts to share with the world. Most groups these days just sing what is given to them, but not BTS!! Additionally, Suga has released his own mixtape, with many years in the making, Agust D. If you listen to his mixtape you can see it obviously has very dark and depressing themes like depression and failure.To my next point – they sing about a lot of things that aren’t typical in Kpop songs. When questioned what Bangtan Sonyeondan (Abbreviated as BTS, means ‘Bulletproof Boy Scouts’) means, J-Hope replied, “The meaning of ‘bangtan’ is to guard against something. So [our name] means that we will boldly defend our music and our value/worth.” (BTS Shares What Their Group Name Could Have Been Prior to Debut | Soompi) Some lyrics to show what I mean:From their song, Am I Wrong: The world’s goin’ crazyAnd you? How bout ya?You think it is okay?I really don’t think it is. Even with ears, there’s no listeningEven with eyes, there’s no seeingA fish lives in everyone’s hearts.Its name is SELFISH SELFISH From their song, Baepsae: They call me a try-hard.Our generation has had it hard.Hurry, chase ‘em.My teachers were born with it all. At my part time job, it’s “all for experience”At school, there’s the teachers.My superiors use violence.In the media they go on about “the generation that’s given up.” When you consider that the majority of Kpop songs today are about parties, love, having fun, generally shallow topics, these lyrics are pretty impressive. And yes, of course, BTS sings about love and having fun too, but you really don’t see other groups doing what BTS is doing. Im going to stop before I go on. I can already think of more reasons on the top of my head, but I don’t want this to get too long. To finish this off — DEBUT:  NOW:  They have really grown a lot and are still growing. ARMY Fighting!!!❤︎ ❤︎

I love K-Pop very much and I’ve only started taking interest in it over the summer of 2018. So far I stan 3 girl groups and 5 boy groups. Although one of the boy groups are Bigbang and since the members are in military right now, I won’t count them and just pretend that I only stan 4 boy groups (But my Bigbang bias is G-dragon and bias wrecker is Taeyang). Anyways let’s get started. Let’s start off with the girl groups. 1. Twice Twice is my favorite girl group. My biases/bias wreckers (I love both of these members so much that I cant tell which one is my bias anymore) are Chaeyoung and Tzuyu. The first ever twice music video I have ever watch was Likey. At first Jeongyeon caught my eye but as I gain more interest in Twice, I started noticing Tzuyu’s humor (She’e funniest in my opinion…) and Chaeyoung amazing rapping skills! (Don’t get me wrong, Dahyun is also great!).  2. Blackpink The first ever Blackpink music video I have ever watched was Ddu-du Ddu-du. The only reason I’ve heard of it was because of this app called K-Pop starpic. There was a vote and you had to decide which song was the best. The choices were Ddu-du Ddu-du, #Cookie jar, and Heart Shaker. When I watched Ddu-du Ddu-du, the first person that caught my eye was Jennie. (mainly because she was the first one to sing…) but then Lisa caught my eye (because she was the second one to sing XD) and then I started listening to the other Blackpink songs and I fell in love with the raps (Yes, I love raps)! Btw my bias is Lisa and bias wrecker is Jennie!  3. Red Velvet The first ever music video I’ve watched from red velvet was #Cookie Jar (Because of that voting thing on K-Pop Starpic) and I loved it. Then I started listening to Red Flavor a lot and I KNEW RIGHT AWAY THAT YERI AND SEUGI WAS GONNA BE MY FAVORITE!!! They caught my eye the first for no apparent reason and then I just well started loving then as I watched more Red Velvet videos! Seriously, they’re the best… Also Yeri is my bias and Seulgi is my bias wrecker.  That was all the girl groups that I stan… Now for the boy groups. Lets start off with the obvious! 1. BTS Bts is my first ever K-Pop group that I’ve taken interest in. The first ever BTS music video I have watched was Euphoria but at that time I felt like K-Pop wan’t for me. Then a couple months later (In the beginning of July 2018) I started taking interest into Bts. I watched DNA and Fire and at first it didn’t sound very good but as I got used to beat, I started to love them very much! V was the first member to catch my eye (Because of the part when V and Jungkook was slowly turning their heads at the camera in DNA… My brother thought V was a girl for a second). As I started taking more interest in BTS, I started liking Jimin a lot. Not because of his cheerful personality (that comes second) and not because of his talent (that comes third). The main reason I started taking interest in him is because when he smiles, his face reminds me a lot of my baby cousin and I thought that was so cute. Now my bias wreckers/biases in BTS are V and Jimin.  2. EXO I just recently got into Exo last month (October 20, 2018) and I LOVE THEM!!! The first ever music video I have watched from EXO was Ko Ko Bop. At first I only liked the part when the song went “It goes down now baby” but just like DNA and Fire, as I got used to the beat, I started to love the song! My bias is Beakhyun and my bias wrecker is Chanyeol. Also this is when I made Chanyeol my bias wrecker. Don’t judge me.  3. Got7 The first song that I’ve listened to that was by Got7 was Just Right. For a week that was the only Got7 song I listened to but then I told myself that I have to like more K-Pop songs so I listened to Look and i fell in love with it right away. Got7 was most likely that group that I had the most trouble with deciding who was my bias… At first I really liked Youngjae. Then I started to like Yugyeom . Then it was Jackson. Then I started taking interest in Bambam. Then Mark. Then Jb and Jinyoung… Now it’s between Jb, Jinyoung, and Mark. (Too lazy to get a picture of Mark so here’s a pic of the Jb and Jinyoung).  4.Stray Kids This group is not as popular as the other groups but I LOVE THEM!!! The first Stray Kids member I’ve seen was Hyunjin from the Idol Room videos with Got7. I started taking a HUGE interest in Stray Kids and now my bias is Hyunjin and my bias wrecker is Lee Know.  Edit: My Blackpink bias wrecker is now Jisoo. Edit 2: I read this over and I cringed! I fixed all the mistakes though. Please tell me if ya’ll see any other mistakes. Thanks! And sorry for the cringe. Edit 3: I stan Momoland now. Bias is Yeonwoo and I don’t have a bias wrecker yet.

response.answer_text: My Favorite K-pop group is none other than EXO because it is the first K POP group I got introduce I started listening their songs since 2016. I listen all of their songs. Now I am multifan but still EXO is my favorite.All of their songs are good but my favorite are XOXO, Love me Right, Monster, Overdose, Kokobop and Forever. They are different from other idols. They are special,perfect, be themselves, charming, glowing, amazing, fantastic, good looking and unique in their own ways. Thier vocals are really strong specially Baekhyun voice is so sweet and charming that you want to hear it again and again.  The 2nd group which I like is BTS because I love their songs the most and find them the most interesting. Their songs are really good with deep and touching lyrics; their lyrics are really inspiring that you want to hear them again and again. They always dance so perfectly and they're so synchronized with their dances. Tae is my bias and I love, LOVE his deep voice.  ASTRO I start liking Astro Because of Cha Eun Woo but all members are good looking and very talented. The boys are very hard working and work together for what they want. Love making people happy and try to make each other happy. Thinks of the fans and always want to do stuff for them.  NCT I start liking NCT Because of Taeyong good visual and Mark cheerful personality. NCT has really impressed me with their music as all thier releases being completely different from eachother. From the interesting unique beat of 7th Sense to the adorably catchy vibe of Chewing Gum, NCT has music to draw in all types of Kpop fans. Not only their main singles but NCT 127s album with the title of the same name includes songs made during pre debut which are just as catchy NCT is more diverse group. With members from America, Canada, Thailand, China, Japan and Of course Korea, surely their plans as a successful global group is prominent. NCT is fresh, dynamic and it’s good to see brand new faces.  Got7 I like Got7 because some of thier songs are good.What I love about them it’s their personalities, they have really strong individual personalities when K-pop tends to create a character for each members, I fell for their natural personalities and behaviours. Even though they are young, they all sound very mature and can talk about their own experiences and feelings in a very mature way.  Shinee of course the main reason to like them is their songs which are awsome. Another thing I really love about them is their presence and humour whether onstage or on a reality show. They're always honest and they never fail to make me laugh when watching any one of their shows.  Seventeen When I first heard about Seventeen , the word * self producing idols * caught my attention . I haven't seen many idols who compose their songs as well choreograph tbh. So I was interested in them. Of course that was all before I stanned them. They are awesome and they work super hard. It makes me a proud carat. Its really something I love and admire because it makes them different than any other artists.  Wanna One I start liking Wanna one when i heard song Energetic; I really like this song. then i hear other song and watch variety shows, videos they are so adorable and cute. They are good looking and What made me love them was their funny antics. especially Kang Daniel and Ong Seongwoo they loves to make people laugh. they are satisfied himself every time they makes people smile.  Infinite I first learn about this group through drama Hi School love on I really like this drama and search this group and find them amazing. I like them because of their synchronized dancing. Woohyun vocals are no joke! They are good looking and their songs are great.  Btob I like Btob because they are talented, hardworking, they're very funny, they have been featured in many variety shows. some of their songs are really good.  SF 9 I got into SF9 through thier song O Sole Mio. This song is really good and one of my favorite. Their songs are really unique with catchy lyrics. they are excellent dancers, amazing vocalists, and powerful rappers. They are often praised for their complex and jaw-dropping choreographies. The boys often showed their own versions of legendary K-pop songs like growl, I need you and their dance covers gained them great popularity. They are really talented.

To be very honest, I'm a huge multi stan (shocker, as if my name didn't give that out) but on a serious note I stan a lot of groups that if I was this serious about my studies, I'd honestly be Albert Einstein smart. Even though I'm relatively new to kpop having gotten into them late last year, I've honestly come across many talented groups, bands and solo artists. I'm starting from my ultimate kpop group. 1. Ateez  My best rookie group!!! Now, I know they're rookies and all and they're just beginning their career, like they haven't even been around for a year but these guys completely and passionately stole my heart. I don't know what it is about them that I just love so much, maybe its the way they perform, the energy and vibe they radiate in both MVs and on stage, the vocals, the synchronized dances, their personalities, the visuals! Or maybe because I'm a 4th generation kpop fan (yes, I dared to say that) and I basically started with them from their pre-debut, I just have this special connection with them! Everything about them seems so alluring. I'm totally whipped for them and you can't imagine how excited I must be for their comeback! My bias is our one and only Korean Big Minion, leader Hongjoong! He's really amazing in every way possible that I can't even begin to count. The other members are my bias wreckers, Every. Single. One! They all bias wreck me so bad I'm actually considering it illegal. Moving on! 2. Exo  They were my first love in kpop! If not for them, I don't think I'd have gotten into kpop as much as I'm in now. The first time I heard their song, ‘Monster', the inner detective in me arose that I immediately went to the web and learnt all their names and other information written about them on kpop profiles within five minutes. I never knew I could store so much information in my brain during that time frame. The vocals, the visuals, the way they moved just enticed me and I fell for them instantly. Had it been I hadn't yet found Ateez they'd have been my ultimate group. 3. Bts  I'm sure some expected them to be on the list. As happy as I am to admit, I'm a proud Army. All their songs spoke to me in with completely different meanings. It amazes me how they connect songs they did years ago with their present ones, telling a story in one way or the other. The only reason they weren't no.1 is because I get confused sometimes (let me finish, don't come at me!) Like I said before, I got into kpop late last year, so you can imagine the amount of catching up I'd need to do if I wanted to understand the song connection they had years ago with their present songs. That's a lot! Plus the theories, I'm not smart enough to understand them, start connecting the dots with the small hints they've dropped in their previous MVs, I'd have to go wayyy back, notice the trivial things and start coming up with theories. I know some may be able to do this but have I mentioned how lazy I am? You can't even begin to comprehend. I give up on the littlest things if I can't do something on my first few trials, I drop it. Its a bad habit of mine but what can I do... But other than what I mentioned I love them! My bias is Taehyung and bias wrecker is Kookie!!! (Lowkey chanting Vkook) 4. Ikon  This group of crackheads is what I live for oml!!!! I found out about them earlier this year and one thing I noticed in them before listening to their music is how extremely funny, laid back and down to earth they are! Honestly I just watch some of their clips and my day immediately brightens! They're my daily dosage of happy pills and don't even get me started on their music! Killing me, the first of their songs I listened to legit killed me! This is one thing I love about kpop, its not only about the vocals, the visuals, the dance but the instrumentals are important too and Ikon has never failed to give me the best. I honestly love them and their songs! Though I miss the crazy Ikon but the sentimental ones too do justice to my taste! My bias is Bobby and bias wrecker(s) are B.I and Jinhwan though Junhoe (June) gets me too! 5. NCT  NCT is everything I could ask for! Honestly the diversity in this group seriously gets me. Plus their sub units are what makes the group so special. They've been climbing up my best kpop groups ever since I discovered them. My bias is Taeyong and bias wrecker, the whole NCT Dream and 127, plus NCT U and Way V! 6. A.C.E  This group right here is what I call an underrated one! For real after discovering them weeks ago with their latest comeback ‘Undercover', I can't believe how much they've actually grown on me. I actually beat myself about just discovering them now and even though I'm still learning things about them, I have just four words to say, ‘DON'T SLEEP ON THEM!’ they're really talented! My bias is Jun nd bias wrecker(s) are the rest of the group! 7. Seventeen  Seventeen releases too many bops I can't begin to count. In my opinion(MY opinion) I feel they're underrated. All their songs I've listened to are so good! Honestly people should stop sleeping on them. I don't even have a bias coz I can't decide. They're all my bias!!!!! Much love from me to them! 8. Oneus  Yeeeep!!!! Have I said their latest comeback is a bop?!! Well, I'm saying it now, their latest comeback, ‘Twilight’ is a bop!!! Though they're also new to the K-pop industry, they hold a place in my heart. Bias wrecker Leedo and bias wrecked by all!!! Other honorable mentions (coz I'm too lazy to continue) Stray Kids Got7 Big Bang Day6 N.Flying Vixx Nuest Super Junior Twice Mamamoo CLC (G)-Idle KARD Pentagon Wanna One(although they disbanded, I still love them dearly!) The Boys etc I don't really have much gg I stan and I'm sure y'all noticed, but bg are more my style for reasons we all know, but I admit gg are soo good and I listen to their songs but apart from the ones on the list, I don't stan just like their songs(MY opinion). Also most of groups I stan are mostly new groups or not too old ones and again like I said I'm a 4th generation kpop stan, I'm still new and still learning old kpop groups but to really stan has been a problem. I hope I didn't bore y'all with this longg rant

response.answer_text: his is based on their music and that’s it. Not based on the members, performances or anything else. Just the music. Btw i’m a bg stan so don’t expect ggs. 1.Ateez  Their music is so unique. I mean they started with their debut album which was tropical house and if you listen to their latest album(Action to Answer) you will see a big difference. Plus they can go from songs like Illusion to Wonderland. All i want them to do is a song that is really sad. Something like Spring Day by BTS or Insomnia by Eui Jin. They are just rookies and already make such great music! They are my ult group and i love them so much. Fav title track: Say my name Fav b side: Better 2.Seventeen  They are so versitile in their music. Because they are self made, it kinda gives this feeling of connection with the artist. Also, the idea with the teams(Hip Hop, Vocal, Performance) give more diversity into their discography and i feel like there is a song for everyone. Amazing group. 10/10.Would recommend. Fav title track: Thanks Fav b side: Kidult 3.TXT  I was debating whether they should be nr 3 or 4,but their music is so good. First off, their title tracks started to go from happy and rainbows(Crown) to killing eachother with tomatoes (Can’t you see me), while going through a Harry Potter phase(Run Away). Their title tracks are really good and high quality. Their b sides are either happy and cute(Blue orangeade, Drama, Poppin’ Star) or ethereal and magical(Eternally, Fairy of Shampoo, Our Summer, Magic Island). They throw some spice in the mix as well(Cat and Dog, Roller Coaster, Puma). 10/10.They are talented fairies. Fav title track: Can’t you see me Fav b side: Poppin’ Star 4.Stray Kids  People call it construction music, i call it “different”. Their music is so distinguishable compared to other kpop groups. I mean, how many boy groups can pull off a song like God’s Menu? It helps a lot that 3Racha are main producers for their music. It give this authentic feel to them. Of course, their music isn’t for everybody, but for me it’s really good and high quality. They are also pretty versitile, having cute songs like Get cool and Awkward silence, sad songs like Hellevator, Levanter and Voices and songs with a rock undertone like Boxer, Grr and Awaken. Fav title track: Levanter Fav b side: Phobia 5.SF9  Definition of versitility. All their title tracks are different and unique. None of them sound like each other. Their b sides are such high quality. They put so much work into their music it’s crazy. RPM is such a masterpiece of an album. Everybody needs to listen to it at least once. 10/10.Please give them a try. They are so talented. Fav title track: Summer Breeze Fav b side: Echo/Round and Round 6.Day6 (what a coincidence)  Do i have to explain myself? Literally everybody says their discography is gold and it’s true. They have music for everyone and every emotion(sad, happy, angry, you name it). I listen more to their sad music but their other stuff is just as good. Everybody needs to listen to Moonrise. Amazing album. Fav title track: Time of our life Fav b side: Afraid 7.NCT  The thing that they did with the sub units is really smart music wise. I mean you got cuter music with Dream, weirder and different with 127 and edgier with WAYV.And NCT U is pretty diverse. I am not that much into Dream. Don’t really vibe with their music that much tbh. Still good, won’t deny that. WAYV’s b sides aren’t that interesting (for me!!! ), but i love their title tracks. 127 is amazing. I love them so much. So that’s why they are lower. Cause i don’t vibe with some of their music. But they are still amazing and high quality. Fav title track: Simon says Fav b side: Not alone 8.BTS  They used to be my ults but i’ve fallen out of love a bit. Their music quality has started to decline since LY:Her. Title track wise, it’s the most noticeable. I mean comparing the mastepiece that is BS&T to On…you kinda notice it. Their b sides have stayed the same in quality, some actually are better. If it weren’t for the b sides, MOTS:7 would’ve been my least fav album, but it’s my fav. I still love them a lot. Not as much as before but they hold a special place in my heart. Fav title track: Spring Day Fav b side: Best of me 9.ONF  Underrated yet so talented. Just check out their title tracks and you will fall in love with them instantlly. Not gonna say anything else. Keeping the suspense up. ;)) Fav title track: We must love Fav b side: I do 10. A.C.E  Underrated, yet so talented. They’re kinda like NCT 127 and Stray Kids. Their music isn’t for everyone but if you are a fan of those groups, you will for sure love A.C.E. They’re at 10 because they don’t have that much music. They have put out 2 mini albums but they mostly make singles(Cactus, Callin’, Stand by you). They would’ve been higher if they had more music. Still love them. Fav title track: Savage Fav b side: So sick And that’s it. Love all of them,stan all of them. Bye

By the way, I love all of the groups that I’ve listed below and I am not a hater to any K-pop group. I am not trying to be mean to people who don’t see their bias group, but I am being as truthful as I can. ALSO: I would like to say that I am not including soloists in the list. As a Korean, I have to say that the biggest group in Korea right now is EXO. I mean, BTS is everywhere nowadays, but they aren’t as popular as overseas fans think that they are in their home country. BTS hasn’t been on as many variety shows or dramas as EXO has, even though we’re including all of EXO’s scandals that put them on hold for a while. When Kris left, it was shocking, but the album sales were still there and they still went on variety shows and such. I don’t know about anybody else, but I can’t imagine that BTS would still continue promoting their album if a member had just left. True, if someone left a seven-member group, it would be much more noticeable than if someone left a twelve-member group, but I’m keeping in mind that they still had booming sales and couldn’t do anything when THREE members left. If I had to ask a random person in the streets of any city in Korea a question about this matter, I would ask them, “Hey, you know that song ‘Growl?’” Their answer 90% of the time would be “yes.” But if I asked a random person on the street about “Hey, you know that song “Blood, Sweat, and Tears?” then there’s an 80% chance that they would know it. But that’s the current boy group. Internationally, I think that BlackPink is more popular. However, Twice is the real hit. They are freaking everywhere, and I’m starting to think that JYP doesn’t allow the girls to sleep. Like, at all. If you’re going to ask someone about K-pop, at least to a middle school boy, they will be like, “oh, you mean Twice?” I can count all of the variety shows that BlackPink has been on with my fingers. Like, they haven’t really done anything besides go to seven shows and release five songs. As for Twice, well… they may as well be insomniacs. That’s for the newest generation. Before EXO, it was SHINee, Super Junior, and Big Bang. Before those three, it was TVXQ. Before TVXQ, it was Sechskies and h.o.t. Seriously. Apparently, in the time of Sechskies and h.o.t., there were fan-wars that were nastier than today’s. Before Twice, it was SNSD. No question. SNSD’s sales were off the chart, and everyone knew about them. You don’t see that many 2NE1 or Twice or BlackPink diet secrets in the major Korean websites. You’ll see the IU diet, which is very well-known, and then the SNSD work-outs. And if it was 2010, you’d see a lot about T-ara. There were several groups that almost got popular and very possibly could have been huge. Loveliez, after ‘Ah-choo,’ were seriously a big hit, but the company didn’t manage them well and they died down pretty quickly. And get this: At one point, FT Island were a bigger hit than SNSD. But then their company, FNC Entertainment, kind of screwed them over by sending them to Japan too early and that made them lose pretty much all of their popularity in Korea. By the time they finished promoting in Japan, the Korean public forgot about them. However, Lee Hongki (main vocal) is gaining some headway nowadays. But before SNSD became super popular, Wonder Girls were the stars. “Irony” and “Tell Me” are two of their debut songs, and that caught the audience’s attention pretty quickly. Sohee’s “Omona!” was thing back then, just like how everyone had SNSD’s “Oh, oh, oh, oh,” as their ringtone when the Oh! album was released. And I haven’t done TVXQ enough justice here. h.o.t. and Shinhwa had just left the K-pop bandwagon when they debuted, so they were faced with many awaiting eyes, and they did rise. They did pretty everything everywhere after ‘Mirotic.’ Only up until the remaining two members drafted into the military did their popularity really die down. Yeah, they were met with some backlash after JYJ left SM, but not as hard as until they literally couldn’t do anything for two years. So right now: EXO, Twice Back then: Wonder Girls, TVXQ, Umm… still super popular but can’t put them in a label: SNSD, Big Bang Popular at their peak: SHINee, Super Junior, 2NE1, Brown Eyed Girls, KARA Were super popular but then died down after they disbanded or something: Sistar, IOI, FT Island, T-ara, Beast, 4Minute, Infinite, Miss A, 2pm, Girl’s Day (No kidding, Beast and Miss A were EVERYWHERE in 2010. People considered calling them legends right from their debut.) Upcoming legends that are too new or something to be on the list: BTS, Seventeen, GOT7, BlackPink, Wanna One, Red Velvet, GFriend, NU’EST Groups you think are popular but not as popular in Korea compared to overseas: f(x), NCT

This is not hard: TVXQ. They've got it all. (I have seen many K-POP groups including Wonder Girls, Girls' Generation, EXO, BTS, BoA, Super Junior, HyunA, GD & TOP, f(x), Red Velvet, and Junsu, Yoochun, and Changmin live -some of them even multiple times-, and have come to that conclusion.) No one in Kpop has beat them yet when it comes to being good in all important entertainment categories: Looks: without plastic surgery (!) like most other groups these days, they rose to fame in 2005~2008. Although Jaejoong has had a nose job when he left SM (2010), before that, they were all PS-free, and SM entertainment was even praised for it.Jaejoong in 2008 was called “The Prince of Asia” due to his superior looks and behaviour. His early stage name was Hero.  Yoochun (a.k.a. Micky):  Yunho (a.k.a. U-Know, the leader of TVXQ):  Junsu was called “Angel” because he was cute in person (even to male MCs), on TV and on moving pictures (photos are not good enough to show his cute side). His stage name is XIA:  Changmin (a.k.a. Max, the youngest):  Singing: TVXQ was known as the group with the harmonic voices that pulls off live performances so well that they sound even better than on CD. The best male signing idol group in K-Pop. Junsu and Jaejoong are regularly at no#1 and #2 on lists of best male voices in South Korea (judged by music experts). Changmin is also always in the top 10 of such lists.    XIA Junsu is a born singer (explanation: in the following video, he is sad because he is singing old Japanese hit songs of TVXQ in 2014 although he has left the group in 2010 together with Jaejoong and Yoochun with whom he created the trio JYJ):  Hero Jaejoong (the one in the center in the following two videos):    Max Changmin, the youngest one, is known as the high note champion in Kpop. He’s pulled off his high notes every single time and never misses them:   Micky Yoochun is famous for his husky voice:   Stage presence: During SM Town, A-Nation, MAMA, or any other joint concert, TVXQ owns the stage. They are so dominant, professional and eye-catching when you see them in person even if you don't know them. (I did not expect Changmin to wow me the most during SM Town 2015 in Osaka - he performed solo and beat out all other SM groups that night.) Compared to most groups nowadays, TVXQ sang live even though they had to dance too. They had very nice breathing techniques to keep that up.   (Try that, rookies of today!) Languages and the Japanese market: It is no secret that TVXQ and JYJ are still huge in Korea, China and especially in Japan. They sell out within seconds. JYJ does not even promote nor do marketing nor appear at music shows at all, and still sells out. These five are the Kpop group with the best Japanese language skills on average. While other groups didn't botter learning Japanese (looking at you, EXO), these five put in their little free time they had into properly learning it so that they could communicate with their Japanese fans. Yoochun is also fluent in English. (I can speak Japanese too.)Fame and Records: Before TVXQ and BoA, K-Pop was only popular in South Korea. Then, both expanded to Japan and China, and pathed and easened the way for many many groups to follow. Once they made it in Japan (=the second largest music market in the world), they made K-Pop mainstream in East Asia. Read more here TVXQ in Guinness World Record For the 2nd Time , and here Celebrating 10 Years of TVXQ in Japan: 10 Fun Facts You Didn't Know About Tohoshinki , and here Question: How popular were DBSK before they broke up? *this made me cry*Stalkers: I won't go into detail here since it's negative to have stalkers and not something to be praised for, but TVXQ had the worst stalkers ever of any East Asian group. Once Jaejoong asked G-Dragon in 2006/7 if Big Bang also had a problem with sasaengs, and GD answered with “What are sasaengs?”. This is a good read: Sasaeng Fans . Yunho even got poisoned once by an anti-fan! Musical: Junsu is the musical actor with the best ticket selling power in South Korea. Whenever he is acting in a musical, it sells out immediately. (When watching this video, mind that he did not have any plastic surgery ever!)  Drama: Yoochun and Jaejoong are one of the most famous South Korean actors. Yoochun has starred in hit-dramas like Rooftop Prince, Sungkyungkwang Scandal, Missing You, Three Days, and movies like Sea Fog and Lucid Dream. Jaejoong has starred in dramas like Protect the Boss, Triangle and SPY. Yoochun is very good at acting!Dance: even though they're ‘old’ compared to EXO or BTS, they have the advantage of having practiced for many years. Junsu and Yunho are excellent dancers.XIA Junsu:   U-Know Yunho:  U-Know Yunho from 2:00 onward:   U-Know Yunho and Max Changmin:  Discography: no one in K-Pop can beat TVXQ when it comes to the amount of high quality Korean and Japanese singles and albums released by them since their debut in 2005.Videography: same goes for the countless Japanese and Korean MVs, show appereances, drama starring and TVXQ's own shows. Quora is not enough to list everything, even I don't know it all.Collaborations: The five men have had many collaborations with other Korean and Japanese artists like:Koda Kumi  XIA Junsu & Big Bang Taeyang:  Max Changmin and Taeyeon (from 5:00 onward):  SMAP (TVXQ is wearing white clothes here, SMAP black):  Tablo  Flowsick  Super Junior, Dok2, or even Western artist like Quincy or Kanye West (although I disliked the latter one). Ayumi Hamasaki, the queen of J-Pop, is also a big fan of TVXQ (they're called Tohoshinki in Japanese).  If you don't know Ayumi Hamasaki, Koda Kumi or SMAP, that's a different topic. Genres: most groups only focus on one genre. TVXQ though is ballad, Pop, RnB, Rock, Rap, Musical…       Even if you may not like their songs, you can notice the diversity in styles and genres. Luxury, poverty and generosity: Jaejoong and Junsu come from really poor families. Although they're super-rich now (Junsu even built a hotel on Jeju Island), they never forgot where they come from. They've (sometimes secretly) donated many hundreds of thousands of ₩ to charity projets around the globe. The list is super-long: Charitable Contributions by JYJ and Fans .  Junsu also created FC Men, a soccer team composed of actors, singers, models and idols, that plays charity matches. He is the captain. Other (former) players include Seungri (Big Bang), Yoseob & Doojoon & Gikwang of BEAST, Kim Hyun Joong (SS501), Woohyun (INFINITE), and JUNO (Junsu's twin brother).  Personalities and friendship: TVXQ is known for their good personalities on and off-screen and for the friendship within the group which was not fake or “business only”. The five had split up in 2010, and have suffered from not being allowed to see each other because of SM Entertainment (long story…). They were like true brothers. I've actually only seen such a pure friendship in one other group: BTS. JYJ has even written songs for the remaining two TVXQ-members.  Jaejoong and Yoochun have huge tatoos on their bodies reading “TVXQ”. They never wanted to abandon the group and all three still love TVXQ to the core.   No other Kpop-group, no matter if BTS or EXO, has beat TVXQ yet. EXO had the chance to do so, but their popularity got damaged after some EXO members left SM for the same reason as JYJ. Maybe BTS will surpass them, who knows, BUT first they must heavily improve their live singing and further widen their discography and filmography. Then maybe, yes. If TVXQ were still five, they'd dominate today's YouTube Kpop-scene without a doubt. Enjoy~ _______________ P.S.: TVXQ was also the first K-Pop group to be featured in anime openings/endings.

Bangtan Soneyeondan or BTS is and (I believe) will remain as my favorite K-Pop band. :’)  But for me K-pop didn't start from BTS. Initially about 3 years back, I was introduced to Kpop and listened to SS501,Shinee,Big Bang,EXO etc. All of them were really cool and some of their songs still remain as my favorites. SS501’s “Because I’m Stupid” is really special to me because it was the first time that a song of completely different language touched my heart.Same with the songs of Big Bang and EXO-I loved listening to them but there was something missing.I felt some void in there even though I enjoyed to their tunes.And guess who filled that in? Of course BTS. I really do not want to sound cliche but BTS made me FEEL. I would become overwhelmed at their tunes, amazed at their lyrics and could literally feel my heart flowing with emotions. They struck chords at my heartstrings when no other kpop group could do. It was not “love at first sight”,but I got definitely victimized by their charm at first sight! My top favorite tracks are :Spring DayI need YouRunMagic ShopAnswerTeaching us to “Love Yourself”. The most endearing reason of why I support them and why I would fight for them. There has been lot of songs about heartbreaks,love,agony of parting,insomnia etc.But tell me how many are there where they teach you to love yourself?How many are there where they as you to discover your true honest self?How many are there that teach us to face our difficulties so that we can overcome them with all our might? One ,two?Very few to be precise. BTS concentrated on mental issues ,trauma,bullying and wrote the lyrics of their song breaking all societal dogmas.You’ve shown me I have reasons I should love myself I’ll answer with my breath, my path The me of yesterday, the me of today, the me of tomorrow (I’m learning how to love myself) With no exceptions, it’s all me Maybe there’s no answer Maybe this isn’t the answer either It’s just that loving myself Doesn’t require anyone else’s permission I’m looking for myself again But I don’t wanna die anymore Me, who used to be sad Me, who used to be hurt It’ll make me more beautiful Lyrics. They write lyrics straight from their hearts. You would feel a part them inside the tunes they sing. Most of the songs are written by Namjoon ,Suga and some by V. The song Magic Shop and Spring Day is too beautiful to exist.I will quote a part of Suga’s rap in Magic Shop: So I was always impatient and anxious Comparing myself became a daily thing My greed that used to be a weapon Became a prison and noose But looking back, to be honest I don’t think I wanted to be the best I wanted to be someone’s comfort I wanted to touch someone’s heart I want to take away your sadness, your pain. My heart races at this part. The song is totally about asking yourself to free those shackles of pain ad sorrow From nothing to achieving so much. Even after years it pains me to think that their debut stage wasn't their own and it was a replacement of someone else. They were constantly demotivated,constantly told to give up saying they wouldn't make it far. But look how far we came. :) I came across a picture yesterday of how BTS would sell free tickets in the beginning and now they get sold out within minutes.I could go on and on about them but I’ll stop right here. An Army.

Well I’m a bit confused with your question. But looking at others’ answers, I’ll just explain why I love my ultimate groups. Lezzgeddit Btw this is long 0u0 My ultimate group is NCT. NCT 127’s Regular got me into Kpop, and I officially started getting into NCT after hearing Kick It by NCT 127. Here are basic reasons why I love NCT so much: Amount of content. They have 4 subunits, so there’s going to be a lot of content. SM promotes NCT really well these days, with things like Aswaz and other “episodes” where the members play games and interact with each other. The number of songs they put out is also a lot because they promote separately in units.All-rounder group. NCT is undoubtedly one of the most all-rounded, if not THE most all-rounded, K-pop group out there. SM hit the jackpot with members like Mark, Taeyong, Haechan, Jaehyun, Ten, and more. Who are some of the most all-rounded idols in K-pop.Different = Special and Unique. NCT has this unique “unlimited member” concept. But it isn’t just that concept that is different. NCT 127 has concepts in songs like Cherry Bomb, Simon Says, Firetruck, etc. that no other group could possibly pull off. The 7th Sense by NCT U also has a complex concept that is neither cute, heavy, or sensual. It’s just what it is. NCT is not afraid to try new things and I like that about them.4 Kings of dance in one group. Taeyong, Ten, Mark, and Jisung are all very well-known outside of our fandom as 4 of the best dancers in K-pop. Self-explanatory.My second ultimate group is EXO. I got into EXO out of curiousity. I heard Love Shot early on when I started getting into Kpop, but never actually went farther than that. Based on my love for Love Shot, I decided to give EXO a shot. Monster was the real banger that made me love EXO so much. But here are basics: Vocals. I REPEAT. VOCALS. 3 of the best K-pop vocalists of all-time. Baekhyun, Chen, and D.O. But the group overall is very vocal based. All have achieved a certain level of vocal skill, it’s just some are better than others. Suho and Xiumin are also very talented vocalists. They have many vocal songs and members have individually participated in singing in OSTs and other vocal songs.Mr. Kim Jong In. Kai is known as one of the most charismatic dancers in the industry. When I first watched Love Shot, I thought he was the leader because of the charismatic vibes he gave off. I was shocked to learn that Suho was the leader, but now I couldn’t imagine anyone but Suho having the leader position. EXO SARANGHAJA!Their rap line is actually really good. I know EXO doesn’t have the most amazing rappers like Suga or Bobby, but surprisingly, Chanyeol auditioned to become a vocalist, and SM just decided to make him Main Rapper instead. He has trained so hard to make his rapping better, and I think it’s paid off! His raps in songs like Obsession and Monster are fire. Sehun is also a really great rapper! And so is Kai.They’ve gone through so much, but have pushed through. EXO has lost 3 members, Kris, Luhan, and Tao. Imagine the heartbreak all of the remaining members had to go through when one after another decided to leave. EXO is one of the groups with the most amount of Sasaengs. Multiple times, members have gotten hurt by fans. But you know what? They still put a smile on their face and tell us everything is OKAY. Baekhyun, Kai, and Chen have gotten loads of hate for being human. Baekhyun dated Taeyeon from SNSD in 2014. Even though Taeyeon got more hate than Baekhyun did, he still was hated on and told to leave the group. Kai dated Krystal from f(x) and Jennie from BlackPink and got tons of hate as well. Chen got married and had a daughter recently, and fans have asked for him to leave EXO. But what do they do? They smile and say they love us, when inside, they are clearly hurting. So please everyone. Love your idols, don’t hate on them for things humans do. Lay, the only remaining Chinese member of EXO, has also been asked by “fans” to leave EXO countless times. It truly breaks my heart that these people call themselves “fans”. They have gotten injured so many times. But they try not to show it to make fans not worry. They risked their lives for us. I know most groups have had a hard past, but EXO had really had the toughest time. If you want to learn more and in detail, I really loved Beth Eady’s answer on EXO hardships. So check her answer out here: What are the hardships EXO went through and what are the achievements they received?Anyways, sorry for the really long EXO answer. My third ultimate group is Stray Kids. I actually got into Stray Kids near the beginning of when I started liking K-pop. I specifically started really liking Stray Kids after listening to My Pace. Basics: So many good songs. Let me just list some of my favorites.My PaceDouble KnotGod’s MenuEasyHellevatorLevanterSlumpetc.Another all-rounded group. Han is a main vocalist and main rapper and could be a lead dancer in another group. Hyunjin is a lead rapper and main dancer. Bang Chan is a lead vocalist, rapper, and lead dancer. Felix is a rapper and lead dancer. Changbin is the main rapper and lead dancer material. Lee Know is a main dancer and vocalist. Seungmin is a main vocalist. IN is a lead vocalist. There you go.2 Rap Gods. Changbin and Han are two of my favorite rappers in K-pop. Flow, speed, tone, facials, you name it, they got it.Hyunjin is one of the best 4th gen dancer in my opinion. His facials and charisma is what really stands out to me. His powerful style of dancing is really fun to watch, and he can also pull off less powerful dances as well. You can watch his cover for when the party’s over by Billie Eilish here: Ok well hope you didn’t get too bored right lol 🌱 ~ stay green grasses ~ 🌱

Hm, well as someone who has only been into K-pop for about maybe 6 months, I would like to say that I do like different groups. (Mainly into Boy Groups though) I listen to a few of a certain group’s songs, and if I like enough of them, I will download ALL their songs onto my phone, and then listen to all of them. So they group’s songs have to have a nice impact on me to actually start stanning them. I also know personally that if I listen to songs to often then I WILL get bored of them no matter how good they are. So I am already into a few groups I’d say (Not too much though) so that I don’t get bored by any songs too quick BTS Of course, they were the group that brought me into K-pop. My friend introduced them to me, and being completely honest, I am a person who is very adaptable to different situations and all that, so I kinda forced myself to think that they were handsome (I mean, I thought they looked OK, I just wasn’t exactly like, DDAENG if you know what I mean *I hate myself rn lol*), and also kinda forced myself to like them, but then I listened to more of their songs and the lyrics and was touched. So yeah, that was pretty great. Now I love them so much and they impacted a good part of my life. iKON Omigosh, I LOVE these dorks. Many of their songs are more on the upbeat side, with a few exceptions of course, but their songs are beautiful and can brighten my day. And all these guys in this groups are hilarious and funny. A good way to see this is by their self-produced self TV show, iKON TV, which is AMAZING and HILARIOUS and let me get to see more of their personalities. Amazing dudes, all of them deserve to be in that group. (I’ve seen both of the survival shows they were in too, WIN: WHO IS NEXT, and Mix and Match) Pentagon All these 10 guys deserve so much. I do admit, I did join Universe (their fandom) after listening to their hit ‘Shine’ (a friend showed the song to me, and at the time, I was super picky about my Kpop songs, so I honestly only liked very few songs) and I thought it was great. After listening to more of their other songs, and seeing their more serious side of songs, I fell in love. Like on my goodness, their emotions and lyrics in some of their songs. Also, their use of Korean Culture references and stuff in their song “Naughty Boy’ makes it one of my favorite songs. (Actually I think it’s my favorite Kpop songs ever haha) Several of their Non-Title tracks are amazing too. These guys are pretty dorky and hilarious (I’ve been able to see from the couple shows I’ve seen them on). I just do feel a bit bad for the rest of the members, since a lot of people left their fandom because of the E’dawn and Hyuna scandal (Not really a scandal in MY, they just were dating, but it became a big thing, and hurt many members in the group). But I still stan all of the members because their videos/music is the ONLY music that will always brighten my mood, no matter how sad/depressed I am that day. And because they make me smile watching any Stray Kids I have been a fan of Stray Kids for a little less than a month by now, and can say that these dudes are worth stanning. I had already listened to a few of their songs, and I liked them, I just hadn’t bothered downloading them onto my phone yet (cuz I’m such a lazy bum bro, it’s shameful). Then, my friend got into them, and I was like, oh well, Imma download their songs onto my phone so I can hear all they do. Was that a good decision! Sure, they have adorable songs like Get Cool and Awkward Silence, but their songs also have some deep and touching meanings. Like Voices, Grow Up, and Hellevator. Those songs are so good, and make me want to cry, dang not something I want to do in public when I have my earbuds in. I’m surprised how hard they work for only being a rookie group. They released a pre debut album, which is really good, along with the rest of their albums. Also, all the members are super fun and hilarious, and get along so well. They’re really a family who love each other. NCT 127 Ok, this is probably the group on my favorites that I know the least amount of, but that doesn’t mean that I don’t like them less. I just barely got into NCT 127, and I like the energy of their songs. I have listened to all their songs, and while I haven’t read the translations of all their songs yet, A lot of their songs are catchy and make me happier I guess. I’ve seen some videos of them on shows (not too many tho) and they all seem very wild and happy together. I like the vibe of their group, which is why I decided to keep listening to their songs. I still need to get more into them haha. Blackpink Ok, being completely honest, I would technically say I’m INTO Blackpink, and sure, I LIKE their songs, and I can tell them all apart, their voices, and their songs are ok, but they aren’t exactly my favorite. I am putting them on my list tho, but when I said this wasn’t exactly in a certain order, but if they were, Blackpink would probably be the last on the list. I do think their songs are catchy and good, but they only have 9 songs… and I get bored of songs quick. So I listen to their songs sparingly on my phone. They seem like nice girls, but I don’t really watch to many videos or shows with them in it. Still, they’re pretty great. While those five groups are the ones I really got into, and love, there are other groups that I appreciate, and like a few of their songs. Dreamcatcher (dang I just love the songs i’ve listened to so far, and their horror concept is super different than usual girl groups I’ve listened to)Exo (I used to not really like Exo’s music, but they’ve really been growing on me, so yeah, I think I might try and stan them soon)Seventeen (Oof these guys are good at dancing, and seem fun. All the different songs I’ve heard from them, I’ve liked, so I think they’re next on my list to start to stan them)Oneus (This just newly debuted group caught my attention with their song Valkyrie. I’ve downloaded their debut album onto my phone, and all the songs are great.
