BTS are the kings right now, in general, no matter how many people hate that fact it’s true….enough said. Blackpink is the biggest gg popularity-wise, they're super cool and gorgeous. But from 3rd/4th generation, as many would argue and hate on me for saying this, but TWICE is the biggest gg in general and the only advantage Bp has over them is popularity but honestly that’s it. I know, I know, I am OBSESSED with Rv, Bp, Mamamoo, and AOA, believe me I AM, but I got to say Twice has the potential to go to an “IT” legendary gg level. Ig twice gets hated on (especially internationals)because people are so used to what they see on the media which is bp/bts/exo/etc., and when they see the opposite of that which is twice they’re like gross but honestly they’re the most hardworking and dedicated girls you can ever see. If only people were able to see the value that they have they’d understand and start to Stan them or respect what they do at least. Other groups are huge threats to them, they have soooooo much talent, i’m not downgrading them whatsoever, each one is unique and different in their own ways BUT Twice has this triple threat talent and potential to go for a really long time. Other groups can go huge and they will without a doubt because they trained hard for it, they're talented and deserve it but there’s something to each twice member that people hate on which is their Charisma. Twice has accomplished sooooo much WITHIN 3 YEARS and are still accomplishing, it’s almost scary when you really analyze things. I mean did people think SNSD would be huge within 3 years of their careers, no and some people hated on them because there’s always anti, but look at them now. People will try to hate on Twice for those same stupid reasons that they are really plain/boring/cringy/toocute/etc (which I call bullshit because their bg do the same and get no shit for it) and I get where you’re coming from because I used to think the same way but I say Fuck it I give credit when credit is due, they are the IT gg of their generation (and at their pace some would say of all generations because of their accomplishments, but thats a 50/50 chance, too early for me to tell). They need to open their eyes to the reality, they won't stop hearing from Twice anytime soon like at all, no matter how much they wish that happened. I DOUBT jype will let them go on a hiatus because if he has a chance to create a gg that can go legendary level like SNSD, S.E.S, Wonder girls, 2NE1, Apink, etc., he WON’T do the stupidest decision in kpop history of promoting them less or disbanding them anytime soon. And he knows it perfectly well because of the shocking accomplishments Twice has reached in such a short amount of time. He will of course keep making more groups even after Itzy but twice will always be there. I know i’m saying this now and things can change in matter of seconds because we don’t know the future but for now Twice is the biggest right now and will get bigger for sure. I get It when they say that they should change up a bit and tbfh I was already ughhh-ing their music 3 comebacks back but they STILL did awesome and they’re so loved. They just recently changed up a bit to a more mature style/concept first with yes or yes and now officially with Fancy and I got to say it’s already going amazing and I can tell that they are already stepping up their game. They showed what anti’s doubted and still doubt (at one point in the beginning even me) they had which is talent. It has to happen with any group sooner or later (unless you're themed/varied and don’t get hate on because of it like bts, exo, etc.) because people get bored of the same thing over and over again and if the concept change isn't as successful then that’s when you know a group won’t go as the biggest of the biggest because they’ll start to flop. And they did AMAZING, the only ones to disagree are of course the over sensitive and picky Anti but they did so great and it fit them veeeery well. I mostly loved how they changed and were still authentic to their Twice style. People think they changed because they're afraid Itzy would de-thrown them but honestly that happens to every gg when a new gg debuts to the company, it happened with SNSD when f(x) debuted and it happened with f(x) when Rv debuted and in other companies as well, because there’s always a change. Either way I think some people under appreciate Twice’s worth and talent and their personalities are just a cherry to add on top of everything that they do. I just wish them the best honestly and other gg too. sorry if this offended you, since I know everyone gets triggered especially in kpop quora questions.

PSA: This is just my opinion so please do not get offended if I do not mention your favorite group, but feel free to comment below. Let us be peaceful and avoid fan wars, okay? I think that it would be unfair to say the best K-Pop group, because every group is different, has had different experiences and hardships, and being under different agencies may or may not be in advantage to a certain extent. Disclaimer: It takes a lot of hard work and dedication to become a K-Pop idol so to say that a group or person is not good, okay, because they have endured more than you can probably imagine. PSA2: I didn’t really get into K-Pop until the 3rd Generation so I won’t include groups like After School, Orange Caramel, Rainbow, 2AM, 2PM, and Shinwa. I’m sorry, I’m sure these groups were amazing, but I do not feel comfortable writing about them since I do not know that much about them. I also will only mostly (or maybe all, we’ll just have to see how this turns out) have boy groups since I mostly listen to boy groups. Sorry if this offends anyone. It is not my intention to offend anyone. With that being said, here are my favorite K-Pop groups and soloists: Seventeen: Seventeen is a 13 member boy group under Pledis entertainment. Okay, so why is the name Seventeen when they have 13 members? Long story short they actually were planned to have 17 members when they were part of the Seventeen Project, a program where trainees were eliminated until they reached the final lineup (this is actually very common, but it is not a widely known fact since it is not usually broadcast. Think of it like a less glorified version of Produce 101). They have now said that 17 stands for 1 group + 13 members + 3 sub-units (Performance-Dance, Hiphop-Rap, and Vocal Units)=17 total. Okay but enough behind 17. These are just a few reasons why I love Seventeen. They are self-producing idols. This means that they write their own lyrics, compose their own songs, essentially producing their own music all by themselves (of course sometimes they collaborate with other producers) and they also choreograph their dances.The unit system is very neat and it allows for each unit to be featured, therefore allowing the group to be more efficient and showcase more of their talents.They have honest and good personalities. There’s not much I have to say about this but if you watch behind the scenes videos you can clearly see how much they love what they do and you can see that they are close as a group.They are so in sync! Seventeen is known for being the kings of synchronization with all of their dances as well as in real life sometimes by accident.They are diverse. They have members from China, Korea, and the United States.BTS: I almost didn’t include BTS in this list just because so many people know them, and I wanted to help spread recognition to those groups who have not gained quite as much fame, yet. But BTS was the group that really got me into K-Pop so I just couldn’t pass up the opportunity. BTS is a very well rounded group. They can act, sing, dance, and rap. They can do all of these well, too. They are also kind and supportive and care very much about their music, fans, and about each other. They are like a bunch of brothers.They produce all of their own songs. K-Pop is a very formulated industry so there actually is not a whole lot of room for creative freedom. BTS has gone against many of the standards even if it wasn’t the thing that would improve popularity (KBS has a habit of banning many things for some dumb reasons) .They are “rough” idols. Now, please don’t get offended when I say this, but BTS doesn’t fit the idol stereotype. They swear on camera and they don’t right about how everything is great, like the “perfect” idol group.They always acknowledge their fans, ARMY, first. At award shows they always thank ARMY before they give their acceptance speech. On their V-Live (a streaking app for idols), they have many iconic videos where they dedicate everything to ARMY or they worry about ARMY.Their leader, RM, learned English from watching the TV show, Friends. This isn’t really group related but it’s definitely cool and unique. I mean, who doesn’t love a good episode of Friends?EXO: Of course if I included BTS I have to include EXO, right? Haha please don’t compare or start fan wars (*cough cough* EXO-L and ARMY). They are both are different and amazing so they shouldn’t be compared. They are also good friends so how do you think it makes them feel when they are friends but their fans always war? Anyways here’s the list: Vocals. Okay, wow, EXO may have some of the best (or strongest) vocalists of a K-Pop group at the moment. Seriously, have you listened to EXO-CBX. Also don’t trod on Chanyeol’s vocals. Also those videos with CBX+D.O or Lu Han were gold. Even though he’s technically a rapper that man can really sing.Kai, Sehun, and Yixing are dancing machines! There’s not much I have to say about this since it’s pretty self explanatory, but yeah, they are so good at dancing.Their concept is based on a story line. This is one of my favorite parts about EXO. They debuted with a story line and have, for the most part, stuck with it all these years.They really are good at variety shows. I always find that their variety shows are super funny, whether as a whole group, in units, or solo, they always manage to make the day better through laughter.EXO Showtime was one of the best things that I have watched. When the OT12 were still together they filmed a show called EXO Showtime. It was to promote cooperation as a team and let the viewers get to know them better. This was around Wolf Era (one of my favorite songs by the way) so many of the activities they did were related to the song. During the show they went to a winter sports park, played a cooperation game, went to a haunted house, and much more!Day6: Okay, so Day6 is a 5 member boy BAND under JYP Entertainment. They used to have 6 members but now they have 5. I capitalized “band”, because they are a band. They don’t dance (oh boy, imagine Chicken Little dancing), but they play instruments and sing and rap. They often play light-rock and just have some pretty fresh and chill music overall. You should check out their weekly idol episode with N.Flying! They really put everything into their music. There are videos of them going around trying to find crickets at the park to record for one of their songs. They also used to have a comeback every single month. Now if that’s not impressive, I don’t know what is.They have diversity in their group. Jae, vocalist, rapper, and guitarist, was born in Argentina, but soon moved to California. Young K (Brian!), was born in South Korea, but went to High School in Canada. Jae also used to MC for After School Club.Their acoustic videos are amazing. They used to film videos while they ate dinner while they sang one of their recent songs using acoustic guitars. The drummer (and the maknae) would often make drums out of things he found on the table.Okay, now on to some less known groups, and soloists :) I won’t write very much on these because I feel like this post is getting too long and I don’t want to cut groups out. This does not mean these groups are any less than the one’s above! The Rose: This 4 member boy band has captured my heart from the beginning. They have such a unique style of singing and their videos are so stunning! Shaun: Shaun is a soloist who I hadn’t heard of until recently when he released his song “Way Back Home”. Now, I cannot stop listening to his songs. I highly recommend the song “Bad Habits”. Shaun breaks the stereotypes of the typical Idol singer because his is not Ulzzang (don’t roast me please). He has a powerful voice, though and he produces his own music. He was in the indie rock band Koxx and plays keyboard and DJs. Holland: Holland is the first openly gay kpop idol. He was kicked out of his company because he announced he was gay, so he started his own label so he could continue to make music. He has stunning music videos, and amazing music. K.Will: K.Will is a soloist who has been dubbed as “Prince of OST”. He often sings many of the OSTs for Korean Drama’s and is famous for his song “Please Don’t” (I won’t spoil it, but it is really good so please watch it!). Henry: Henry, a old member of Super Junior-M under SM Entertainment, is now a soloist. He was born in Canada and has Chinese ancestry. Before becoming a K-Pop artist, he was a violinist at Berklee College of Music in the United States. He is famous for his violin and piano skills, but he also sings and dances quite well. I highly recommend his OST, “It’s You”. He was also featured on the show “Always Cantare”. Benji of B.I.G.: BIG is a fantastic group, but I would like to focus in on Benji because I feel as if he is highly unique. Benji was from America and went to Julliard School of Music (one of the best music schools in the world) for violin performance. He was also on the show “Always Cantare”. He is famous for his violin covers of K-Pop songs. Honorable Mentions (Not in any particular order): AstroKNK365DaBand (Not K-Pop but V-Pop is pretty nice too)Erik (also V-Pop)Nine Percent (C-Pop)BtoBBlock BStray KidsThere are so many amazing idols these are just a few of them!

NCT 127.  I really love every single album they’ve put out. From Firetruck album to Neo Zone, there are so many songs that I love hearing and that just sound so new and interesting when I was exploring different artists discographies from so many different backgrounds and cultures. I was introduced to K-Pop in 2017, and of course while we had the huge groups like BTS and EXO that many people have heard of—even if they don’t like K-Pop—there were so many other great groups that were just hidden under the surface, and NCT 127 was one of them. They debuted in 2016, and in 2017, I listened to Firetruck—one of the first K-pop songs I had ever heard. I checked out their other two title tracks, Limitless and Cherry Bomb and I really loved their style and the way their music was structured.  NCT 127’s concept is a ‘neozone’ concept, and I really think that they portray it very well in their songs—most specifically their titles.  Cherry Bomb is an almost 5 minute song that dives in and out of so many genres, it goes from being synth-pop to heavy bass, slips into a quick R&B section, before having an electronic dance break instrumental in the latter half of the song. It’s so interesting, complex, and has so many layers to the song that it’s never a boring listen when I put it on.  One of their newer comebacks, Punch is also super interesting music-wise. It starts off with this video-game sound for around 15–20 seconds before going straight into a hype chorus and then into a rap verse. The structure of the song is also really different and the first time you listen to it you would be surprised at every turn the song takes, and it might take a few listens before you even fully comprehend what the song is even constructed of. All in all, Punch is another amazing song that really fits their neozone concept, without being overdone or repetitive.  Lastly, I want to talk about Superhuman. Superhuman is a song released in 2019 and is an amazing sci-fi electro-dancepop song with really gritty EDM and a catchy chorus. Everytime I’ve listened to an NCT title song, I have never said “oh this sounds like a song I’ve heard before” because it all sounds so new and fresh. Especially Superhuman. It starts out with harmonies before having really glitchy sound effects and the verses are all really slow and nice on the ears. However, the chorus takes it to another level and the drop is so satisfying to hear every time.  One of my favorite American artists of all time is Twenty One Pilots and NCT 127 really reminds me of their discography. Twenty One Pilots songs can take so many twists and turns just from the verses to chorus and I always find it really stimulating and interesting to listen to. I hope to always find new and interesting songs to hear so that I will never be bored while listening, and right now NCT 127 is doing just that. I love it. From the stars, Dawn. Songs Mentioned: Cherry Bomb, Punch, Superhuman

I don’t just like K-pop, I love it. I also love a bunch of groups. Bare with me, as this answer will be pretty long lol Boy Groups: BTS: The first boy group I ever stanned. I got into them after their win at the BBMAs, despite listening to Dope for the first time two years earlier. (Can you believe that i thought they were generic back then? LMAO) I’m glad to have gotten into them, though, for a myriad of reasons. They as a group are all very talented individuals, from their vocal line (Jimin and Jungkook sing beautifully, and so does Jin, when they bother to give him lines.) to their dance and rap lines (chock-full of rapping and dancing talent, especially on my boy Hoseok’s end) , they’ve got it all. Granted, they may not be as vocally qualified as EXO, but that doesn’t mean that they’re bad in the slightest. Aside from having a great amount of talent, all of he boys are so handsome and funny. I may not be directly attracted to them, but that won’t stop me from saying that I think they’re gorgeous. (Especially Jin, aka Worldwide Handsome) I mean, look at this.  Jung Hoseok/ J-Hope/ Hobi, age 24. Member of Rap and Dance lines.  Kim Taehyung/V/Tae, age 22. Member of the Vocal line.  Park Jimin, 22, Member of the Vocal and Dance lines.  Jeon Jungkook, 20, Member of the Vocal and Dance Lines.  Min Yoongi/Suga, 25, member of the Rap Line.  Kim Seokjin/Jin, 25, member of the Vocal Line.  Kim Namjoon/RM, 23, member of the Rap line. Did you feel your soul leaving your body when you looked at those photos? Because I sure did. For more of these gorgeous photos, you can follow their many fansites on Twitter, as well as their main account (BTS_TWT), where you can find many high quality selfies and other things such as music recs from everyone in the group. You can get a direct taste of their humor by watching their Bangtan Bombs and V-Lives. They love to laugh and are quite hyper 90% of the time, just about every time they get together they have loads of fun. I don’t recommend watching the old Bangtan Bombs, though, because many nasty, overused jokes have spawned from them. (i.e. You got no jams) Aside from their group lives, each of the members has solo ones in which they talk to fans themselves, about music, life, and anything else, sometimes even getting visited from other members while they broadcast. For the other sides of their personality, you can watch the older and most recent episodes of Run BTS, as well as the upcoming Youtube Red series Burn The Stage. The last reason why I admire them is for the amazing things they have achieved in this past year, along with their help to spread K-pop to the U.S. Just yesterday, it was confirmed that Big Hit Entertainment is bigger than all of the top three entertainment companies in South Korea, the acclaimed SM, YG, and JYP entertainment companies. They have broken incredible sales records with their most recent album, Love Yourself: Her selling over 1.4 million copies, breaking the record of 1.2 million albums sold after h.o.t. held the record for 16 years. They have partnered with UNICEF to create a campaign titled Love Myself, whose main focus is to eradicate violence towards children and teens. They have had various TV appearances on American televison, from the Late Late Show with James Corden to Dick Clark’s Rockin New Years Eve. They are truly icons in every aspect of the word, as they have done so much for the K-pop industry and for their beloved ARMY as well. They love us as much as we love them, and they constantly thank us for our support and work their hardest so that they don’t make us disappointed. I made that explanation of BTS much longer than planned, lol. I’m just going to do a short list for each group I mention now, because there are too many to count and do huge picture-lists for. I’m going to skip over the other two boy groups I like too, because I don’t know enough about them to say anything substantial. The Girl Groups I Like Are: SNSD: My queens, my leading ladies, my number 1 group. They are the group that got me into K-pop, the first group I ever stanned, the group where I found my first bias and a birthday twin, and the first group whose songs truly stuck with me throughout all these years. All of the members (including Sica), are gorgeous and extremely talented, having some of the best female vocals in K-pop along with awesome, memorable choreography. Interesting concepts are plenty with this group, as they can pull off any type of song, from cutesy and bubblegum-poppy, to classy and sexy, to heavy and dark. Their visuals are no joke, and they can melt the hearts of fans of any gender with their beauty. They are hilarious and very talented at hosting variety shows and events, and have been likened to Super Junior with their skills at MCing. However, I wasn’t around for the majority of SNSD’s careers, because I was a dumb child who never learned how to follow a group’s activities. (Maybe I should be easier on myself about this because I was only 8–10 years old around those years, but I still feel like I missed everything important with them.) I was absent when Jessica made her departure, I was absent for most of their tours, I was absent for the majority of their TV appearances and comebacks (minus Mr. Mr., which I bought the day it was released.) I missed many things from pre-2013 as well, because I was a toddler/young child when they first debuted in 2007 and only started to like them in 2013. I never saw the interviews and behind-the-scenes things that I missed, or footage from the main parts of their tours. I feel incredibly guilty about this to this day. It seems like I lack so much knowledge compared to other SONEs. Sometimes I feel like I shouldn’t even call myself a SONE. Maybe I shouldn’t be a SONE. Regardless of if I should or not, I will still continue to love and cherish SNSD until the day I die. The day they disband will be one of the darkest days of my life, and you best believe I won’t be leaving my room for a few days after. I love them too much to see them break up, but I have been forcing myself to prepare for that day ever since Holiday Night came out. All we can do is wait and see, and support each other as fellow SONES when that day does come. (another long explanation whoops) Okay, they’ll seriously be short now. Red Velvet- Vocals and visuals. Wendy despite being problematic sings really well, as well as Seulgi and Irene. Everyone in the group is very pretty, especially Joy to me. (Formerly Wendy was my bias, I mentioned that on another question as well as the fact that I don’t have anyone else to Ult. I don’t want to enable her by saying any more good things about her, because I’m still angry about her most recent stunt she pulled) Twice- Lacking in vocals but are very pretty. They also get along really well and are interesting and funny to watch. Their semi-gay interactions also appeal to me, as a really lonely person, and I wish that I had someone like Sana to give me the affection I so crave. BlackPink- I love their dancing and style, even if it’s only like that because YG is trying to make them into mini 2NE1. Their vocals are alright, better than Twice but worse than RV. Do like their voices though. KARA- Got into them about a month ago, can proudly say that they’re the only group that I’ve loved more than three B-Sides from. Almost every song on their albums is good, and to top it all off, they’re gorgeous. Wish they would come back someday. After School- Same situation as KARA, got into them around two months ago. Learned to love their music, especially their Japanese stuff, and I now proudly support anyone who is in favor of burning down Pledis Entertainment to set them free. (Seriously though, screw Pledis for ditching them.) Girls Day- Not very big into them, but I love their concepts and MVs, especially Darling and Something’s. Minah is an awesome vocalist as well, and her high notes always stun me. Not to mention that everyone in the group is pretty, too. Weki Meki- They may be new but they have lots of potential. IDLYG was on repeat for a week after it released, and I began to love them since. Yoojung and Doyeon are triple threats, each being very talented in rapping, singing and dancing. But what else would you expect from the former Produce 101 winners/ IOI members? I do think the other members should get more attention though. Orange Caramel- they may be a subunit of After School, but they’re the whole reason I know about the group in the first place. They prove that they don’t have to be sexy to a successful group, as more of their stuff leans on the cutesy side but is still extremely popular. (I.E. Catallena) I fell in love with Raina after seeing her for the first time, and Nana and Lizzy are also high on my list of hottest girl group members. I love Lizzy’s sweet-sounding voice very much. This group is why I love people who are named Raina, and what I think of every time I encounter someone who is called that. AOA- Not huge on this group tbh, but I do find myself bopping along to a lot of their songs, especially Elvis and Good Luck. I always say the “prince” in Jimin’s rap part in the song, it’s become a habit. The lifeguard concept for GL was one of the best they ever had and they looked so hot in their teaser pics. I’m still sad over Choa’s departure, though, because she was my bias. Hopefully Yuna or Mina will pick up where she left off in their next comeback. Sistar- Another group out of the many that I got into after disbandment. Everyone in Sistar is very talented, especially Hyorin. She can, rap, dance, and sing very well, on top of looking like a supermodel. I’m also extremely proud of her for creating her own agency. Can’t wait till she debuts her first artist :D And so that I don’t leave anyone in Sistar out, I want to tell you all that they are some of the most beautiful K-pop idols I’ve ever seen, and their songs will definitely make you long for the summer. Wonder Girls- Yet another group I started to like after disbandment. I don’t have a bias in the group yet, in fact I don’t really even follow Sunmi anymore. But I do love their music, even the English versions of their songs, which are iconic regardless of languages. I also love the video for Like This, as it looks like it would have been really fun to be a part of it, dancing with the Wonder Girls in a giant flashmob. 2NE1- I never stanned them back in the day, and never quite found it appropriate to call myself a blackjack despite how much I listen to them. However, Come Back Home is featured heavily in my music rotations, as is Gotta Be You and Can’t Nobody. They were another one of the most important girl groups in K-pop history, running the show alongside SNSD and WG for most of the early 2010s. Because of that, they have much of my respect. F(x)- I only got into them after listening to Electric Shock a few years back. I didn’t follow them much or stan them hard, still don’t, but as of recent I’ve been listening to the Pink Tape and missing them. I finally realized how many good B-sides I missed out on, such as Pretty Girl, Step, and Kick, years after they were released. Aside from them as a group, I admire Amber very much for dressing like a tomboy in an industry full of cute/girly idols , and expressing herself the way she wants without letting haters get her down. Her solo work is also really impressive, and her most recent track with Luna was a bop. EXID- Vocal capabilities in this group are awesome. Solji, even though she’s on hiatus now, sings some of the best and most memorable notes I’ve ever heard in K-pop songs. Hani is another really good singer, and LE’s rapping is quite good too. Hyerin is my bias because she’s cute and funny+ she can sing, and Junghwa is second to her for similar reasons. G-Friend- This group is practically perfect. They have angelic voices, can dance almost flawlessly to their songs no matter the speed, and are funny on top of that. Everyone in the group is absolutely adorable, especially Umji, who shares a birthday with my mom. <3 I find it cool that she knows some English, too, and the video of her ordering McDonalds for the group baffles me every time. ( I could never remember so many orders, much less recite them as perfectly as she did) BESTie- I’m still angry over Dahye and UJi’s departure a few months ago, as they were my biases from the group. But that doesn’t erase the fact that I listened to Excuse Me over 500 times last year, making it one of my most played songs on Spotify. I would have more to say on the group if they had stayed, because when those two left, they lost their main visual components and two of their most talented members. Hyeyeon and Haeryung are still two talented girls, but I wonder what will happen to them now that they lost half of their group. GLAM- A sad case of what happens when a group gets underpaid. I never quite liked GLAM because of the Dahee scandal, which I knew about even back in my Vocaloid phase (in case u didn’t know, Dahee voiced the Korean Vocaloid SeeU prior to the scandal and her arrest, GLAM even had her on stage at some of their concerts before disbanding) and caused me to be wary of them. I changed my opinion on them after stumbling upon the video for “In Front of the Mirror” while looking for empowering K-pop songs.I found that the meaning behind the song and the lyrics was something I could really relate to, and I’ve liked them ever since. Their other songs showcase lots of unused potential, specifically Party XXO. Let me say now, as my final note, that Bang Shihyuk really could have made them big if Dahee hadn’t screwed up. These are just a few of the GGs I like, and there are loaaaads more. (Comment if you want to know them and I’ll either add them in later or tell you in a reply!) Sorry for the long answers like usual, but I need to get my thoughts out in the way I see fit, which is writing a lot. Nonetheless, I hope you guys enjoy his list and that maybe some of you become a new fan of these groups. :)

I’m going to do a male/female combined stan list (and why I adore them). ATEEZ: I don’t really know the idols themselves but god, do I love their discography. It’s such a different taste to me but I LOVE it. Probably my favourite all rounded kpop discography, so these buys have the capacity to shoot up to number one. No bias’s yet but these boys are really shining.  IZ*ONE: These girls honestly are so sweet and I got so attached to all of them during Produce 48. I was near distraight hearing they mightn’t promote because of the Mnet rigging saga. I love their concepts and I just melt when they perform. I’ve loved the more badass covers and honestly I just milk up every bit of content they put out. I always get way too attached to temporary groups and I’ll be so sad when they disband, but honestly the stuff they’ve released makes up for it. The teasers for BLOOM*IZ look so good and I’m super excited for the release.  My bias in IZ*ONE is the one and only Miyawaki Sakura. God when I first saw her, her visuals hit me like a truck and as a straight female, I’m proud to say it. She is genuinely kind, polite and sweet. She’s up front and voices her insecurites. She puts everything into improving herself and I admire her so much. I’m not going to be that person that says she would be a better center then Wonyoung (who’s also a queen) - (but she sort of would have been).  EXO: One of my groups whose music I adore, but I haven’t fully gotten into the idols themselves. Honestly their vocal line hurts me when they sing they’re so good, but the acapella in Tempo literally hit me in 400 different places at the same time. I have so much respect for the group and what they’ve been through and the place in the industry.  My Bias(s): Chen and Xiumin. I maintain that Chen is one of the hottest idols in the industry in that simple, smooth way. His voice is my dream and everything I aspire to be. His fiancee jackpotted there, and I’m sure he did as well. I wish him good health for his family. I hope he takes a break when the child is born to care for them and get to know them. Xiumin had my heart from KoKoBop. I don’t know why but he just stuck out to me as hilarious, very polite and gentlemanly and very in touch with his masculine side (wow I sound like a creep lol). Love him, all the best for his military duties.   Everglow: Honestly these girls have such sweet personalities I adore all of them. There music was fantastic from the get go and I can't wait to hear more from them. There’s not much content out yet but they have the capacity to be one of the biggest girl groups - I hope they get the right promotions and directing.  Bias: Yiren. Don’t know why but I’m very drawn to her personality and I relate to her a lot. She has a really unique visual and I don’t know she’s really talented and I just love her.  Blackpink: Well I swear I’ve biased every one of these girls at one point and I’ve just accepted that I’m an OT4 stan, I love them all. I really like their music to listen to casually and there title tracks are such power anthems. At this point it’s ridiculous with there comeback all we’ve gotten is Awesome Screen, Awesome Camera, Long Lasting Battery Life. And I doubt we’ll get much more for a far amount of time. The girls are clearly not enjoying themselves so I’m glad they have such a tight bond.  TWICE (ULT GG): I could write an essay on each member alone but these girls… Every single one of them has a special place in my heart. They’ve been through so much together and they’re still so loyal to each other and show so much love towards us Once’s. They aren;t the most talented but together they have worked so much to improve there skills and they have one of the best dance all rounders, visuals in every member, absolutely gorgeous voices and some very talented rappers. I hope they keep producing music they enjoy and are comfortable with. The girls never fail to put a smile on my face. I’ll support them no matter what, they’re entitled to love, health and happiness just as much as anyone else.  Bias(s): Jihyo (ULT), Tzuyu, Mina and Sana. Jihyo is perfect to me, I respect her, her attitude and commitment so much and she’s my biggest role model.  Tzuyu’s personality I relate to on a cosmic level, reserved but hilarious (I like to think I’m funny but my friends would disagree lol) and her visuals are god tier. She’s improved so much since debut and really showed the general public her talent and her drive to succeed and accomplish her dreams.  Mina has just struck me as someone who I wish I could be, so likeable and friendly but also quiet and humble. She is the epitome of elegant and I relay hope she’s feeling better and is taking as much time as she needs to recover.  Sana is rising higher and higher every moment and she’s bias wrecking me as a bias. She’s seems so genuine and friendly. No Sana No life tbh.  BTS (ULTs): I swear these boys just hit different for me. They’re more then just kpop idols. Without them and their music, personalities and Love Yourself campaign, I’d still be in a very bad place. I honestly think these boys were fated to meet. They have the strongest bond with each other and the personalities contrast so well to create the perfect group. They are managed really well and they are so honest and sincere towards their fans and most importantly, themselves. Like Twice, I could right essays on each of them and honestly I’m such an OT7.  Bias (ULT): V. I’ve said it before but I’ll say it again. My ideal type. At the risk of sounding like a creep for the 10th time, I’m very attracted to his personality and his attitude. Very free spirited and sweet but not afraid to show his emotions as anyone should be. I’ll save you the time of having to read it but he’ll always have my heart.  Thanks for reading if you made it this far :)

I stan quite a few. Around like 8 I think. I’ll name them off and give two reasons! Twice- These girls are rays of sunshine seriously. Their music isn’t girl crushy which I find cool because it’s such a big genre now, but it’s more bubblegum poppy (?). All of the girls are so caring and talented and that really shows through their hard work.  Blackpink- I know, controversial. Yes I stan all of the big three and have no issues. All four of the girls in Blackpink have such bright and amazing personalities. I have never ONCE seen any of them be rude. I know they love music, but unfortunately their company is holding them back because they could do sooooo well internationally.  Red Velvet- I mean what’s seriously not to love about these girls. They all work so well together and I’m always so attracted to their interviews because they just make me laugh. While I’ve heard their rap line is weak, I personally think Irene and Yeri are good rappers and they’re all good vocalist.  Mamamoo- seriously once you watch one mamamoo thing, you fall into a hole. I could go on and on about these girls. First off, they break most forms of standards in Korea. From Hwasa not changing her body, to Solar ripping off her shirt, to Moonbyul advocating for LGBTQ+ and Wheein not changing her ideas, they’re amazing. Also their vocals and rap are seriously no joke.  Iz*one- I would say that they’re underrated, but I also don’t know where they stand in popularity. They’ve had two comebacks since debut and honestly, I’ve loved and spent hours gushing over them. All their songs are just so good. They have a lot of cute songs and a lot of badass songs. With there being 12 members, it allows for so much talent in dancing, singing and rapping. Oh and VISUALS.  Itzy- They won rookie of the year for a reason. These girls are so new to the industry yet they’re taking it by storm. They aren’t afraid to show their true passion and even though they’re a bit hesitant because they’re still building a reputation, I can’t help but fall in love with them. I really admire them for having songs that don’t really fit in a category (it must be a JYP thing). They are also AMAZING dancers. Stan the Chae sisters.  BTS- okay so I knew they were huge and I didn’t really stan them until I had stanned all the groups listed before this. The versatility in the group is what makes them so entertaining and talented. I mean they are so advanced in all forms of music. On top of that, they have such a good bond that they don’t need to be fake even when they were taking America by storm. I really truly love their personalities.  Stray kids- People who are into BTS I feel would really like stray kids. They give me a similar vibe to BTS even though they’re completely different. I was originally attracted to their dance but ended up falling in love with their personality. They are all so hilarious and just work well together. Also their vocals, rap, and definitely dance are so good. I would put them up there in talent along side BTS for boy groups.  Solo- I stan a few solo artists too that I thought I would mention quickly. I stan Chunga, Somi, AleXa, Taeyeon and Jessica (SNSD), Sunmi and Hyuna. Obviously I’m more of a girl group kind of girl. To anyone new to kpop I would recommend all of these groups. I personally ignore the controversy surrounding stanning multiple groups and just follow what I love. Yes it is possible to stan Blackpink, Twice and Red Velvet all at the same time. I’m just happy with the 8 groups and have been getting into Loona, Everglow, and Got7 lately.

I am a diehard fan of SHINee. To me, they are the ultimate KPOP band. And I said to me. They have it all: vocals, visuals, talents …TAEMIN. Each member can stand on his own. Their solo work proves it. ONEW  Go listen to his version of Rainy Blue. I never get over how beautifully he sings that song. JONGHYUN  His solo work speaks for itself: albums, Radio show, SNL… Two of my favorite songs of his are: SKELETON FLOWER and WARM WINTER. May he Rest In Peace. He is gone but never forgotten. 5HINee, always five members. KEY  Savage. That’s all I am going to say. “Watch out, babe”. MINHO  I just love the way he raps. It’s so cute and always so smooth. I am not saying he is the best rapper. I am just saying that I love the way he does it. And I love his acting. When he is done being an idol, he has something else to fall back on. TAEMIN  Need I say more? The boy is KPOP. There is no KPOP without TAEMIN. PeriodT. His skills are unmatched. Just look at him. Aren’t you entranced? He is 2nd, 3rd and 4th generation of KPOP. The boy got it. MY FAVORITE KPOP BAND! They don’t have a concept. They are the WHOLE CONCEPT. Their music is always bright and preppy and it makes me happy. Whenever I need a pick me up, I listen to them. That’s fine if you don’t like them but don’t say anything disrespectful under my answer. Go write your own about your favorite KPOP band.

Thanks for the request. Since I can’t choose just one group, I’ll be listing a few, though I’m more into boy groups. In terms of girl groups, I adore Red Velvet. Red Velvet is the type of group where you’re never bored with their songs because of the sheer versatility. For me, the songs that I like of a group are just as important as the group chemistry and the connection I have with them (I’ll be getting into this more later). Red Velvet has almost anything you can name of any concept - the differences in theme with their songs Ice Cream Cake, Rookie, Bad Boy, Butterflies, One of These Nights, and Peek-A-Boo are all so different and they have an incredible creative streak with their music videos, which have storylines and plots that you don’t see in any other mainstream group. The members themselves are all very well-rounded and talented, and they’re all sweethearts. I don’t consider myself a Reveluv because I’m not as interested in them as I think I should be for it to be fair to say that I’m a fan, but I definitely support them and I love all their songs.  Seulgi is my bias, who’s yours?  This isn’t really a girl or a boy group, but it’s a sibling duet! Akdong Musician is such a well-loved group within South Korea but they don’t have much of an international following and I wish more people could find their lyrics. They’re all written and composed solely by Lee Chan-Hyuk (the older brother), and Suhyun (the younger sister) has one of the most beautiful voices in the industry. These two are just so talented and lovely and they have such good songs, a few being Dinosaur, Melted (I truly recommend this, it has incredible meaning and lyrics and the song itself is just breathtaking), and Re-Bye.   Now boy groups. There are two that pop out to me. BTS. People reading this may actually be surprised if they’ve seen me on Quora before, but BTS was the first group that got me into K-Pop and will always remain a special group in my heart. They brought me into this world of creativity and talent beyond what I’d imagined of my own country. They were the inspirations behind my life for months. I still adore the members and respect all of them so much for everything they’ve ever been through and I wish them the best in all their endeavors. BTS is well known for their underdog story and the message behind their songs in their earlier years in songs such as Not Today, N.O., and Save Me, but what I actually like the most about them is their resilience and their good natures. With an industry as brutal as the one they’ve risen in, it would have been easy to rely solely on common mainstream ideas to gain popularity, but they didn’t do that. They stuck with their ideas, their lyrics, and their emotions throughout their entire careers (save a few songs) and I love that about them so much. Taehyung, who was my first bias in BTS, is such a sweet, bubbly person. Jimin and Hoseok are amazing dancers that inspire me to work harder, dance harder, dream bigger. I love Jin to death and I wish people could see his talent more. His vocal teacher adores him because according to him, Jin improves with every single lesson. Namjoon will forever be the suffering father and leader of the group, but I adore his efforts for BTS and the other members. Yoongi has touched me so deeply with a lot of what he has written and never fails to surprise me with what he does. And Jungkook is the golden maknae who can truly do anything he sets his mind to. Anyone that’s read all this may wonder why I’ve left the fandom, but it’s simply because I lost interest in their music. It isn’t because of their Love Yourself series, which, unlike what a lot of other people seemed to think, did actually have a rather deep message and was as emotionally charged as their other albums. It was more just the songs themselves. I need a good melody to keep interest in a song. It’s why I especially prefer songs that have a great vocal climax - because I keep coming back to it and I never get bored. My musical tastes have also changed over the years, and that’s something that I can’t control, no matter how much I love these boys. I wish them the best in all they do, and I’ll continue to watch them from the sidelines with a proud smile on my face. Hoseok is my baby, feel free to comment your own bias or scream about him with me :)   EXO. My ultimate group until, hopefully - my last breath. I just. I love them to death. I found out about them, ironically, from a bunch of ARMYs and EXO-Ls that were fighting in the comments section in another video. I didn’t pay mind to it in the beginning, but then I saw Chen singing Tears by So Chan-Whee in its original female key (which is already really hard itself) and I was awestruck. His vocals were a gift from the gods and I would like to fight anyone that disagrees. After I found out about Jongdae, I started looking for other members. Baekhyun, I would like to add, also has one of the best voices I’ve heard as a K-Pop fan so far and every note he sang seemed to fall from an angel’s lips. Kyungsoo, too. Jongin is voted year after year by other idols to be the best active dancer in the industry and it’s quite easy to see why. Yixing composes, writes, translates, and produces all his solos and he’s such a powerful dancer. Chanyeol, as a main rapper, composes, writes, sings, and plays at least three different instruments. This group was just so talented and I couldn’t believe I hadn’t fallen for them before. And then I learned about them, as a group. As idols. As brothers. So many people say that EXO has a superficial relationship, that they’re not as close as other groups tend to act on camera. However, the lack of fake skinship doesn’t mean they aren’t close. Chanyeol drove Baekhyun on a trip that lasted hours to his concert on his free day on his own time. Jongdae and Minseok are so close because they were the only two Korean members in China. Kyungsoo cooks for Sehun often because Sehun has particular tastes. Chanyeol buys a lot of things for all the members. Yixing always promotes them in other countries when he can’t perform with them. They’ve been through so much. They were called SM’s worst mistakes for a whole year after they debuted. The entire industry seemed to be out for them. Even after the hate died down, they were accused of being carbon copies of Super Junior and nothing they did appeased the Korean public. Three of their members left early, leaving some members without their best friends and confidantes, Baekhyun and Taeyeon were torn by the media and supposed fans for a scandal that wasn’t even a scandal, really - and they suffered through so much shit over their idol lives that I just want to wrap them up in blankets and see them happy. EXO’s songs are also just a treat in general. They’ve done ballads like Lights Out and Universe, to electric beats like KoKoBop, hard rock with Drop That (and Chen’s incredible high note), as well as the pure and happy song that was Power, and then songs like Tempo that had a freaking acapella bridge in the middle of it? And then they released Promise, which was written entirely by Chen and Chanyeol, co-composed by Lay. It holds so much emotion and it has such a powerful message within the lyrics. Their songs never bore me and I always end up crawling back to them. They have every type of song to fit my every single mood and I just love that about them. Their versatility knows no bounds. I love them for all they’ve done, all they’ve been through, and all they will continue to do. I love all the members (I have no bias, really), and my short term goal in life is to see them live, because I really just want to hear their god-like voices through something more than a computer screen.   A special mention that I just couldn’t leave out: TVXQ and Super Junior. These groups are both so talented with all their members, and they’ve also been through so much within their times as idols, but they’ve thrived and they are now both known as legends in the industry. My TVXQ bias is Changmin, my Super Junior bias goes between Leeteuk and Eunhyuk. I’m sorry I can’t write more about them but I’m just so tired.  (Super Junior above, TVXQ below)  Thank you for reading!

I'm not that much of a multi-stan but I'm making a list mostly based on my music preferences and looks(not visuals but the kind of vibe they give off) 10. Red Velvet:When I first saw red velvet they gave off this dark mysterious vibe which attracted me b/c most of gg have that cute sweet image, I'm not saying there's something wrong with it but it's just not my style. Sf9:I first fell in love with them after listening to' O sole mio'….that song of theirs is just *chef's kiss*. Their rappers are really great but the fact that they are 9 kind of kept me from getting interested in knowing them besides their music. For me 7+ member in a group is just too many.  8. Blackpink:Queens of gg's, but their recent comeback just wasn't my taste at all. But visually and vocally they are good and I really like the music they make, I love when they do that bad bitch style like they did in 'kill this love'. They rock every concept they do. My favourite member is Rosé.  7. Stray kids:A fun fact: I followed them on Instagram without knowing what/who they were. I just followed because I liked the name, I thought it was unique and cool. So when I listened to hellavator for the first time I was like wait these guys look familiar XD.  Yes after that I started listening to their music and fell in love with some of their songs, side effects, my pace being ones on the list. 6. Mamamoo:Like their vocals so much. My favourite songs of theirs are, starry night, Hwasa's Maria, gogobebe and a few more.  5. Monsta x:F***ing love their voices and like all of their songs that I listened to up until now. Favourites are play it cool, follow, and literally the whole album that was in English (sorry can't remember the name). Although I am not into them besides music but I was genuinely sad when Wonho left.  4. Day6:Day6 have the music style that you want at the end of a hard day. Their music just relaxes you, and right up my alley. Also they are super talented and underrated.  3. JJP:Yes, this needs a separate mention. JJP also known as JJ project is a subunit of two of got7's members, but since they existed way before got7 I think they have their own identity. Their album Verse2 is a blessing to the world which most haven't even discovered yet. All of their songs are so serene and beautiful, written, composed and sung with so much love. All of the songs have their own vibe to it. My favourite song from that album is 'Coming home'. I still remember myself gasping while listening to the chorus of that song for the first time. I just hope they comeback soon.  Did I mention that the aesthetics of the album are on another level!? 2. Jus2:Just2 also a subunit of got7 but have a completely separate identity. Jus2 is comparitively new(debuted in 2019). Their first (and only album up until now) Focus is literally so underrated in my opinion because this album is THAT bitch that makes you want to dress up sexily and dance on your own at two in the morning.  Go watch& listen to ‘focus on me' and you'll thank me for telling you. 1. Got7:  you've probably got the idea by now that I'm an ahgase. This is the band that I really care about, got7 feels like home, they really feel so close like they're your friends b/c they're so open, genuine and honest that you feel like you know them like your friends. Even though I'm new to the rest of kpop, I've been an ahgase for a number of years now. Their music(especially the one they compose themselves) is just so beautiful. I have a habit of imagining songs as matters or abstract things(e.g: this song is ocean, this one is glitter falling from dusky sky). And listening to got7 makes me imagine alot of beautiful things. Also stanning them includes free therapy, anti-depressants, mood-lifters, you name it! In genuine words they feel more real and human-like. They're so underrated for their potential b/c they have got the worst promotion any one can ever get. And ut really sucks when you're an ahgase for so long. Thanks for coming to my ted talk. Have a great day and be kind and understanding to people. Bless you, bye.

Check out : EXO. EXO is my favourite group because I really like their music a lot. Most of their songs are bops and I like how with each and every comeback they get better and better with their music. I would suggest you to watch their debut year music video first like MAMA. It'll help you out to get to know them better. Then, you should watch their popular music videos like Growl, Monster, Call Me Baby and Tempo.Red Velvet. Red Velvet is like the female version of EXO. I like them because of their music. I tend to listen to their discography most of the time because they're just so good. All of their albums are bops. On top of that, they have two concepts which you can choose from so you won't stand a chance not to look up to them. The Red concept is mostly bubbly, cheerful and cute kind of vibes so it's mostly preferred by the Asian fans especially the Korean fans. The Velvet concept is mainly soft, balad and R&B kind of vibes so most Western fans actually prefer this concept better. I would suggest you to watch their Dumb Dumb, Bad Boy, Red Flavor and Peek-a-Boo music video on YouTube.NCT is also one of my favourite groups because they are all very talented and amazing. They need more love tbh. They are known to have a very interesting concept with their group consisting unlimited amount of members. However, don't worry because they are splited into sub-units like NCT U, NCT 127, NCT DREAM and the latest one, WayV which is currently debuting in China. Right now, their group consists of 21 members in total (and still counting). NCT is also a group which is mesnt to be very diverse and for that, they've released their own songs in different languages including Korean, Chinese, English and Japanese. My favourite songs from them are NCT U's The 7th Sense, NCT 127’s Simon Says, NCT U's Boss, NCR DREAM’s We Go Up and NCT 127’s Cherry Bomb.EVERGLOW. I have to mention this group although they're just a rookie. I've never heard a debut song like theirs in the Kpop industry ever. It's very unusual for a Kpop group to debut with that kinf of song so you should definitely check them out. Search for Everglow's Bon Bon Chocolat on YouTube.TWICE. Since Twice is one of the most popular Kpop groups out there (with so many achievements), you should also check them out. My suggestion would be Like Ooh Ah, Cheer Up and TT.If you want to know more about these groups I would definitely help you out by suggesting more songs especially their b-side tracks for you so feel free to explore more Kpop groups.

Oh, this is really hard and I can’t choose just one. But I’ll give you my top three (Note: These aren’t in any specific order): 1.) Stray Kids  This is a newer group, only debuting in 2017, but I absolutely love them. Not only because of their cute, adorable faces- I mean, look at that little squirrel in the bottom left(Jisung) or the adorable face in the top right(Seungmin)- their music is fantastic. They have a variety of pieces from powerful ones, like “District 9” and “My Pace”, to more cheerful ones, like “Get Cool” and “Awkward Silence”. They’re also very real with how they act on their reality show “The 9th” and are so loveable with each other and their fans. They are still pretty young, the oldest being born in ’97 and the youngest in ‘01, but would you expect from people that just debuted and are rapidly rising in the charts. Bias: Jisung (My little squirrel in the bottom left) Favorite Song(s): Voices + Insomnia 2.) Got7  Now this group has been getting a lot more recognition in the U.S., like BTS, the last few years. Being from the same Entertainment company as Stray Kids- JYP Entertainment if you didn’t know- they are all completely INSANE, but that’s why I love them. They are all childish- even though the youngest was born in ’97 and the oldest in ‘93- but can still be serious when needed. They are very hard working and have calmer songs thanks to the amazing leader they have (JB, the black haired one in the back row) Bias: Youngjae (The black haired one in the middle row) Favorite Song(s): You Are + Moon U 3.) BTS  Okay, before anyone jumps down my throat saying “Oh my Goodness, they’re so overrated”, “How do you like them, you can’t even understand what they’re saying” (which to this comment, I would like to rely it to every single person that either has, or still does, like(d) the song “Despacito” and can’t speak enough Spanish to understand it. I’ll be waiting for why this is so terrible and that isn’t). This group is the calmest out of the three. They are so hard working, putting out so many songs for us in only six years. They were also just at the 2019 Grammy’s where, though they didn’t win the Grammy they were nominated for (next year though), they were able to present one. I’m so proud of them and can’t wait for the new songs that will be “coming out sooner than later”. Bias: Jungkook (The black haired one kneeling in front of the other five- Jimin’s next to him) Favorite Song(s): Spring Day + Airplane pt. 2 Honorable mentions that I like the few of the songs I’ve heard and/or seen live shots of them in reality type shows(again, not in any specific order): ExoAstroBlackPinkSeventeenKNK

GOT7 they are amazing to me! They really got me into KPop. I had heard other groups but no one caught my heart like they did. The way they are together, they make me laugh. Like I want to have them all over for dinner and we laugh and play like family friends. As individuals they inspire me to be the best version of me. To be completely satisfied with being me, the me I truly am. Not the one the camera or society wants to see. I love how honest their lyrics are. They have all written songs that have touched my heart deeply. There songs seem very open and seem to say, “here I am on paper, I hope you like it, if not, oh well I love you anyway.” They inspire me to wait on true love. JB is a kind, firm leader; as the eldest of four it surprised me seeing how kind and caring he is as an only child. JB, fearless leader, is such a corky guy. It’s adorable! Mark, oh handsome Mark! He is the oldest and to me it appears he is most humble. I am not sure why Mark is not extra cocky, but I really admire that about him. He seems to mentor the guys with lessons with how he lives his life as opposed to preaching at them, I like that about him. Jackson does not know who he is or how wonderful he is, it is sad but brings me joy to watch him grow and I have hope that Jackson, and all the guys will know they are worthy of love and worth dying for. Jesus paid the same price for every human being, we all have the same price tag. And we are all SO VALUABLE just because we are, not earning it or deserving, just wake up and breathe. You are more valuable than everything in the universe except the person/people in front of you, cause we were all bought at the same price. Park Jinyoung is such a wonderful mystery to me. I think he is a talented lyricist, actor, singer and dancer. He could model whatever he desired. He says he will be a god father and I believe he will be an even better husband. He is kind and so mean to Yugyeom. He reminds me of my baby sister the way he picks with him. Youngjae (Sunshine is usually what I call him) is so sweet, funny and kind to me. He makes me laugh and Got7 would never be the same without him. BamBam aka Double B!!! He is so funny! I want to cook for him! I like his accent when he speaks Korean and English, he really makes everyone laugh. He seems to be the mutual one amongst the members but he will speak what he believes in. Yugyeom! The maknae or youngest brother! He is so kind and sweet! I am so excited to see him become his own man! He loves his brothers and he has blossomed so much. You can hear all of their progress and development on their most recent album and individual/duo projects. I really appreciate the way they love us Ahgases, even when Jinyoung slashes our hearts and smacks down the kisses. I will give them my support until I can no longer.BTS THESE GUYS ARE HILARIOUS! I would enjoy cooking for them! JHope and Suga make me cry all the time! RM is such a good leader, Jin is an amazing big brother. BTS as a whole is a group of some amazing guys that are blessed to be together and has blessed the world with their friendship and hearts of love. I love how smart V is and how Jungkook puts everything on the line for his brothers and their ARMY. Jimin need never feel down about himself. I hate when they are down about themselves. They love each other so deeply and truly. They really give themselves to their fans, I appreciate how far they have come and where they are going.Winner I have not spent as much time studying or listening to other people the way I have with GOT7 and BTS because once I like something, I like it and I ignore everything else. But my best friend that introduced me to KPop kept pushing other artists on me so….I like Winner!! Mino is adorable! Yoon has a voice that would make a dove cry (not exactly sure what that means, but it sounded legit ;) ) I like every member for what they do, like I said, what I know about everyone else is hear say and a few songs I have heard because of my best friend. I like what I have heard from them, I have not watched any videos of them playing around, hanging out, pulling pranks or doing aegyo like I have with GOT7 and BTS, but they seem cool.   #4. NCT, all of NCT lol NCT U, NCT 127, NCT Dream…I like them all! I like the songs I have heard and they guys are funny, (I saw a Buzzfeed video of NCT 127 and I thought they were adorable together. #5I would say this spot has a tie between Stray Kids and BlackPink….they each have two songs I like: “My pace” and “I am you” by Stray Kids and “Ddu du ddu du” and “Whistle” by BlackPink. The message in my pace made me cry the first time I heard it/read it. It is about loving yourself and not comparing yourself to others and being the best you at your own pace every day. I like love songs which is why I like I am you. The songs by BlackPink are cute to me and have a beat I like dancing to.

I listen to A LOT of Kpop groups. I’ve slipped in and out of Kpop for almost 10 years until more recently a few years ago, I really fell in deep. So over the years I’ve followed various groups with various concepts and styles of music and can recongnize a lot from songs from 2nd generations till now. There are time throughout the year when there’d be a 2 week time pocket where so many groups are announcing comebacks, I can’t even keep up! Ok sorry if I sound like I’m bragging, I’m not I swear! Basically what I’m getting at is, I follow and listen to a lot of Kpop groups. There are groups where I’d watch their MVs as soon as it drops, listen to every song on the album, buy the album, watch all their variety show appearances and know every member and their stats (age, birthdays, various trivia) and then there are groups where I’d follow a bit more casually, watch their MVs, Some variety shows, know some members, and maybe have a few of their B-sides on my playlist. At the moment, my top groups who I follow the most on are: Seventeen, Nu’est, Gfriend, DreamCatcher, NCT, Mamamoo, and Monsta X But again, I “like” so many more groups than that. Some other groups I follow but maybe not as religiously as those are: Astro, Lovelyz, AOA, WJSN, Oh My Girl, A.C.E, SF9, EXID, Infinite, Twice and a few more that I can’t think of. But then there are groups I’d listen to more casually like BTS, Kard, WekiMeki, ONF, Got7, BlackPink, Super Junior, EXO and basically every other group on my massive Kpop playlist. Honestly I’m not picky when it comes to Kpop. I don’t think you need to buy all versions of a groups album, watch every MV they drop, stream it 24/7, like every song they come out with to justify yourself as a fan. You can be a fan of a group just by simply enjoying the content they put out. And also, there’s nothing wrong with not liking one of your favorites group’s song. Everyone has different taste and preferences. Not everyone is going to like you’re favorite groups and your not going to like everyone else’s. That’s why so many groups with so many styles exist, there’s something for everyone! In my personal opinion don’t think you can call yourself “Kpop fan” if you only listen to one group. Your just a fan of that group. Anyways, that’s my two cents. Yes I like other Kpop groups. A lot of them actually.

Right now I can confidently say it’s Akdong Musician but I call them AKMU, consisting of brother-sister duo Lee Chanhyuk and Lee Suhyun.  They debuted 7 April 2014 with the song 200% (which is still my least favourite AKMU song, forgive me) after emerging the winners of Kpop Star. I have never watched it, but what I constantly hear is that they were excellent performers, so I might watch it out of curiosity. Over the years, they have never failed to improve more and more, and their sound always impresses me. Reasons why I love them: Their music doesn’t fit the typical standard in K-Pop, they rarely have any tropical house or hip-hop. There’s something about their sound that’s so organic and refreshing. We have Chanhyuk to thank largely, resident songwriter and composer for AKMU’s songs. The lyrics alternate between deep and thought-provoking to fun and light-hearted. And Suhyun’s vocals are above average, she has a pretty powerful voice.They may not have the ideal appearance for K-Pop stars but I love them for how cute and unique their facial features are. I’ve seen them receive flak for it, but I disagree that Suhyun and Chanhyuk are ugly. They are easily some of the most good-looking Koreans I have ever seen. What makes it even sweeter is how as brother-sister, you can clearly see their resemblance to each other.I can relate to them. As an older sister, I have younger siblings whom I love but at the same time am exasperated with. Hearing them talk about how they were when younger and recount past fights while laughing over it or when they interact with each other on variety shows reminds me of my own sibling relationships and how much they are like my family. It helps me establish a sense of closeness to them.Lastly, their music videos are the best I’ve ever seen. ‘Re-Bye’ has a theatre themed storyline with a twist at the end which always blows my mind because I couldn’t see it coming. ‘How People Move’ has a crisp, bright aesthetic and is my favourite music video. It includes Escher’s stairs as part of the set-up. ‘Melted’ is the story of a boy struggling to make it in the world and brings tears to my eyes. It’s all so good. There are many more but these are the highlights. I’d recommend anyone who’s interested to listen to their music, these tunes for a start: How People MoveRe-ByePlay UglyMeltedDinosaurLast GoodbyeChocoladyTo end off, here’s a cute picture of them.  Particularly, a picture of Lee Chanhyuk. Suhyun is amazing but he deserves more love.

I have so many favourite kpop groups because I listen to almost all genres and can’t seem to settle with one. I guess each group that I stan have their own unique feature which really stands out to me. This is going to be a really really long answer! Boybands SHINee (Ultimate bias group) Their music varies across a wide range of genres including dubstep, deephouse and retro. Their ballads make you fall for them all over again. Their dancing is so powerful and sense of humour makes you want to watch all of their variety shows over and over again. EXO Their music is packed with energy and their ballads are just so emotional. They are funny, good-looking, above all, extremely talented! BTS There isn’t one song I dislike by this group. Almost all of their songs involve a very very powerful dance and their variety skills and looks really are just an added bonus to their talent. They debuted under a small company but now look at them, they have so many international fans and are one of the most famous groups out there! BigBang They are CRAZY but in such a good way! All of their songs are so unique and I guess its because this group has such a wide range of distinguishable voices. You can easily tell apart the member singing a part of the song. Even though most of their songs as a group are energy filled and wild, most of the solo songs by each member are more tamed down and again, amazing to listen to. Seventeen Their songs are more “light” I guess and they are fun to listen to. Their dance skills, vocals and visuals are amazing. VIXX I watched the survival show MyDol and was impressed by a few members. But looking at them now, each of them have really just improved so much that they all are equally talented now! They are the kings of dark concepts. KNK When I first stumbled upon their songs, they were rookies then and the first thought that occurred to me was “They look like a bunch of models and actors rather than idols” and so I didn’t expect much. But their skills proved me wrong. They were excellent from the start and I love how they are getting more and more of the attention they deserve! Got7 It kind of took me a while to actually like this group but when I fell for them, I FELL HARD. I guess the thing that attracted me the most was the way they performed at variety shows and their interaction with fans. DBSK This was the first group that I found out due to a web series. I saw Changmin and wanted to find out more of his movies when I found out about DBSK. The duo is amazing because according to me they are the kings of Kpop. While Changmin is the king of Vocals, Yunho is the king of Dance. Wanna One Long story short, I watched produce101, saw how each of the members have their own skills, how beautifully they could work with each other and I fell in LOVE! Their visuals are no joke! These young boys just have so much talent and even though they are just a project group, they might actually leave a huge impact in the Kpop industry and I can’t wait for more music from them! Girlgroups SNSD (Ultimate bias group) The first group that led me love korean music. I don’t know why, but whenever I looked at this group I could only think of magic. Their songs are so magical and I really just love each one of them to bits. Each member have their own special skill that is displayed through solo activities. The fact that they are still so strong even after 10 years is something to be admired. With the recent rumors of three of the members leaving the agency, it is breaking my heart but one thing is for sure, I’ll just keep loving them and supporting them the same that I’ve been doing all these years. Apink I really just love their concepts. I find it so cute that they really suit the cuter and more innocent concepts despite their age. According to me, they are the funniest groups around and I never miss a single variety show appearance by them! Gfriend The most attractive thing about this group is their dance. No joke. Their dancing is one of the most powerful ones amongst girlgroups and is so beautiful to look at! Each member is such a cutiepie who really just transforms on stage. All of their songs are my favourites. WJSN/Cosmic girls I found out about this group only because of Yeonjung and I’m so glad I did! Their music videos are their speciality and love how they bring out the cosmic feel in each of their videos! April One of the youngest groups around. Their songs are so deep yet their music videos are so cute! I found out about them only few months ago and I wish I had, sooner. Twice I watched the survival show Sixteen and saw how they all improved so much by the end of the show. JYP’s choice was excellent and you can really see them improving more and more by every song! F(X) Honestly, this group is one of the best. It really hurts me that they don’t get promoted enough because they have such unique vibes. Every song of theirs is a totally different concept! I want them to get the popularity and attention they deserve, and really just be known by everyone! EXID Every member in this group is equally talented and I don’t see any reason to dislike them. Their songs are so catchy and makes you want to sing along everytime you hear them. BlackPink These monster rookies must have definitely found a place in everyone’s heart. Since they release very few songs that too with a long delay, improvement can be seen with every music video. These rookies may have a lot to learn from the variety world, but their talent is really just WOW. Red Velvet Their songs are so unique. The tunes and beats and everything get you addicted to the songs. This is one group where learning the names of the members is just so hard despite the fact that there are just 5 members. Every song of theirs display each of the member’s vocal strength and I think that is so cool! Mixed groups K.A.R.D Love at first sight. Remaining groups did take me atleast one song to figure out whether I liked the group or not but with K.A.R.D I just knew instantly that they would become one of my ultimate favourites! Their speciality has to be the fact that there are two versions for every song and every song has a point dance. They are still rookies but still have support from all parts of the world. It’s going to be fun seeing these guys grow! AKDONG MUSICIAN These siblings are really the cutest!! I enjoy their music so much. Their voices complement each other’s and it so nice hearing ballads from this group. Disbanded groups I’ll miss each of these idols a lot as a group but ofcourse my support will always stay with each of the members as they carry on with their solo activities. Wonder girls They were going so strong even after many years of debuting. I did like many of their songs and even though they may not be my most favourite, their disbandment still hurt me a little. Sistar This honestly had to be the most shocking disbandment ever. I mean the news just came about out of the blue and I was just wondering what went wrong! Their songs were so addictive and I just enjoyed their comebacks. 2NE1 The end of an era. They were one of a kind, had such unique and strong concepts that many would fear to try. Their music was catchy and addictive and just perfect. Their powerful songs were just as amazing as their more ballad-type songs. I.O.I One of the most painful disbandments in history of kpop. I watched Produce101 and saw how extremely hardworking these girls were. They made some amazing music in a variety of concepts and I’m glad that they made the most out of the time they were together as a group. Ofcourse, I like listening to more groups but I felt like these names had to be mentioned on the list. If you read the entire answer, thankyou so much ❤️

I asked myself the same question few years back before I became a K-pop admirer. As a foreigner, now living in Korea, I don’t root for any of the big guys, so I hope my answer is fair and from a distance. In Korea, in your daily life, you will hear mostly girls groups playing while shopping in malls or eating out. Twice, Red Velvet, F(x), etc. The ladies are giving the boys a run for their money when it comes to popularity, winning awards, and coming up with new musical styles. In the men’s category, currently BTS and EXO are everywhere. Nevertheless, The one song I heard more often is Untitled 2014 by Kwon Jo Yong, aka G-Dragon. It came out back in April and you can still hear it everywhere. I asked many Koreans of all ages if they know who GD is and everyone does. They know his name, his face, his songs, even in the bowels of the vegetable market… the 80-year old ladies know who GD is… Outside of Korea, boys groups have a larger following. Statistically, TVXQ is in the Guinness world-book or records for having the largest fan club in the world. BTS is the most tweeted musical act of 2017 world-wide, and that includes beating Bieber, Despacito, and so forth. So as far as size goes, world-wide, I would say, first came Psy, than TVQX, than BIG BANG, than BTS. If we just refer to Korea, the interests are different, and EXO most probably wins there today. At a stadium music festival in Korea I witnessed the actual competition between fan clubs. Present were: Psy, BTS, a mini-version of EXO, and Sechs Kies, plus many others. In order of loudness, chants and enthusiasm, BTS wins by a mile. As far as numbers, Sechs Kies pretty much conquered the stadium, and Psy got the loudest standing ovation. So depending on demographics, geographics and allegiances, you will get different answers. My personal ranking … if it matters … between the groups, BTS wins for influence and universality worldwide - for taking k-pop to a new level today. BIG BANG wins for geniality, disruption, and sheer indisputable talent - a classic anywhere you go. EXO wins for talent, consistency and loyalty. TVXQ wins for talent, power and vision - paving the road for a new musical environment. But then, there are so many others old and new, Girls Generation, Super Junior, Cnblue, Shinee and Taemin, Got 7, Seventeen, Wanna One, Monsta X, just to name a few … new talent debuts everyday and competition is fierce. But K-pop is an unprecedented phenomenon, and nothing can stop it now.
