Monsta X ❤️  I literally just finished watching Episode 3 of Monsta X Ray — Season 2. They all have this aura that is so irresistible! It is something about these guys that really absorbs me in like a sponge and it's a very heartfelt thing. They haven't placed #1 in a music award yet but I can most definitely feel it coming soon. It's the same feeling I got when I first discovered BTS. They literally struggled to get views on their music now they are out here achieving goals that they never even imagined setting (with the BBMAs being the prime example). Monsta X will be achieving big goals someday too! I must squeeze this in…it takes a lot of patience to babysit a bunch of active kids, but Monsta X was able to master the role. It took trial and error but thats natural.  I already mentioned this in a recent answer about Jooheon but I will briefly recap. He starved and was held hostage in the past. He never had the freedom to be himself, metaphorically, he was living the life as a circus Tiger (its basically like coming out to perform under the master’s command, then going back into his cage for the rest of the day). His animal like aura is so strong that he was the only person who connected with an animal on the first try in Episode 2 of Monsta X Ray. Barya (the sea elephant) basically became a Monbebe on sight because she would not stop following Jooheon around. The aquarist even said that she never popped her head above the glass….ever!  Just look at the eye contact she's making with him…I understand how you feel Barya. Wonho’s family would spent their hard earned paychecks to give him the future he always wanted. They loved and cherished their son so much that they would give every dime they had left to make him happy, now he's out here making them proud of him. I.M. traveled so much due to his father being a scientist, therefore, it was very difficult for him to make mingle with others and create a friendship. Even when he was announced as a member of Monsta X, he had a hard time bonding with all the other members. Imagine how hard that was, he surely felt lonely. People judged Minhyuk and said that he would never be an idol or at least successfully get as far as he did right now, but guess what haters? He proved you all wrong! Those four place an inspirational theme to their lives due to their rough pasts. I love it when people escape harsh reality and move forth to focus on their future. Monsta X seem like such a very humble group, besides the fact that Jooheon lies on Starship by saying that they won't let him show his abs, which I think is funny. Also their fandom is very chill but I think it will get out of hand once they gain more exposure. Other than that, I love these guys dearly! Monsta X hwiting!

My favorite KPop group is Big Bang. Why? BECAUSE they are FANTASTIC! I could give a rat’s patootie about all this ‘oh, they are so sweet, they work good together, they love each other’ crap if the MUSIC isn’t any good!!! And if the music IS wonderful I don’t care if the guys making it aren’t innocent, sweet, pure babies who ‘love each other’. OKAY? Now if they’d, you know, MURDERED someone, or were proven rapists (no, nobody in Big Bang falls into either category - do not believe slanderous slur jobs released by gossip rags) that would be different. I, along with Hongki BTW, am over Choi Jong Hoon of FT Island - cause rapist. Damn good guitar player but sorry, no thanks. Big Bang? Seungri left the group (even tho I don’t really care about what he did that much because guess what, he was NOT really involved with JJY’s crap at all) so why hate on the group? Sheesh. I have yet to hear a Big Bang song I don’t like, okay? GDragon is a phenomenal songwriter, T.O.P. has this sexy deep voice when he raps and I like hearing him sing. Daesung is the damn voice of Big Bang - just wow. Taeyang also has a great voice and some songwriting skills. I own Rise, I also own The Great Seungri - which is a wonderful album BTW despite whatever the boy did or didn’t do. You know who else I love? CN Blue. I’m so over the top FURIOUS at these lousy little netizens sitting in internet cafes thinking they can just decide who to throw out a window. They are BULLIES of the worst order. I’m so upset about Lee Jung Hyun being forced to leave. Thank all the deities that little uptight puritans didn’t have the power to destroy groups like Led Zeppelin back in the day - we’d have lost so much great music. This young man has been confused with the FT Island rapist right from the beginning, and none of the little idiots whining about him have even bothered to fact-check a thing. So Oh MY he acted like the ROCK STAR he is back 4 years ago, and then dropped JJY as a friend like a hot potato when the GF made those accusations. That’s his ‘crime’ - the cops and the Japanese don’t give a flying F!%!% - I doubt any Americans do either BTW. Anyway, I’m a bit upset about things right now. I do like the way KPop wants their idols to be family friendly (at least overtly), be discrete is what that used to be called - and I also like that celebrities acknowledge their fans on a pretty deep level in SK. It’s very nice to see a talented group like BTS who are hugely creative, responsible, civic-minded young people who are great friends with each other. Very nice. Just not necessary for me to like their music or performances. I also like it when groups write their own stuff, have a hand in creating their own material (dance, rap, song lyrics, melodies, concepts, production, etc). BUT again not necessary for me to really enjoy the music and performances.

response.answer_text: (Initially I was asked why I stan my favorite groups. I’m answering that) I’ve criticized my groups more than praised them whoops. I guess I do that cause they already got a buttload of fans that literally worship them. But I’ve never properly answered this question before so here it goes: BTS. Technically, Gdragon and PSY were my first impressions of kpop, but BTS genuinely amused me and I admired their dancer, Jhope. I really enjoy watching people dance. And I like too many BTS songs, so might as well stan them. Monsta X. Second group I cared about, and they quickly became my favorite. I related with their personalities better. And I like their more intense music style (I’m a metal and alt rock fan outside kpop). Plus, the rappers are hard to beat. BlackPink. I thought they were stupid and I hated their songs. At first. Somehow, they grew on me, especially Lisa. I thought her accent sounded pretty cool when she rapped. And I was sick of aegyo concepts from gg, so… BP made my list. ATEEZ. I was an off and on fan in their fetus days. But I started consistently following after “Say My Name”. What really drew me into this group was their outstanding stage presence. They are hilarious! VIXX. Initially, I just thought they were stupid edgelords trying to be scary (which they kinda are lol). But then youtube was like, “hey look at this DANCE by their leader”. And so I slammed the stan button. I love their dance style and main vocalists. And I admire their company’s eagerness to test the kpop boundaries. And their fandom is literally the best.

PentagonDropping this to prove you why I love them:  You will be surprised if I say that this is a self-produced and self-choreographed title song from their fourth mini album (excl. Japanese album) a month before they celebrate their first anniversary as an established group. The group has that color you’ll never get in other groups. They have members who already became trainees since 2nd gen groups are trending. Their height difference, their overall talents, their visuals, and their personalities… There are only two members in this group who haven’t showcased their self-composed songs yet, and they are foreigners. This is legitimately the first group which all members wreck up my ultimate bias list because they are all so extraordinary. They are also the first group in which I like all the rap line’s rapping style. They have stayed as my ultimate group for around 4 months now and you won’t regret knowing these guys. You’ll really regret sleeping on them. BTS  Credits for them to make me wanna jump into the K-Pop world. I really like their music style, the originality they have, the bond they have as a group, and one thing that really amaze me the most is the way they can make all members sound so good when singing their songs. Their songs are surely of high quality, especially HYYH. Oh, and despite being a stan since WINGS era, I love them because of their super awesome debut song: No More Dream. You really gotta check that song, and N.O too! GOT7  I know this group from BTS, actually. Their music is pretty much good for me and they are beagle-dols! They also have Defsoul and Ars to produce their songs. Same as BTS, each members are also very connected, and I feel like what I see on camera is their true selves. Seventeen  The way they send their emotions of a song written and composed by a member (Woozi) through its choreography done by a member (Hoshi) made me completely slipped into the diamond life, although it was only for a while. The amount of respect I put on this group is just beyond any groups I’ve ever known because they managed to show me that a 1-year group can look like an established old group (watched them for the first time on MMA 2016, I really thought they were sunbaenims!). All members are so, so formidable, and their musics are HQ most of the time, especially subunit songs. BTOB  This group is so far the only one that made me feel so nostalgic and amazed since I knew about them 4 years ago, and I was not a K-Pop fan at that time! You’ll think that there are normal members here while there are not a single one of them who is normal, especially that popular actor on the left. Sure, they don’t have that visual quality new gen fans adore nowadays, but all the members’ talents and humbleness are on another level (and also their dorkiness). They are not just the king of ballad. Seeing these guys daily will burn your tummy’s calories because they are very hilarious. I also like MAMAMOO (vocal quality, the ‘quietness and reservedness’ they have, queens of imitating styles), CLC (versatility, visuals, talents, the same dorkiness fellow Cube artists (former or staying) inherited), Bolbbalgan4 (song quality), and Rainz (Hong Eunki, b e a g l e s).

- Monsta X : they got me into this world and will be favs until I leave it (I hope it will never happened). Their music is totally matching my taste, I one of the lucky one who found her perfect group musically talking. But it’s not only their music.  They are talented babies, they are getting recognition because they are nice people, well known and very popular among other idols, actors and entertainers, to be sweet and treating everyone with respect, no matter if they are rookies or seniors. In addition, they are what I call a family. Groups like that are going to be forever, without losing a member, are able to work amazingly together. It’s something I feel only with a few group, which are Monsta X, BAP, VIXX and Seventeen. Those who have not only face difficulties but who have also fought against each other in order to debut (or in BAP case, faced something so bad that it almost killed literally three of them). Groups like that are diffusing a real harmony and you feel so great when you see them together. These seven boys are going to change the kpop world, making a whole tsunami, they are already creating their waves. “Kpop isn’t a fight, it’s a fair competition”. - Seventeen : Is it link to what I said above ? Probably. Anyway, I discovered Seventeen thanks to Monsta X and I have a single thing to say : bless this friendship.  Seventeen are hardworker babies who saved their whole agency with their 26 babies arms. As say above, they, too, are a real family. Such a big group would not work like they do if they weren’t loving each other as their brother, it has been show with groups like SuJu or ToppDogg. I have great hope in their future. - A.C.E : Who are they ? The future. A.C.E are amazing boys who have seen their hope being crushed. They didn’t give up and they are here today. Can’t wait to see what’s going to happened tomorrow.  - Nu’est : Nu’est have been on top, dropped so low that people though they were disbanded and came back to be the most popular Kpop group in Korea. No explanation needed. Nu’est are shining. They didn’t gave up, they throwed their whole hope into their fans and LOVE heard them. They are one of the most peaceful and beautiful group I know. I just feel so great when I watch them  That’s it. Otherwise I have a lot of other groups I like but don’t really follow or don’t follow anymore and don’t call myself *fandom name* ; Got7 : They were one of the first group I followed, but their musics didn’t really matched my taste and I ended up dropping them. I have a lot of affection for this group, I feel really sweet when I think about themVIXX : I don’t really know why I dropped them but I think it’s just I wasn’t interested in their style anymore. I have a lot of respect for them tho, not only as kpop group you know, just… when I see them I want to bow very low and kiss their feet.BTS : Their music isn’t really matching my taste currently. Added to the whole hype and negative aspect of it, I ended up being more and more uninterested by everything they were doing so I stopped following them before I get just annoyed by them. Stay the good memories I suppose. It’s a group I didn’t really stopped following by choice so it’s a little bit bitter.BAP : My sister is a huge Baby and talking with her ended me being interested into them. But I don’t follow them, I just have a strong feeling of affection and I would love to hug them one by one so hard, and patting their head saying “it’s going to be alright, you did well”.And in general I like the work of : SuJu, SHINee, EXO, Up10tion, NCT, Twice, WJSN, Pentagon, SF9, Infinite, Sonamoo, Sistar (TT-TT), Day6, Shinhwa, N.Flying, KNK, Pristin, and probably a lot other I can’t remember. I always wonder if someone read my posts fully

It’s an individual’s opinion. For me it’s Astro. I have followed lots of groups, but I did not find anyone as best as ASTRO. Like, ASTRO is a complete package. It’s not been too long since I started following them. It was December 2018. I was watching My I.D. is a Gangnam Beauty, and Cha Eun Woo’s visual led me to the group. I started watching ASTRO’s mv, their funny videos, their live performance videos, they were all awesome. I mean, they really are something. Each member of the group has his own talent. Like, MJ, he is good at impersonation, while Jinjin is a good drummer. Well, Cha Eun Woo and Moonbin both know how to play piano as well as they are good at acting. Also, Rocky is the best dancer and Sanha is the best guitarist. I mean that, besides singing, they have their own talent, and these talented boys need more recognition. Its really sad to say that ASTRO is one of the most underrated boy group. However, they are gaining popularity slowly, but not getting famous as they deserve to be. The best thing about the group is that they are really close to one another. They care and help one another a lot. Especially, Sanha (maknae) gets a lot of care by his hyungs, as he is the youngest in the group. Another fact about the group which I love is the two oldest members, MJ and Jinjin, they act like the youngest ones. MJ, also known as a happy virus of the group, along with Jinjin are so playful and always keep their members happy. On the other hand, Sanha, who is the maknae, is very savage to his hyungs. I feel so happy and entertaining when he messes around with older members. It’s kind of cute and interesting. While Cha Eun Woo is like the father of the group. He is a calm member but also very mischievous from inside. He usually takes care of the members more. Talking about Moonbin, he is a sportsperson of the group, and his attitude is like so daring that he is not afraid of anything. Lastly Rocky, he and Moonbin have been trainees for like 7 years together. So, its pretty obvious, those two are very close. Both of them are good at dancing. They even have make choreos of their songs by themselves. They are very talented as well as pure-hearted people. Recently, they have won first prize for their first album and they were beyond happiness. Also, just 2 days ago, they made a Japan debut, and it was a huge success for them. See, these boys deserve to get more attention and recognition. Follow them, you won't regret. #arohafighting #astro #aroha <3

There is no “best”. You can’t compare a group that’s been around for 10 or 12 years to a group that just debuted. I have “favorites”. That doesn’t mean the groups I like are better than the groups other people like. I can see a lot of BTS fans answering this however unless you know tons of KPop groups how can you compare? Not including disbanded groups my top 4, in order, have been in place for years - ShinEE, Vixx, Infinite, and Super Junior. That is not to say they’re better than other groups, just that I personally like them more. I can’t even keep track of the new groups! If you want to add in groups who play instruments CNBlue, FTISland and Day 6. That doesn’t mean my phone or iPod doesn’t have 2PM or Got7 or Seventeen or BAP or EXO or Monsta X or Beast or even, yes, BTS on them. I like vocals and harmonies so my top groups reflect that. I also like groups who sound the same live as they do recorded. I also like groups who dance and remember their choreography (watch weekly idol and see how many groups forget their own dance moves because the song was two comebacks ago. It’s also important to me that the groups really like each other (yes, they all look like they do as they are packaged to look like they are best friends but there are some groups who don’t hang out outside of work and I don’t understand how you can eat, sleep and live with people for years and then just not be friends outside of an MV or concert. When Kim Jonghyun died the main mourned was Choi Min Ho, that’s how close ShinEE is to each other (main mourner is meant only for family so that means a lot). But mostly if it’s about the music, as I said, put out great songs and I’m your fan. The order in which I like groups isn’t that important and to objectively say this group is better than that group or this group is the best is what starts fan wars. I don’t need to justify my favorite group, they’re just my favorite and they don’t have to be anyone else’s. If I’m pulling out a song that is 10 years old and I still love it that justifies why my favorite groups are what they are.

What IS the best K-POP band in the world? This question is in-fact close to a year and yet, I’m still being requested to answer. How do we even judge this? Currently there are 5 collapsed answers from last year, and most of them say what??? BTS and SNSD. Does that mean they’re the best? Why do questions like this arise? Is it for bragging rights among other K-POP fans? A means to walk like there’s a sore under your arm-pits and show your pride in your K-POP group being “the best”? Back up please. Let’s see a hypothetical situation: Let’s say for argument sake that the best way to determine the best at something is to find how “popular” it is, and how much money it has mustered compared to other groups, globally. And let’s just say it’s BTS coz the majority of KPOP fans just love hearing that, don’t they? Would that make them the best?  Look at movies: The highest grossing movie in the world is currently Avatar (grossing 2.7Billion!). Would you call it “the best”? With the likes of Avengers Infinity War that seemed to break the internet, could you even make this a fair deduction? What does the best even mean? That all other contending movies are not “good enough”, or they don’t captivate the crowd as much as Avatar? Enough Questions. This is usually a common question when fan wars are happening. It’s a good question to express hate and rage among others. This is because they want other K-POP fans to recognize their idols and acknowledge them as better than all others. Let me go on to say this: BTS is not the best K-POP group in the world. (Actually upon writing this, BLACKPINK are infact more popular than BTS). Let’s add some pictures, coz quora users love those:  SNSD is not the best K-POP group in the world.  There is no BEST group in the world. Yes. Come at me you all. Rain down your rage on me for my despicable acts of violence against your Oppas and Sunbaenim’s or whatever you call them. The truth of the matter is that art is subjective, and treating it objectively would express a lack of perspective towards the other group. You know deep down that Avatar is not as captivating as Infinity War, so the highest grossing movie doesn’t make it the best, going by that standard. Please stop with the comparisons. Put aside the need to put one above the other, because they are all their own style. I understand that they are all under K-POP, but it isn’t imperative to try and find the best. BTS is good in their own regard. Same with EXO, GOT7, BLACKPINK, 9MUSES, G-IDLE…. you get it. Why does this question come up actually? If you are truly interested and invested in the music a certain artist produces, you’d have little to no time to bother if he’s the best. Heck, if they’re the worst in the world, wouldn’t you still listen to them? People bring 2 very mutually exclusive groups independent of each other, and compare them…. again, pictures: We have MAMAMOO  and G-IDLE  They are both really good. They are both dedicated to their work, and they bring out one of the best of sounds there is. To put one over the other, is to rob one of it’s artistic prowess. A means of undermining one’s work. Try to imagine how JYP or any other KPOP inclined agency representative would respond to this. If you asked them, what would they say? This question is quite dangerous if answered incorrectly, which is funny as there is no correct answer. Your best artist is the best artist. Cheers!

GFriend, or 여자친구 (Yeojachingu) in Korean, stand out among K-Pop groups, with a number of songs better than anything I have heard from any of their rivals, and I find them much more musically satisfying than other groups. In addition to that their main vocalist, Yuju, has exceptional talent, they don’t use Autotune, their dances are generally regarded as setting the standard among Korean girl groups, and you won’t find a lovelier bunch of girls anywhere. Some people complain that all their songs are the same, which is not true; they are always different musically, but GFriend have a characteristic sound (which they don’t always stick to), with strings and other “real” instruments. It doesn’t appeal to everyone, but as a classical music lover I like it and feel that it gives them more scope for expressiveness and colour. Another thing I like about them is that, unlike most other K-Pop groups, they don’t ruin their songs with rap. GFriend’s best songs don’t instantly stick in the memory and that is one of their great strengths; instead of simple tunes and a lot of repetition they tend to have long, wide ranging melodies, interesting harmony and some very good counterpoint, and increasing familiarity brings richer rewards rather than boredom. They transcend conventional pop genres, and Time for the Moon Night is one that I don’t consider to be a pop song at all; it is a genuine art song worthy of comparison with the very best from any time and from anywhere in the world. Start with Rough, Time for the Moon Night and, for something different from the usual GFriend sound, Fingertip. If you listen enough times to really know the songs you will probably end up loving them because they are so outstanding. The more recent Sunrise, and the new Japanese song, Flower (March 2019), are very good too. With songs like these they could become very popular among people of all ages all over the world.

Because everyone else is doing top 10, so I’m going to, too, because picking just one is more difficult than finding that damn lost sock so yeet. BTS - Did they pave the way? Yes. They allowed Kpop and Korean culture to move more into the western world and allowed many groups in smaller companies to become more well known, like Cube Entertainment groups, Pledis groups, Starship, etc. They also introduced a lot of people into Kpop, myself included. And we enjoy some meme bois at every given time.My bias is Taehyung, not because he’s handsome but because when I first got into BTS, I really liked how wide his vocal range was and how his voice sounds.Stray Kids - I don’t think they’ve released a single song that hasn’t blown my mind, pre-debut songs included. Bang Chan is JYP’s pride and joy, putting together Stray Kids and leading the group. I love how funny and chaotic they are and it hurts me to see how underrated they are in Korea overall. We can always appreciate some chaotic Aussie humor.kinky felix low voice stan (but his high voice is extremely stable too and i luv but felix is mostly my bias because HIS LOW VOICE fsodifjaofpsdoifjopj)Itzy - Their debut and every song leading up to it has been bops, and their dances are very strong. I think most of us can agree that Yeji (also Bang Chan), with amazing dance and singing skills. All of the girls showed extremely good dance skills while competing, definitely showing why they got picked.My bias is Lia because I’ve always been jealous of how flexible and pretty she is. As a person who enjoys dancing and watching choreography videos, her dance for the competition blew me away.Twice - Sometimes I really feel like they are queens of Kpop, dominating it since debut. Even though their choreography was a simpler back then, they’ve really stepped it up, and every girl is a strong dancer and have always been strong vocalists. They, in my opinion, started the trend for being cutesy and girly to be ok, especially because they are from the Top 3.My bias is Nayeon because she’s such a bright, bubbly person who seems like would be very loyal and sweet, or Momo, because she’s such a good dancer and visual. (pINk lAmBOrghiNi)Red Velvet - I honestly thought they would be 3 on my list, but guess I was wrong. They were one of the first artists I listened to after BTS, along with iKon (who never really made it onto my list) and BLACKPINK. They’re really talented girls with excellent vocals and very catchy songs. Irene is it-girl of Korea and anyone can try to convince me.My bias is Irene or Seulgi because they’re talented girls and very pwety.BLACKPINK - I know most people believe BP are an untalented group with a toxic fandom, but like any not all of their fandom is toxic (but as an ARMY, I have seen a lot of the toxic side), and the real reason they’re untalented is because YG Entertainment is a horrible company that just uses BP’s fame for money. When YG is in need of botching up a scandal, BP has a new song ready to be released. They don’t get many comebacks, but individual, they share many talents like Jisoo’s singing voice and Lisa’s dancing skills.My bias is Jisoo or Jennie, because Jisoo is a powerful vocal and (in my opinion) the only girl whose vocals are not held down by YG because she, by nature, has a soft, sing-song voice. And Jennie is a meme and another it-girl of Korea.NCT - Even though I don’t fully “stan” them (I’m in the process of learning names and albums and stuff), they’re a really good group and interesting in the way that they add new members and have a rotating sort of concept. My favorite subunit would probably be WayV or NCT127.My bias is probably Mark or Johnny because 1) I don’t know very much else about everyone else and 2) because, because.Day6 - They have really good songs, including Sweet Chaos and I mention that song because I literally CANNOT on SuperStar JYP just alkdsfj;aoejwrojeapoidv. Just like NCT, I’m learning the members and songs and stuff.I don’t really know most of the members but I know YoungK and that’s it.Got7 - I’ve known them since I started watching KPop, I just never really looked into the group (I watched a lot more Stray Kids) but they have an interesting discography I can deal with and yeeea.My bias is Jackson because (ahem) MAMA meeeme and also because just,… because.Ateez - I also never really got into the group but I’ve heard of them a lot, and I really liked the concept in Wave. IMO, HALA HALA was kinda dark and the MV was not what I thought the theme would be (I listened to the song before watching the MV), but the song is rlly gewd and Wonderland was a great comeback.I don’t have a bias but my friend (whose bias is Seonghwa) says I would bias Mingi because he has a low voice and apparently I have a low voice pattern in my biases. (Taehyung, Felix.. yea that’s it.)

It really depends on your taste. I’ll put the ones that I think are best in each category and my recommended down. Note: I won’t be including the legendary ones in here as you’ve probably already heard of them Vocals: Boy groups: EXO Girl groups: Mamamoo Dance: Boy groups: Seventeen and Monsta X Girl groups: Gfriend and Dreamcatcher Groups that have debuted not for a long time, but I think have the potential to be really big: Boy groups:Stray kids (Rap is seriously amazing. Vocals are too, but I like rap more so I’m kinda biased on this) Girl groups: (G)-Idle (If their agency,Cube, doesn’t screw them up. I really hope not.) Fandoms: (as in peaceful ones) I am not sure about this one, but to me it feels like Seventeen, Mamamoo and Gfriend are pretty peaceful. Most ARMYs(fans of BTS) are actually pretty peaceful, but some immature fans keep ruining the name for others. I know this for a fact as I myself am an ARMY, and I have met a lot of other ARMYs just want to end the fanwars and enjoy music together. Same for Blinks. I would recommend BTS’s music for their meaning lyrics and sound, but seriously, for your own good, STAY AWAY FROM THE FANDOM. If you post anything that sounds even a little bit negative about them, you would get bombarded with replies. My recommendations: Duo: AKMU, Bol4 and KHAN Co-ed group: KARD Band: Day6 and The Rose (I only know these two bands, but I really like their music) Girl groups(excluding the ones mentioned above): Red Velvet,Loona and Gugudan Boy groups: iKon,Pentagon and Got7 P.S. I don’t know much about soloists, but I heard several songs that I like which are from Hyuna, Sunmi, IU, Suran and Chungha. I don’t know about Jessi’s music, but from the videos I watched, she is a really great and badass woman.

I have a lot of favorite kpop groups. Some of them are: BTS - because of their music, personalities, just the fact that they never dissapoint me and motivate so many people. Also I love their remake of Come back home. NCT - Empathy is my favorite album in year 2018, I love each one of them a lot and I like their choreographies the most. Also Taeyong is probably my no.1 idol - because of voice, performance, his dance moves etc. Stray kids - their lyrics, themes. Voices, Insomnia, 3rd eye, Question, Rock, Glow, Grow up,… whatever, also 3racha songs like Broken compass, Double knot, If, Domestic banana, Wow, many more. And they are really funny +bunch of potential. Got7 - personalities, their whole “chill aura”. Their fandom is nice, it’s much better to stan Got7 than for example BTS. I am tired of new ARMYs, when I am on Ahgases’ side of the internet, life is peaceful lol. EXO - as singers and some of them dancers, their skills are amazing. For me they were like “face of the k-pop” for four years. Shinee - songs, vocals. Jonghyun’s album Poet is something I listen to really a lot. Noir - to me it seems like this group is full of unlucky people with amazing skills. Can’t wait for their comeback - soon. That airplane choreography got me. *EDIT* They just released that song, it’s better than I expexted. Check them out they debuted just moths ago but every one of their songs is nice.  BAP - just the fact that their debut was better than BTS’. They were my first kpop group, Zelo and Yongguk are people that I admire a lot and I wish to hear more of their music. EDIT**** ONEUS - Just had their debut and I am totally in love with every member. I really like their voices, there are many surprising parts in this song and it somehow looks like they might try to have some story behind it.  ATEEZ - they are going to debut soon. Might become best dancers in kpop and their performance of one song just got me. Just 1:00 and wait for the chorus. **EDIT - They had their debut, definitely amazing rookies.  There are many more tho. Can’t pick one they are all nice.

These are my three favorite Korean groups, not in a particular order.  BTS (방탄소년단) Undoubtely the most successful K-pop band ever, the milestones they have achieved is remarkable and praiseworthy for pushing K-pop to mainstream across the US and the Europe. The group is a celebrity-magnet, having a very large number of celebrity fans, including Shawn Mendes, Justin Bieber, Halsey, Steve Aoki, Jimmy Fallon, James Corden and John Cena. The group is highly praised for it’s impact-making lyrics, that influence the lives of the millions across the world, making them more than just merely ‘idol singers’. The performance is absolutely top-notch, as they’re well-known for pushing to their farthest in every performance. The record-breaking K-pop group aren’t only just ‘idol singers’, but the current ‘worldwide sensations.’  Seventeen (세븐틴) Debuting in 2015, the thirteen-member group is well-known for their absolute eye-catching dance demonstrations. Seventeen, seemingly popular among teens, for their charming personalities and young-dynamic performers, have started to enjoy initially greater success, both nationally and internationally.  SHINee (샤이니) It’s undeniable that SHINee is one of the most iconic K-pop groups ever existed, their music is, simply, the best. For instance, the debut song, Replay, I’ve never heard a debut song that good.

response.answer_text: I’ve only recently developed an interest in Kpop. After years of avoidance, I finally decided to check it out. My current obsession is Dreamcatcher.  They’re the one group I can’t get enough of when it comes to songs, dancing, concepts, music videos, everything. Their entire discography has been nothing but consistently high quality music. As someone more into the rock genre, it makes sense that Dreamcatcher became my first love with that rock/metal influence in their music. Since their debut in 2017, these girls have rocked the ‘nightmare’ concept with stunning visuals, dance and vocals. After their lack of success as cutesy girl group, Minx, 2017 gave them a clean slate and two additional members. Dreamcatcher’s debut album, Nightmare, starts strong with addictive high energy and synchronised dancing in title track, Chase Me.  Deja Vu is, perhaps, one of my favourite music videos of all time. It’s like some sort of epic fantasy story. I can’t express how much I love this frame alone.  Dami’s ‘magic trick’ in You and I… The entire choreography for that song is art.  And Piri’s opening sequence is just beautiful.  Last year, Dreamcatcher released their album, End of the Nightmare, and they’re now onto newer things, with a Dystopia series. This year, two mini albums have been released—Tree of Language and Lose Myself. It’s great to see that their title tracks, Scream and Boca have been doing really well.  They also have some fantastic b-sides that depart from their usual style, including: Jazz Bar, Black or White, And There Was No One Left, Polaris and Wonderland. I would highly recommend watching the group’s self-made music video for Sahara. It’s very professional, of course.  Can’t wait to see what else Dreamcatcher has in store. c:

My Number one Big Bang What set Bigbang apart is 1. G- Dragon, this man is a musical genius and I think through his leadership and songwriting has made this group what it is today. 2. They have a lot of control now on their music, artist development and show production. G-dragon and T.O.P have been heavily involved in the songwriting process of Big Bangs music since the beginning, so their sound has come off consistent and more authentic as it’s coming from the artist. 3. They have really great and funny personalities. I love watching Big Bang on variety shows they all have distinct personalities and a little quirky. They look like they really enjoy each others company and love what their doing. I think a group that is in a similar situation a lot earlier ( in terms of creative control and showing their real personality) is BTS. Their involvement in songwriting and presentation adds an authenticity to their full package and probably why they have a strong international following ( we want our artists to be authentic and we connect with them through their music so want it to be their story). They're not on this list because I like only a few songs less than the ones on the list, but great group <3. I would just like to note that Kwon Ji Yong by G-Dragon to me is the best K-pop album I still listen to once a month.  Apart from Big Bang I’m pretty much a multi-stan, I just listen to music I like. The below is based on the groups whose tracks music I listen to the most and listen to often. EXO I tend to like upbeat songs ( rather than slow ones) and EXO has a lot of great songs ( Power, Monster, Growl). Also, they have some great vocalist esp in EXO-CBX loved Blooming Day.  TWICE I really tried not to like this group, because the cutesy girly pop music isn’t really my thing but TT and What is Love is my jam.  Honourable mentions - I think these two groups will hit big A.C.E  Pentagon - I hope they can survive the scandal

!The following order has no relation to my preference! Stray Kids - I can write a whole essay on them. They have 9 members who can do literally everything - they have no “dance black hole”, they can all sing, rap, and compose (some are better than others), which is very rare in the industry in my opinion, and I admire it a lot. Not to mention their rapper line (3RACHA) is very, very skilled. Moreover, all of their songs have relatable lyrics - some examples include growing up, insomnia, rebelling against norms.BTS - Honestly, not so much now, because their title tracks sound more generic than before and I am not a big fan of their kind of EDM (e.g. Euphoria, Magic Shop, Best of Me), but some of their songs and their older songs are still awesome in my opinion - examples include Dionysus, Dead Leaves, I'm Fine, Spring Day (THE QUEEN) and Run. Of course, I also appreciate their messages to people. And again, their rapper line is awesome.Dream Catcher - The only girl group in my list! I LOVE their dark, creepy, rock concept. Their dance is probably the most powerful and one of the hardest within existing GGs, ans I love it. While their rock songs are epic, their ballads are also soothing but not boring to listen to.Seventeen - Probably the best knife choreography group, and their dances are also creative too. In contrast to BTS, I love their type of EDM (sans DWC but I love DWC for another reason), like Home and Oh My, while their funky songs are also cute and addicting. They also have my favourite kind of voices, with DK so far the only one whose high notes give me chills.The Boyz - LISTEN this group is so underrated. Although less so than Stray Kids, they are also very multi-talented, have some of the best visuals and voices in my opinion, and their knife choreo is also no joke. Their songs are also nice to listen to.One more thing, these five groups are also hiarious and full of walking memes, which is a bonus.

….BTS? It’s true. I’ve been with BTS since 2015, and it seems like I’m on an endless journey when I listen to them and watch their V-lives. Most people won’t give BTS a chance because they’re korean and (No offense to BTS or ARMY) they look like Ken/barbie dolls. That’s what people think. Oh yeah and when they see them, they immediately say “Ew they’re gay.” Just because they dress up and wear makeup, which is NORMAL in the Kpop world, and that’s what people fail to realize. Anyway…..My absolute favorite band is BTS because they taught me a lot of important things, and they helped me through dark times, especially when I was in a severe state of depression. I’m self conscious and hate the way I look. I’m not saying I change for BTS, but BTS technically are the ones that made me think more positive about myself and I have to thank them because without them, I wouldn’t be where I am today. I really wish people would see their message behind their songs because it can help a lot of people, especially when it’s illegal in North Korea. Not to be mean, but BTS are really pushing the boundaries that most koreans don’t want. Like for example, some koreans, (Mostly in North) don’t like it when you try to make people individual. In North Korea, they’re taught to behave a certain way and taught how to act a certain way. Basically they’re like puppets that are being pulled by strings. BTS, if they were to go to North Korea and do what they do now, they would be executed right there on the spot, because BTS are all about voicing your opinion and loving yourself. In short, I truly have to thank BTS for getting me out of my slump, and i’ve never been happier. I LOVE the messages that they put in their music and I wish people would feel the same instead of judging them just because they’re not like us. :( SORRY FOR RANTING

I have three favourites so let’s get to it! TXT The Newest favorite Kpop group.TXT has just debuted a few days ago but I already fall in love with them. Their music is so eye catching and you cannot not fall in love with at least one of their songs. They have a great variety of vocals and although lacking in rapping (Although we haven’t seen a great amount of that). I know that TXT will be one of my favorites for a while. AND THEIR VISUALS ARE JUST… NO WORDS 2. Seventeen the most consistent Kpop group I started to listen to Seventeen since the release of their 6th Mini Album You Made My Dawn. I love Seventeen’s songs especially Home, Don’t Wanna Cry and Getting Closer. They also have one of the best visuals like Mingyu and Vernon. They have great vocals and good units. But my most favorite is how they are seperated into different units. My personal fave is the Hip Hop Unit consisting of Vernon, Mingyu, Wonwoo and S.Coups. 3.BTS The most inconsistent but the one I most loved I still love BTS DO NOT GET ME WRONG. But the fans sometimes are super annoying and I really hate some anti BTS fans/haters come along and say “Oh BTS SUCKSSSSS”. The ARMYS are also annoying as well. But BTS have my fave vocals and my fave rap line. They are also really good when it comes to interviews or shows. BTS THE KINGS OF KPOP

1- BTS !  This will group will forever be my top, why? It’s because they are funny, thoughtful, kind, humble, and most importantly they taught me how to love myself just the way I am. They have such calming music, with such meaningful lyrics. I don’t love them because of their looks, their popularity. I love them for being them, for being 7 amazing yet dorky crackheads that never fail to put a smile on my face everyday and their amazing personalities! Not to mention, they are such adorable babies, I can’t! 2- GFRIEND !  These girls are SO underrated! They really should get noticed more, they work so hard and they love their fans dearly. They treat everyone as family, in fact they are now acquired by BigHit Entertainment, which means BTS and GFRIEND are basically a family now! Both BTS and GFRIEND have been great friends, and so as their CEO’s. They really should get more attention, for the hard work they put in, like practising for comebacks, recording songs, etc. I don’t adore them just because of their amazing visuals and their hard work, I also adore them for being similar to BTS, I adore them for being crackheads, for being the light that shines forever in dark times and for being so humble and caring. This group will forever be my Top 2 and will also forever will be my adorable and VERY beautiful girls! They always put a smile to my face no matter what! Also, their unique and awesome personalities too, I love them for being who they are. 3- TXT  Also another group I adore. These boys are so cute, like I don’t even know why or how. Like how can 5 boys be SO freakin’ adorable! This group is my Top 3rd because they have such passion into, singing, dancing, and rapping. They work hard non-stop, and they make sure their fans are satisfied with their songs. Even though they’re just kind of a rookie group, I still love them. These guys, are also a bunch of crackheads! All 3 groups are, they all have something in common. I watch TXT, if I need a laugh or if I’m sad and I want something to cheer me up. They never fail to put a little smile on a my face! They are SO fun to watch, because each of them have different traits and personalities that make them even funnier and better! I hope this helped you get your answer! Signed off by your lovely crackhead, -Sammie xoxo    (3 Crackhead Siblings indeed. xd)

Hi I'm really new into K-pop and also on Quora 😅. However, i've listened to many famous and non famous K-pop groups’ songs. I don't know all of the members of some of these, but their songs are really good and that's why they're on my list of my top 10 K-pop groups.  10. ITZY They're literally very new in K-pop, but they've already released an album & their stage presence, performance, aura and charisma are the main factors for which i admire them. Favourite songs: Wannabe; Cherry; Dalla Dalla & Selfie Cam   9. GOT7 I think i like them more because of their personalities than their songs, but i never said that their songs aren't good. Favourite songs: Not By The Moon; Just Right; Never Ever & Girls Girls Girls   8. Ateez They debuted a few years ago, but they've already gained so much success because of their awesome discography. Their newer songs are always better than the previous ones. Favourite songs: Wonderland; Hala Hala; Answer; Wave & Treasure   7. Blackpink Even though, many people could say that they're overrated, you can't deny the fact that their songs are really catchy. Their MVs and visuals make them stand out the most compared to other K-pop groups. Favourite songs: Boombayah; Whistle; Stay; As If it's Your Last & Don't Know What To Do   6. Seventeen Their synchronization is unbelievable. Their melodic voices and visuals are stunning. Favourite songs: Hit; Left & Right; My My; Very Nice; Home; Don't Wanna Cry & Clap   5. Twice This was the first K-pop girl group i listened to. They haven't got very stable voices and aren't really good performers either, but their aura is mesmering to the point to make me fall for them. Favourite songs: Feel Special; Fancy; Dance The Night Away; Likey; Knock Knock & Fanfare   4. EXO Their songs aren't really my type, but i love their personalities. They're very humble and loving. Plus, their vocal line is outstanding. Favourite songs: Tempo; Love Shot; Growl & What Is Love   3.Mamamoo Ever heard about woman empowerment in K-pop? Yes, Mamamoo is the only K-pop group who touches these kind of topics and that makes them totally unique and different from everyone else. Not to forget that their vocals and rap are unbelievably astonishing. Favourite songs: Hip; Egotistic; Gogobebe; Yes I Am; Starry Night; Mr. Ambiguous & Taller Than You   2. MONSTA X I think they're one of the most underappreciated K-pop groups of all time. Their discography is amazing. I haven't got words to describe the feeling that i have for their songs. Favourite songs: Fantasia; Follow; Shout out; Who Do You Love; Jealousy; Alligator; Beautiful; Play It Cool & Monsta Truck   1. BTS Literally every song of theirs i've listened until now is GOLD and i really mean it when i say so. Plus, their personalities are very unique and i think that, along with GOT7 and EXO, they're one of the most humble and respectful Kpop group right now. Favourite songs: I Need U; Run; Dope; Save Me; Danger; Not Today; Spring Day; DNA; Mic Drop; Blood, Sweat & Tears; Fake Love; Epiphany; Idol; Boy With Luv;On & Black Swan   That's my ranking. You don't need to agree fully with this since it's my opinion & don't need to attack me either (i'm saying this because i've seen many Kpop fans, who are very toxic and immature). Remember to enjoy each sunset for the promise of a new tomorrow and to stay safe & healthy.  See you around ~lina

I really like a lot of groups, but I’m going to list groups that have not been listed yet (or at least, I think; I might end up repeating some): MYNAME  They debuted in 2011, and are incredibly underrated. They’ve had to promote in Japan because of this, has not had their first win despite being a group of seven years, and are extremely talented. Recently, 4 of the members (as Insoo went to military training) went on the show The Uni+, however, none of them made it to the top 9 (Seyong was very close though). Their last Korean comeback was in 2015, and I painfully wait for their next promotion. They deserve so much more attention, please love them! NU’EST  They debuted in 2012, and are labelmates with SEVENTEEN (whom I love just as much). 4 of them participated on the show Produce 101 Season 2 (I think Aron had an injury, so he didn’t join them), in which Minhyun made it to the top 11 and is to promote with Wanna One until the end of 2018. Due to this, they’ve been promoting as NU’EST W (W standing for ‘wait’, as in waiting for Minhyun) and had their first win after 5 years with “Where You At”. They really deserve love! F(X)  Their last song as a group was 4 Walls, which was back in 2015. Among other SM Entertainment girl groups, I feel like SM promotes f(x) the least and it makes me really sad, because I truly love them. All members are talented, so please love them! Love former member Sulli as well, as she has many haters for some reason (although she doesn’t mind them at all, she’s such a queen). A.C.E  I got into A.C.E after I originally posted this, so I’m adding them onto this list! They’re also quite underrated. I promise they’re literally the most talented group I’ve ever seen. They’re all visuals too; Donghun’s my bias, hahah. Jason, Donghun, and Wow were on MixNine, while Jun and Chan were the Uni+. They’re a rookie group whom only debuted in May 2017, and yet they were on survival shows. Please stan them!! ONEUS  Aha, another group I stanned after I posted this! I got into them in March and they’re extremely talented and well-diverse- literally, 6 vocalists, 6 dancers, 6 rappers. I love all of them so much and I saw them in November (and I’m still missing them). They’re all totally precious and cute, but also so charismatic on stage, so please consider being a fan of them! I don’t use Quora anymore but I was willing to edit this post just for my ONEUS boys. Three of the members were on Produce 101 Season 2 (Seoho [previously known as Gunmin], Keonhee [previously romanized as Gunhee], and Hwanwoong), as well as two of the members being on MIXNINE (Seoho again, RAVN, and Leedo auditioned but didn’t pass, poor boy). ONEWE  And if I’m going to do ONEUS, I have to do ONEWE too. As the brother band if ONEUS, they’re also equally just as talented and cute. One member is a twin of the youngest member in ONEUS (I love both of them a lot, also because they’re both born my year). That same member, Dongmyeong, has also been on Produce 101, and then the whole band was on The Uni+. They’re super underrated, and they’re also really funny (as to when a media outlet got the members name wrong so they wrote their hands on their palm the next time they showed up for a performance). — Other groups you should stan as well: HotshotThe Eastlight (unofficially disbanded: the two brothers have left, Eunsung has enlisted, Sagang and Junwook are doing their own thing, and Woojin deleted/archived all of his posts on Instagram)KARDPentagon (I still need to get into them too)ASTROVIXX— Personally, I think all groups deserve love, as they’re all very qualified with their talents and deserve more attention (unless they do something unforgivably problematic, of course).

A-HA, I love these kinds of questions! Well, there’s 3 groups that I currently ult, and 2 that I still stan but doesn’t keep up much. Those groups are: Stray Kids [wallpaper created by fan @/etherealstraykids, btw] *deep breath* *insert Wonder Girls lyrics* My first love story…. So, apparently it was My Pace era and at that time I’m still ulting [spoiler alert, so i’m not telling you] and since they come from JYP I subsribed to them and received notifications of SKZ’s My Pace comeback. I thought to give them a try because they’re all the hype now, why not? At first listen I thought My Pace was really catchy, especially during the Nanananana part. I subconciously came to the MV everyday, and I felt like knowing them, so I dig all infos that involve Stray Kids in it. I watched a lot of variety shows and thought, ‘crap, they’re funny and really really attractive,,, who’s the guy with the chubby cheeks?’ I surprisingly took a lot of quizzes to get their faces and names right, it definitely took days to differentiate Seungmin and Hyunjin (lol). Anyways, after a while I became almost o b s e s s e d with Stray Kids I complain why there isn’t enough merch of them (maybe because they’re still rookies at the time). My bias was Jisung and it still is except that my wreckers are now my bias [Hyunjin and Chan] while my wreckers are,,, truthfully, the rest of them HJSHSJ I CAN’T CHOOSE!!! Seungmin has been wrecking me constantly with his vocals, cuteness and savageness, Jeongin is such a pure babey im,,, Woojin is so goodlooking I forgot how to spell goodlooking for a second there, Changbin is a small rapper that has LOTS of potential, Minho the 4D one and most savage and Felix with his devilish voice and angel personality. Their personalities vary and I think they’re EXTRA and they are a very crackhead-oriented group (JYP gimme your organic foods). MAMAMOO  Mamamoo are the full balanced package: MOONBYUL the main rapper can do a hIGH NOTE effortlessly, SOLAR is a cutie that has a really nice voice, HWASA with her charisma and on-stage presence and lovely WHEEIN being the elegant woman we know today. Not only that, they are really entertaining to watch because they’re CRAZY! nope, they’re not crackheads. They’re crazies. I thought that they were weak on vocals (but can still sing nonetheless) and are cringey, but over time I think BLACKPINK are below TWICE (not in any way I’m hating on Blackpink, I’m just saying Twice improved a lot before Blackpink could). Son Chaeyoung is a smol rapper that has a real nice voice (HONESTLY JYP GIVE HER MORE VOCAL LINES) , Hirai Momo is a great dancer that over time, her stamina and skills improved, Minatozaki Sana, a natural aegyoist (CHEESE KIMBAP) and also a great singer, Chou Tzuyu, visual maknae that has lots of potential and apparently one of the most stable singers in TWICE, Park Jihyo, best leader and best vocalist, Im Nayeon, bunny singer with an also natural aegyo and tomboy qualities a bit, Jeon Jeongyeon, the girl-crush vocalist, Myoui Mina, a black swan that has a soothing voice and pure visuals, and last but not least Kim Dahyun the funniest, craziest, 100-eyed girl of TWICE with well-balanced skills. Thanks, BTS! Got7~ They’re really nice, and like just like twice and skz they eat organic food! I stanned for only a short while tho. Sorry Got7, but then again I would’nt

I don’t stan very many groups, but here’s a rough list: BTS I’ve just got to say—when I first found BTS, I knew there was something different about them. Being able to rise from a tiny, near-bankrupt company to the top of the industry takes talent, and of course, loads of blood, sweat, and tears. They have worked so hard and I also just really love their music. Each track on each album has a memorable chorus and interesting variations, not to mention their meaningful lyrics and the fact that they write all of their own songs. Another thing that I really love about them is that when you are watching an interview, or an episode of RUN BTS, you can really never get bored, and they seem to truly have really interesting and different personalities. Times are really hard right now and I think this is having an effect on them but I hope they can cheer up (힘내~)! I was actually supposed to see them on their MOTS:7 tour and will hopefully soon! 2. IU  I know, i know, she is not a group, but I just wanted to add her to this list because I think IU (Lee Ji-eun) is absolutely amazing. She has a beautiful voice, and so many amazing songs! I mean, even as a hardcore ARMY, I seriously considered putting her in here first! She is also a beautiful and wonderful actress, starring in Hotel Del Luna, Moon Lovers: Scarlet Heart Ryeo, Persona, etc. Her live vocals are amazing and she just looks like a total doll 🙂 3. TWICE  My favorite girl group is definitely TWICE. I mean, it pretty much goes without saying—amazing visuals, catchy songs, and just… everything! 4. Mamamoo  I mean, there’s not much to say. These four women are so strong and powerful, I love their music, and I just really look up to them a lot. 5. TOMORROW BY TOGETHER (TXT)  Ok, as an ARMY, I really am Big Hit-biased, but I’ve got to say, these boys amaze me! After debuting only a little more than a year ago, they already have three albums and I see the same thing as what I see in BTS—not a SINGLE non-memorable track on each album. I believe that they will follow in their sunbae’s footsteps and are headed to becoming world stars! 6. Seventeen  Again, I may be just a liiiiiiitle bit Big Hit-biased, but I really love Seventeen as well! 7. Ateez  I haven’t, in my opinion, listened to enough of their songs to form a strong opinion, but I really loved every track their album Treasure Ep.3: One To All. I’ll keep an eye on this group! 8. ITZY  Again, I don’t think I’ve listened to enough of their songs to form a real opinion, but I liked what I saw! The girl crush vibe was really good, and their MVs that I watched were catchy! They seemed to have great dances as well. (I may also really like Chaeryoung after watching Sixteen and hating it when she was eliminated…) Definitely keeping an eye on this semi-rookie group! 9. EXO  As a hardcore ARMY, I know there was a lot of beef between ARMYs and Exo-Ls, but I hope we can all come past that together and stop fandom wars :) Also, I really like Baekhyun after he was in Moon Lovers with IU ❤️ 10. Stray Kids or NCT 127   I’m technically cheating and adding another slot here, but I really couldn’t choose between the two. They both have some songs that I like but I don’t really stan them (Except NCT Mark, he’s great). FINAL COMMENT: I know there were some groups that people will probably be surprised not to see in here—Blackpink, Red Velvet, Gfriend, AOA, maybe even some of the older groups. I don’t really listen to the older music like first or second gen, and I haven’t really listened enough to RV, GF, or AOA’s songs enough to make any opinion at all. Blackpink I probably would stan, if they had more than 12 and more different-sounding songs, and if the fandom was not so toxic. Anyway, that’s all~ Thanks if you read this far!~zAyNa

My ultimate groups that I'm proud to say that I never went through a “it took me a while but I finally like their music” phase are EXO, RedVelvet, Twice and NCT. For other groups I really had to get myself to like them:( So here's reasons why these are my four fave groups. TWICE  I casually listened to TT by Twice some time ago. I never got to even finish the song for some reason, so I just forgot TWICE existed for months. That was until Fancy! I stumbled across it by accident and realized oh these are those girls! Everything in the video gave me goosebumps from the beginning, but the cherry on top was Dahyun! I love them and I think they're really talented and very beautiful! I don't know a single twice song I dislike:) NCT  I really don't care how many they are, if you know a group with so much talent packed into it, then why aren't you stanning? Lol I'm just kidding. Honestly NCT is almost untouchable when it comes to talent, though I think they need a few more vocalists. It actually didn't take me as long as it took other groups to learn their faces and names. All of their sub units are lit af too! Can we also talk about their visuals too? They all look amazing, that's all I can say:) Edit: okay so I'm eating my words after saying they need more vocalists because even their rappers have mind blowing voices! Damn! RedVelvet  I think RedVelvet are the best female kpop vocalists of this third generation! They kill both red and velvet sides perfectly! I started to Stan during Sappy era, and let's just say they blew my hat off with their voices and visuals! They're all very beautiful, and their fandom is so unproblematic! EXO  I have to admit after discovering EXO through Loveshot, I immediately liked them. I had a bunch of their songs on my phone I'd listen to for months, but I wasn't seeing their faces so I didn't even know I supported any group called “EXO”. It was until I decided to watch an MV of them that I was shook! I'm just gonna say they all look like freaking gods! And their voices are amazing as well! I really respect a group where even the rappers can sing amazingly good:) Edit: understatement these men are gods! I'm smitten   Other groups I immediately loved without needing to get used to them are; GOT7MamamooMomolandMonstaX etcThe list goes on, but these are on the top of my list:) thanks for reading Quora's best friend

My favorite K-pop band ever - 2NE1 I just discovered them recently after becoming an ARMY. Sadly they already disbanded. But Dara, CL, Bom and Minzy are forever in my heart, every single of their song is so beautiful, amazing and relatable. Forever a Blackjack. Wow, I just love everything about them. And I think there would never be another girl group. ever, could replace their space in my heart. Forever my queens.  You may have watched concept of many K-pop girl group: thin, tall, cute with similar face and choreography dance. But 2NE1 is a hundred percent different. They can put on the most craziest outfit that you could never think people can wear but still look so cool. They can have the most weirdest hairstyle that you never could imagine but still look amazing. They were considered “ugly” compared to the Korean beauty standard when they debuted but they have conquered the most difficult audience and made history and even they made a song called UGLY. Their music - all in Korean - yet you can just watch them sing and could understand feel the pain, the joy, the happiness, the story and all the emotion they put in their songs. I don’t have my 2NE1’s favorite song cause I love every single piece of their music. It is like - whatever they released a new song, it has to be great. Their live performance - they do not need choreography dances like others but they put each of their stage presence ON FIRE. You can watch the last performance before the fatal date in here . Their power, their confidence and their energy, there are no words that could express. I do not have my bias in the group because I just like all of them. The four girls are totally different but they harmonize so well under the name 2NE1. DARA Visual of the group. Perhaps because she is the most beautiful member of the group or perhaps she is in a group full of talents that she has always been considered incompetent. People say she cannot sing or dance well. Yet she has overcome all critics and proves them all wrong.  MINZY Being considered the least beautiful member, she is the typical sample of how “TALENT BEATS APPEARANCE”. She was chosen by the YG’s CEO to be a trainee since she was just 12. She does not have to be show off any part of her body cause she is already so attractive with her voice, her dance moves and her stage presence.  BOM She can be cute and sexy at the time. She can do some very sexy dance moves and still looks so cute. And her voice is like an angel. She had been into a big scandal in her career and I really hope she could come back and give us more amazing music  CL The greatest leader, the greatest rapper and the most badass singer I have ever know. Every time I see her perform, she is just so powerful, energetic and charming and so caring to all of her sisters.  I just have a simple wish that one day, they can reunite and again put the stage on fire. Forever a Blackjack!!!

I feel that BTS is an obvious choice (don't get me wrong, I love them) but here are some others. (all boy groups, since I don't really stan any girl groups.) -Stray Kids. Fandom: STAY. Most recent song? Astronaut. Songs I recommend? I Am You, Miroh, Maze of Memories, Hellevator. I would say they have a nice mix of upbeat and serious songs, but they are more upbeat than not, at least in some aspect. -NCT. Fandom: NCTzens. There are three sub-units, so I'll give one song recommendation for each. NCT U: Boss. This got me into NCT. NCT 127: Chain. NCT Dream: Boom. The first song I liked by the Dreamies. I would definitely say that their songs are pretty upbeat. -ATEEZ. Fandom: ATINYs. Most recent song? Wonderland. Songs I recommend? Say My Name, Wave, Treasure, Hala Hala. I would say that they are more often upbeat than not. -AB6IX. Fandom Name: ABNEW. Most recent song? Blind For Love. Songs I recommend? Breathe, Dandelion, Blind For Love, Pretty. I would say that their songs give off more of a "soft" vibe, still upbeat but maybe slower, or have more serious aspects. -VICTON. Fandom Name: Alice. Most recent song? I am a new fan, and Nostalgic Night is the most recent MV, so I'm assuming that's it. Songs I recommend? New World, Farewell, Nostalgic Night, Here I Am. From what I've heard, I would say they are a bit like Stray Kids in how often their songs are upbeat. -ONEUS. Fandom name: To Moon. Most recent song? Lit. Songs I recommend? ZigZag, English Girl, Valkyrie, Eye Contact. I would say that their songs are more like AB6IX's, soft. Lit was pretty upbeat though. -A.C.E. Fandom Name? Choice. Most recent song? Savage. Songs I recommend? Under Cover, Cactus, Mr. Bass, Savage. I would say that their songs have more of a "rock" aspect to them. More hardcore. -TXT. Fandom Name: MOA. Most recent song? They came out with a new album a few weeks ago, but the most recent MV is Magic Island. Songs I recommend? Blue Orangeade, Run Away, Magic Island, Our Summer. I would say that again, they have the same type of songs as AB6IX. -There are a couple other groups that I like a few songs by, but I wouldn't necessarily consider myself a fan of them, since I don't know enough about the members or songs. Here are they and songs I like by them: -MONSTA X. Fandom: Monbebes. Songs? Follow, Dramarama. I would say that their songs sound like a mixture of rock and upbeat, like if you mashed Stray Kids and A.C.E.'s songs together. -UP10TION. Fandom: Honey10. Songs? Blue Rose, Your Gravity. Again, I haven't really listened to many of their songs, but Blue Rose seems more serious while Your Gravity is upbeat. -SEVENTEEN. Fandom: Carats. Songs? Home, Hit. Hit was pretty upbeat, but from what I've heard their songs are a little slower. (AB6IX vibes again) -Dreamcatcher. (Girl Group) Fandom: InSomnia. Songs? PIRI, Deja Vu. Definitely sounds more like rock than pop. -WINNER. Fandom: Inner Circle. Songs? SOSO, Really Really. SOSO was definitely more serious, while Really Really just makes you feel happy. -The Rose. Fandom: Black Rose. Songs? Baby and Beautiful Girl (However, Beautiful Girl is sung by only the leader and a member form another group.) Again, more of a rock aspect. 💞💞💞

There are numerous talented kpop groups out there but here are my top 10 :) 10. Red Velvet These girls are extremely talented and have great vocals! I’m always pleased with their albums (including their side tracks) and they’re all in all the perfect girl group. But with that being said, I don’t really see myself being involved with them more than listening to their music as I find their lives as well as variety show presence not so entertaining or energetic. Hence, justifying their place at number 10. Bias: Seulgi  9. Super Junior Okay these men are so widely loved and looked up to and it’s not for no reason! They are so extremely talented, have amazing stage presence and don’t even get me started on their discography. They are hilarious and they will remain iconic regardless of the number of years that pass! Bias: Heechul  8. BigBang Well….It’s sad that I had to move them down the list when they really deserved to be in the top 5. There’s no doubt that Seungri is cancelled but it’s hard to unstan the group for that reason alone. Sure the others have been in a few scandals as well but they don’t deserve what they’re gonna get when they come back from the military. They’re so so talented and worked so hard (especially GD) to achieve what they did and even be called as the “Kings of KPOP” at a point of time. The opened up kpop to so many international fans and brought life to award shows and variety shows. I’m disappointed at Seungri for his actions but…I hope the rest still have a comeback and regain their lost place in the industry once again! Bias: Taeyang  7. Girls Generation Okay these queens are the ones who got me into kpop many years ago! Their music, visuals, performances justify their place in the hearts of the hundreds of sones all around the world. Despite their popularity, these girls are down to earth and it’s such a pleasure to see them on variety shows (especially running man). Their solos are doing great and Oh GG’s debut was a hit! I really hope SM promotes them more :) Bias: Taeyeon/Yoona  6. Exo The best male vocalists of kpop. End of Discussion. Their discography is once again flawless and the members are talented as hell! They’ve gathered so much support despite going through their own share of hardships. Having one of the largest fandoms in the world, I truly believe that it’s the fans that keep them going! I hope SM stops sleeping on their promotions and give us a comeback really soon! Bias: Baekhyun  5. BlackPink First of all, their comeback was a huge success! Kill this love is a bop and the girls are making it big this year! I love that they produce the kind of music that’s forever iconic you know? They’re definitely the type of group I see myself stanning but I feel it’s the lack of representation and songs that’s preventing me from getting in too deep. Anyways it’s great to see that people are still supporting them and that they’re getting love from both Korean as well as international fans despite all the hate that they’re receiving. Let’s hope that we have another comeback this year! Bias: Rosé  4. Mamamoo I’m not going to lie, I’ve always appreciated their music but I’ve only recently been very into them and the fact that they’ve made it up so high on the list in a short period of time says something. They are the most talented girl group in kpop. I said it. They have amazing vocals and are well equipped in all fields of entertainment. They are so so down to earth and are hilarious! They don’t mind being themselves and that makes them so unique and different from other groups which makes me love them even more! Ofcourse they’ve had the blackface incident but they weren’t aware and even apologised for their actions so it’s about time ppl stop holding that against them! Their music never disappoints and I hope they get more recognition in the future! Bias: Moonbyul/Wheein  3. Seventeen They have the best music in kpop. Period. Despite having so many members, each of them shine in their own way and I Guess that’s what makes them so special. Their choreographies are the best and their live performances are absolutely worth watching! Their fandom is such a beautiful community and don’t even get me started on their lightstick haha. They are hilarious and I love how they portray themselves on tv. Their concepts and units are refreshing. Good to Me is the best song I’ve heard in 2019 and I can’t wait for further releases. Bias: DK/Wonwoo/Mingyu/Woozi  2. Stray Kids When people may say that they became popular too fast and find that as a reason to hate on them, I really don’t think so. They became popular for a reason, and that reason is called talent. They produce amazing music and gained popularity on their own and not just due to the Big 3 advantage. It’s cute to see them grow on variety shows and it’s safe to say that these boys are lovable. They really have one of the best and welcoming fandoms and I can’t wait to see more of their content in the future..haven’t been with them from the beginning but will definitely stay till the end :) Bias: Felix/Bang Chan/Hyunjin  1.BTS Okay I’m going to try to make this as short as possible and cut down on the fangirling. These boys are just so special in everything that they do. They’ve helped me go through so much and continue to put a smile on my face every single day. No, they aren’t overrated. They deserve everything that they get and so much more after all that they’ve been through. The message that they carry and whole BTS universe phenomena with the notes and webtoons are so unique! Their music is undoubtedly amazing and carry so much emotion through the lyrics! The boys work so hard to serve their fans and their loyalty and passion is what makes me want to support them for as Long as it takes! Sure the fandom contains toxicity but so does every other fandom. It’s just more prevelant in larger ones and it’s not a reason to hate on the boys themselves. They don’t only act as a source of happiness but also bring out happiness from within each of their fans! Bias: Jungkook (but what even is a bias)  Thank You for reading if you’ve made it this far!

At the moment? Ateez, A.C.E, VAV and Mamamoo. Traditionally? Big Bang, BAP, 2PM, Cross Gene (but the last clip I saw of them buying food together made me feel so sad), Block B, Day6, Winner - gosh there are so many … I also like EXO, BTS, The Rose, BVNDIT, Itzy, Oneus, NFlying, KNK, Ab6ix, MonstaX, SF9, Got7, Nu’est, Kard, Vixx, Halo, Spectrum, Shinee, TVXQ, Sechskies, iKon, probably a heap of others I can’t think of right now. 3YE could be interesting? A 3 girl hip hop group. I have a love hate relationship with groups like NCT but I guess I could say the same about MonstaX (I didn’t like Alligator) but I loved NCT’s Baby Don’t Stop and Boss. Both groups come across well in interviews. I know Stray Kids are very popular and their earlier songs I quite like but not so much now. I love the Australian accents.
