I love Yoonseok/Sope I know many ARMYs ship Yoonmin much more than Yoonseok, but I can’t see it. Jimin is a very loving person and mostly shows it through physical actions. Many clips will show Jimin latching on to a member or just straight being touchy with them. This is mainly because in Korea they’re much more touchy than people in America, so when they become more physical with another it’s usually shown as a mere friendship. However, I’ve seen Yoonseok encounter one another and they seem so comfortable with one another. Of course all the members are comfortable with each other since they’ve been together for over six years now, but Hoseok and Yoongi seem to be close in a different way. When they’re around each other they seem so balanced. Yoongi is usually grumpy and/or sleepy, and Hoseok is usually loud and/or active. They seem like opposites and would be the two members that don’t get along as well as they would with the others, but this is quite false. There are times when Hoseok is doing his own thing (entertaining another member or just flat out being loud) and Yoongi would suddenly join in and vice versa. Not to mention they have known each other longer than Yoongi had known Jimin. Jimin was the last and final member to join the roster for BTS. Before he came Hoseok was originally suppose to be a vocalist, but he wanted to try rapping. He didn’t know how to rap at the time, and Yoongi, with the help of Namjoon, taught him how. He soon traded places with Taehyung (who was originally suppose to be a rapper but became a vocalist) and became the third member of the rap line. Also both being rappers they tend to be closer just by their roles in the group. If you got this far thank you for reading all this. Simply search Youtube for Yoonseok and you’ll see what I mean.

I don’t have an outright favorite, but I’ve shown the most consistent dedication to these bands (I define “consistent dedication” by saying I know a good 75–80%, if not all of their songs, I’m subscribed to their main channels, watch music videos and shows within a week of release, and know at least a decent bit of trivia concerning the members): BTS - After stumbling across their music video of Blood, Sweat, and Tears, I bought the entire Wings album, no regrets. It was the first K-Pop album I bought. Fast forward a few weeks of scanning YouTube for more performances, interviews, and funny moments, I committed to purchasing their other main tracks (honestly, thank goodness for Spotify, it saved my bank account) and accepted the fact that I had fallen into the ARMY trap. I was immediately drawn to Taehyung and Jimin, but ultimately I think each member is individually and uniquely talented, I adore their teasingly supportive group dynamic, and I enjoy their overarching concept (from the story behind their lyrics and range of musical style, to their light-hearted interactions in Run BTS, and their visuals overall). I’m proud to call BTS my first K-pop love, and I wish them well through their upcoming seasons.  I mean, of course, I’m loving the glow up, but fight me, Blood, Sweat, and Tears was their best era.  Monsta X - I accidentally clicked on a video of Kihyun singing a capella and fell hard for his pure tone. From there I started listening to some of their more popular tracks, found I really enjoyed their edgier vibe and strong beats. I admired their stage presence, technically challenging dances, and after watching the addictively entertaining Monsta X-Ray, I couldn’t help but stan these hard-working, brilliant, hilarious members. I’ll admit, I don’t really want to go to a BTS concert (too many screaming fans makes me claustrophobic, and too expensive), but after hearing that Monsta X is coming to the USA, I low-key high-key really hope to score a ticket. They deserve more recognition…I’m so glad that their newest releases have been trending!  Mamamoo - I was initially more into boy groups than girl groups, as I tend to shy away from more cute concepts in general. Mamamoo defied my every pre-conceived expectation. They are undeniably attractive without aligning with the more stereotypical K-pop female visuals, each member has distinct vocals that are necessary to the group’s harmony, and their songs tend to resonate in my head longer than almost any other group (aside from the two previously mentioned). I freely admit to having an obsession with Hwasa, but honestly, all four of these women are queens. And yes, they slay.  Other than these three groups, lately I’ve been listening to a handful of tracks from these (I know more than just their title/top songs, but I’m not as dedicated long-term): SHINee, Twice, Red Velvet, GOT7, Stray Kids, EXO

There’s quite a few of them: BTS (Seokjin biased)  My first impression of them… Wasn’t very nice. But that changed. Now, they became one of the reasons why I smile every day. They changed my perspective on life, turned me into a better person, made me happier. It’s only enough to look at their picture and I’ll smile like an idiot. Stanning them was definetely one of the best decisions I have ever made. Sure, I love other groups very much but no other group can compare to the connection that I share with Bangtan. I really can’t explain it. I’m just glad that I found them. I won’t take it for granted. 2PM (Junho biased)  I regret not stanning this group earlier. I only found out about them this June and since then I couldn’t get their music out of my head. It only took one look to know that they will definetely be one of my favourite groups. Seriously, their vocals and dance moves are beast. Members are also very handsome and they all share likable personalities. It’s impossible not to love them. Now, they haven’t been active since 2016 because of their enlistments and stuff but I’m telling you, once they come back, it won’t be good for your faves. Also, this is an OT7 picture with Jaebeom since my crying ass can’t get over him. GOT7 (Kunpimook biased)  This group. Seriously. It’s impossible not to love them. Their bond with each other just hits different. They were never a group for me bout a family. Stanning them really feels like that. Like you’re a part of a big happy family. We may have some ups and downs but we’ll always find a way to be happy at the end of the day. The boys have always been questioned if their voices, performances and music in general were worth it but trust me, they are. The passion and hard work they put into music is out of this world. Kpop found a wrong group to understimate. If anyone deserves more respect and attention, it’s definetely GOT7. Blackpink (Chaeyoung biased)  Hate or disagree with me as much as you want, I don’t care. Hear me up first. Trust me, the girls didn’t train over 4–5 years to be treated like this by their company and be disliked by most of the Kpop community. They always get called out for their inactivity but that’s not even their fault. It’s their company’s fault for not treating them the way they deserve. When it comes to Blackpink, people would always focus on the bad things. They may have only 10+ songs but it sure was more then enough for me to acknowledge the talent the girls have in themselves. That’s why I’ll awalys support them and hope for their situation to get better. But if you look at it this way, they only needed less then 20 songs to became world’s most popular female Kpop group so yeah… They INDEED are talented. Sips tea. TXT (Beomgyu biased)  Okay. They are my babies. I agree that I may have started stanning them because they are BTS’ junior group but they justified that title soon after that and now they’re one of my favourite Kpop groups ever. Do you even see how Yeonjun looks in this picture, oh my God. Okay, I’ll shut up now and continue. See, their talent can’t be handled, literally the whole group raps, sings and dances well. They fit into every possible concept they tried so far. I feel like they may be mistreated by Kpop community because they’re BTS’ juniors, but trust me, they’re more than that and one day they will prove it to you all. They definetely deserved the title of Rookies Of The Year. This is just the beggining for the boys and I can’t wait to continue this journey with them till the end. Mamamoo (Wheein biased)  I’ve been stanning them since forever. Back in the days where Kpop wasn’t my first choice of music, these girls have always been my number 1 girl group. They’re talented, of course, but their personalities are also golden and something that made me fall in love with them in the first place. They’re making a change by fighting against stereotypes in Korea and they’re putting up a good picture for younger girls who look up to them. They totally should. Also, members aren’t even fluent English speakers but they’re still making a name for themselves in Western countries. I’m not even surprised, their harmony and talents shouldn’t go unnoticed or unappreciated. Honorable mentions: Stray Kids (Jeongin biased) iKON (Jinhwan biased) (I lost my Kpop virginity with this group lol. They may not be one of my ultimate groups but I will forever respect them and be thankful for showing me this beautiful place called Kpop) EXO (Baekhyun biased) Shinee (Jonghyun biased, sleep well angel♥) Seventeen (Jihoon biased) NCT (Mark biased) NCT Dream (Jaemin biased) NCT 127 (Yoonoh biased) NCT U (Taeyong biased) WayV (Dejun biased) (I’m an NCT trash I know) GFriend (Sojung biased) Oneus (Hwanwoong biased) SuperM (Taemin biased) B1A4 (Junghwan biased) Twice (Dahyun biased) Everglow (Eunji biased) Pentagon (Hongseok biased) Momoland (Joowon biased)

The Top 10 K-Pop Entertainment Companies in 2019 K-pop is still bigger than ever. It is growing every day not just in Asia but all around the world. Furthermore, K-pop Entertainment companies are reporting all-time high profits and pop groups are getting global exposure. Recently BTS performed on SNL which made them the first Korean musical performer on the show. Therefore, Korea’s main asset still continues to be K-Pop as K-Pop entertainment companies continue to find new talent. Most of these K-Pop companies/agenciesare looking to expand outside of Korea and into other Asian markets as well as the United States. People all over the world want K-Pop more than ever. K-pop is a blend of electronic, hip-hop, pop, rock, R&B, and even rap. Currently, K-pop is a $5 billion global industry. The Battle for the Top Spot Most of the Korean Entertainment companies are listed on KOSDAQ (SM Entertainment, YG Entertainment, JYP Entertainment, FNC Entertainment, and CUBE Entertainment). Both SM and YG Entertainment have been the two most dominant over the last decade. However, with all the K-pop scandals that YG faced in 2018, JYP and SM are now battling it out for the top spot. For this ranking we at Seoulz took into account three factors: Talent rosterMarket CapitalizationFuture PotentialThis is our comprehensive list of the Best K-Pop Entertainment Companies in 2019 1.Big Hit Entertainment  The success of Big Hit Entertainment is because of ONE group and one group only…BTS. In addition, BTS has been having one of the most successful runs of all time. Big Hit was just a small company and in 2007 they were on the brink of bankruptcy. But with BTS they were able to create one of the biggest boy groups of all time. BTS is a 7 member boy band and they have already sold millions of albums and their YouTube videos are some of the most-watched videos on Youtube. BTS was not an overnight sensation. They debuted in 2013. BTS stands for Bangtan Sonyeondan which translates to Bulletproof Boy Scouts. Now BTS stands for Beyond the Scene. A Huge Boom to the Korean Economy It is estimated that BTS added $3.8 billion to the Korean economy in 2018. This number could double in 2019. The band could generate $40 billion over the next decade for the South Korean economy. They first came to the US in 2014. The group was living in LA and learning about western culture. They even played at LA K-Con. They have since collaborated with Nicki Minaj, Halsey, and Ed Sheeran. In 2017 won billboard award for top social artists. Beating Justin Bieber and Selena Gomez. In 2018 BTS partnered with UNICEF, Converse, Coca Cola, Puma, and Hyundai. Their stadium shows around the world quickly sold out. In 2019 they performed at Soldier Field and Metlife Stadium generating over $30 million in ticket sales. Their Love Yourself/Face Yourself Tour has generated over $100 million. Top Social Media K-Pop Group They are very connected to their loyal fans who are called Army. BTS used social media to make themselves available and visible. The Band had full control of their social media. They were able to show their fans what was going on backstage. BTS has only one band account. One account per platform. For example, Youtube, Instagram, Twitter. Big Hit Entertainment has over 27 million subscribers on YouTube which goes to show their potential market cap once they have their IPO. Therefore, once they do they will crush all competition. This is why Bit Hit Entertainment is #1 in our rankings. Artists: BTS, TXT, TOMORROW Estimated Market Cap: $1.5 Billion 2. SM Entertainment  They are now battling JYP for the 2nd spot. The company has focused a lot on the Chinese market in 2018. They will look to continue that in 2019. After getting investments from Alibaba and now Tencent, their popularity grew even more in China. If you check out their youtube channel they have over 19 million subscribers. Data shows that over 90% of the subscribers are not Korea. In addition, a vast majority are from China. Their strategic partnership with Tencent Music Entertainment will help SM Entertainment’s distribution and marketing in the Chinese music market. SM even has a Chinese boy band called WayV. Breaking into the Chinese Market China is one of the leaders in the music streaming space. Tencent Music Entertainment has close to 900 million monthly users across four of the top music service platforms in China. To put that into context, Spotify has just under 200 million monthly active users. Through the partnership, Tencent Music Entertainment will have access to SM’s entire music catalog. SM’s music and video platform sales have grown close to 50% from last year. SM’s yearly YouTube views have reached just under 8 billion by the end of 2018. Their top female K-pop group at the moment is Red Velvet which is doing their first solo tour in the United States. Their top male K-pop group Super Junior is doing a tour around South America. SM is planning to create an American version of Girl’s Generation as well as a European version of NCT. Artists: S.E.S., Kangta, BoA, TVXQ!, CSJH, Super Junior, Girl’s Generation, J-Min, EXO, Shinee, f(x), Zhou Mi, NCT, and Red Velvet. Estimated Market Cap: $970 Million 3. JYP Entertainment  JYP was founded in 1997 by J.Y. Park. The company has been known for making the careers of K-pop legends such as Wonder Girls, Rain, and Miss A just to name a few. Their YouTube channel has over 12 million subscribers. Their current hottest group TWICE has over 3.5 million followers on Twitter and Instagram combined. While the company has focused a lot on China, JYP focused a lot on Japan. TWICE broke all the records for K-pop girl groups in Japan. The loss of Suzy will hurt JYP, but what JYP does best to find talent from all around the world. They hold auditions all across Asia. Entering the Japanese Market TWICE and GOT7 will continue to focus on Japan as both are gaining a lot of popularity there. But the company will look to support their 2019 projects Mix Nine and Stray Kids. They recently formed a partnership with The Orchard in hopes of expanding their reach outside of Korea. The Orchard is a part of Sony Music Entertainment. They are in charge of global digital and physical distribution. This will help JYP enter the U.S. and European markets in 2019. Artists: 2PM, TWICE, GOT7, DAY6, 15&, Stray Kids and ITZY Estimated Market Cap: $980 Million 4. YG Entertainment  What a terrible year for YG Entertainment. Their biggest female K-pop star CL wants out of her contract. Then they are hit with the biggest sex scandal to ever hit Korea. We will get to that a little later. The K-pop entertainment companies have all suffered due to the scandal of Seungri. LVMH invested $80 into YG Entertainment and China’s social media giant Tencent and its related online ticketing company Weiying Technology agreed to invest $85 million into YG Entertainment in 2016. Weiying owns 8.2% of YG and Tencent owns 4.5%. They also got a huge partnership/investment from Naver, South Korea’s largest internet portal for around $90 million (9% equity stake). Their current top group is Black Pink who are traveling across Asia in early 2019. They have also partnered with Universal Music Group’s representative label, Interscope. Winner will also look to start their U.S. tour in 2019. The Seungri Scandal However, the key to YG will be the comeback of Big Bang after most have now finished their military service. But is that possible with the Seungri scandal? Investors have already started to sell their shares of YG Entertainment and by the end of 2019, it is possible that Big Hit Entertainment will surpass them. Seungri is facing jail time after allegations of drug use and sexual assaults at his nightclub Burning Sun. He has already posted on Instagram that he is quitting show business. YG Entertainment has a major PR problem they need to deal with. Big Bang is a major part of YG’s success. If they fail so will the company. They alone account for 40% of the companies total sales. Their strategy for 2019 will probably be to focus on Blackpink’s comeback. However, Blackpink cannot replace Big Bang. This should be an interesting year. Artists: 2NE1, BIG BANG, WINNER, 1TYM, DJ Tukutz, G-Dragon, Daesung, T.O.P., Taeyang, Kang Seung-Yoon, Minzy, Dara, Psy, Sandara Park, iKon, Seungri, Sechskies, Yang Hyun-Suk, Stony Skunk, Akdong Musician, Katie Kim, Lee Hi, Epik High, Tablo, Taebin, Teddy Park, iKONG, and MOBB, and Black Pink. Estimated Market Cap: $740 Million 5. FNC Entertainment  For FNC Entertainment 2018 was terrible. 2017 was better. 2018 brought a lot of scandals with F.T. Island and AOA. The company itself seems to lack leadership and it seems to have a lot of corruption and is one of the low trending K-pop entertainment companies. In 2017 things ran much smoother. FNC started to focus more on dance. FNC has been known for cool/hipe bands like CNBLUE, SF9, and AOA who have all transitioned into more of a dance group. TV vs Music However, the biggest star for FNC Entertainment is not even a K-Pop star but the famous Yoo Jae Suk who they signed in 2017. That signing alone rose FNC’s stock prices by 30% raising the company’s value to close to $300 million. Therefore FNC relies more on their T.V. talent than singers. This might be a good strategy moving forward as they will not be able to compete with the Big 3 and for sure not Big Hit. Veteran actors Lee Dong Gun will continue to help FNC as they look to split their talent base down the middle. SF9 is who FNC will focus the most on in 2019. They are looking to push them in Japan as well as Latin America. Their new female group Cherry Bullet will also debut in 2019. CNBLUE’s Jung Yong-hwa will leave the military in November of 2019 so a late CNBLUE comeback could be in the works. Artists: CNBLUE, FT Island, N. Flying, AOA, AOA Cream, Hong-gi, Yonghwa, Jimin, Choa, Jong-hyun, InnoVator, SF9, and Juniel. Estimated Market Cap: $120 million 6. Cube Entertainment  Cube Entertainment has found great success with their new group PENTAGON. PENTAGON looked to take the place of B2ST who left Cube Entertainment. This was an attempt to revive Cube Entertainment who has not had a great 2016 and has seen their stocks suffer continual losses even into 2017-2018. Cube’s success depended on PENTAGON‘s and CLC‘s debut and HyunA‘s comeback. With the loss of 4 minute and B2ST, it was crucial for PENTAGON and CLC to pick up the slack which they were unable to do. Losing BEAST was a crushing blow to Cube Entertainment. Add that to their failure to sign SISTAR and resign 4 Minute and many are wondering if Cube Entertainment can ever recover. Many questioned whether Cube Entertainment can take girl groups to the next level. It was not wise to launch HyunA‘s solo career so closely with 4 Minutes debut. As all the attention went to HyunA, 4 Minute just got left behind. In fact, looking back on Cube Entertainment’s history you can say their only A list hit was BEAST. Maybe they should think about restructuring their business model in regards to managing their artists. Artists: PENTAGON, BTOB, CLC, Yook Sungjae, Yoon Doojoon, HyunA, Ga Yoon, G. NA, Jang Hyun Seung, Lai Guanlin, and Lee Gikwang. Estimated Market Cap: $140 Million 7. Woollim Entertainment  Woollim Entertainment merged with SM Entertainment through SM C&C in 2013. However, three years later the two companies officially separated. Woollim Entertainment now is an independent company. Their main artists include INFINITE and Lovelyz. 2016 was all about the comeback of INFINITE and has been a success up to this point. 2017-2018 was all about INFINITE. The main topic was whether they would resign with Woollim Entertainment. The good news for Woollim was that they were able to sign INFINITE in 2018. Now they can focus on having an amazing 2019 as they make their first comeback. What can you expect in 2019? More of Golden Child? The main singer Choi Sung Yoon could be the next big K-Pop star in 2019. When they debut in August of 2017 with “DamDadi” there was a lot of buzz about them because of their youthfulness and high energy. The big acquisition of Woollim was Takahashi Juri of Japanese idol group AKB48. She will debut in a new girl group under Woollim Entertainment in 2019. This could be their long term plan to break into the Japanese market. They are one of the major K-pop entertainment companies that are aggressively looking to enter Japan. Artists: INFINITE, Lovelyz, JOO, Golden Child, and Nell Estimated Market Cap: $65 Million 8. Pledis Entertainment  Pledis Entertainment has had great success with their girl group After School over the past few years. However, many fans see After School as a one-hit-wonder because they have not made a lot of noise ever since “Because of You”. However, still to this day After School has a strong following in China and Japan and still ranks in the mid of Korean song charts. Orange Caramel and UEE were a success in 2017 but have fizzled out. Their main group is SEVENTEEN followed by PRISTIN and NU’EST. Those three groups will be pushed hard in 2019. Out of the three, only two have the potential to have a big global impact, SEVENTEEN, and NU’EST. Raina will be focusing a lot on YouTube. The Pledis YouTube channel has 825,000 subscribers. They have started to upload SEVENTEEN content on the Pledis channel in hopes of raising their subscriber numbers. Artists: NU’EST, SEVENTEEN, Orange Caramel, UEE, Han Don Geun, Pristin, and After School. Estimated Market Cap: $45 million 9. Starship Entertainment  FAVE Entertainment was formerly known as LOEN Entertainment and their subsidiary Starship Entertainment has had much success with their 12-member girl group Cosmic Girls and of course IU who is one of the biggest stars in Korea at the moment. IU is not only a musician but also a very successful actress. She is the driving force behind FAVE entertainment. Starship’s focus for 2019 will be to continue to look into the Chinese market and Cosmic Girls which consists of both Koreans and Chinese members is their best chance for it. With SISTAR resigned and on board, Starship will look to nurture their individual abilities for potential solo careers. Male group MONSTA X partnered with Cosmic Girls to form a new unit called Y TEEN. Y TEEN consists of 7 MONSTA X members and 7 Cosmic Girls members for a total of 14 members. This is Starships plan to appeal more to young girls. MONSTA X was Starships top group in 2018. Comeback group WJSN will continue to push their comeback album as well as continue acting. Boyfriend, solo artists K.Will, Soyou, and Jung Se-woon will perform in various ways such as broadcasting. They come in at 9 on our list of the top K-pop entertainment companies. Artists: Cosmic Girls, Monsta X, Yoo Seung Woo, Hyorin, Soyou, K. Will, Mad Clown, Brother Su, Boyfriend, WJSN, JungGiGo, Lee Kwang Soo, Lee Dong Wook, Kim Bum, Kim Ji Won, Yoo Yeon Seok, Jo Yoon Hee, and SISTAR Estimated Market Cap: $10 million 10. Top Media Entertainment  TOP Media is a South Korean company. They were founded by Shinhwa member Andy. He was in charge of handling the management of several artists. They usually work with LOEN Entertainment as the distributor of musical releases. They are considered one of the top up-and-coming K-pop Entertainment companies in Korea at the moment. TOP Media’s biggest success of 2018 was TEEN TOP. The group has five members: C.A.P, Chunji, Niel, Ricky, and Changjo. Originally they were a six-member group (with L.Joe, filing for contract termination in February 2017), Teen Top debuted with their first single album “Come into the World” way back in 2010. They are still going strong and look to take that momentum into 2019. Artists: TEEN TOP, 100%, UP10TION, Andy, Niel Estimated Market Cap: $10 million

I like a LOT of groups, so it's always really hard for me to choose. In the end, it boils down to Seventeen, NCT, Ateez, and A.C.E. In no particular order, here's why, in case you want to know (you probably don't but anyways): I love Seventeens music so much. Discography is a big part of whether I want to stan or not, and Seventeen is full of bops (including their b-sides). I also like them for their talent and skill. The group is very all-rounded, and they're even self-producing as well! And on top of that, their chemistry is really good, they seem like chill best friends. They're open with Carats (who are an awesome fandom) and care about them a lot. NCT's music is not as good for me as Seventeen's, but there are still a LOT of really great songs (my favorites are WayV's). NCT is also overflowing with skill and talent, and it's so hard to choose a bias, even within the sub-groups. NCT are full of living memes, and that makes for a lot of funny and interesting content. And, like Seventeen, they have great chemistry within the units and czennies are generally a funny and chill fandom. Ateez has the best discography for my music taste. I have their entire discography in my playlist, not joking. I love their music so much. Ateez are also crazy good performers, and dance skill is something I really like (and most of my biases are main/lead dancers). And finally, they're absolutely full of memes. I like A.C.E because their music is full of bops and they're generally just amazing people. They're a very all-rounded group like Seventeen- every member can hold his own when dancing, and they can all sing amazingly well, even the rappers. Also, their line distribution is freakishly even. (ahem, SM, did you hear that?) And A.C.E and Beat Interactive also feed Choices (who are probably the nicest fandom I've been in) very well with a lot of quality content. So yeah. If you're up to it, you should take a look at one or more of those. Even if you don't decide to support them, thanks for considering and learning a bit about them! Byeee

Without a blink, Mamamoo. This is based solely on their talents, womanhood, music and gauged intelligence. They are arguably the most talented acts in kpop and it's not just only about their vocals, but their musicality, songs, performances and their stated opinions of life in general.  Their concerts usually run for about four hours for two to three consecutive days and fan meetings run for about 3 hours. Activities include creative VCRs, revamped performances with live band, almost no MR, encore stages and cover songs done individually by the members. They never lipsync, and put their 100% into every of their performances. These girls are the epitome of hard work, perseverance and unrelenting strength.  Their musicality is top notch. They easily add adlibs to their songs at the spur of the moment. Create mash-ups, medleys, remixes of songs without much efforts. Their recent rock remix performance of Gogobebe at MGMA 2019 blew my mind away. It was shockingly good. Their live performances are creative, ever changing and interestingly engaging. Never a dull moment. They're funny, witty and all round comedic. Their opinions on life, people, etc., are very intellectual. You could tell that they're incredibly intelligent, open minded and not clout driven. Their love for music keeps them going and it's enough for me to say they are the best kpop group at the moment. Each individual members can be a successful soloist. They're that talented. Surprisingly, they never outshine each other when they're together. Each member shines exceptionally well and brings maximum efforts in the group’s activities.  I could go on and on about Mamamoo, list their several abilities, but I'd leave a last note about these ladies. They're a force to reckon with. They are women who thrive well in a world filled with vile people who throw hate at them. They embrace their insecurities as humans and women and let us know that you can whoever you want to be. They are unapologetic and remind us often that you are in charge of your life and no one has the right to run your life except you. PS if you want to get to know them, I recommend the following resources: Watch their Immortal Song performances on YouTubeGo on Twitter and ask about Mamamoo, their fandom would get through to you and help you out.Listen to their music on iTunes, Spotify or whatever music content platform you pleaseWatch their live stages and get blown away.

A K-pop group named Apeace was the biggest, in terms of the number of group members. In 2011, they debuted with 21 members. However, they reduced the number to 15 in 2014. In terms of influence and legacy in the K-pop industry, 2nd generation groups come to mind. TVXQ, Big Bang, SHINee, and Super Junior brought international interest to K-pop and Korean culture. With their powerful vocals, catchy songs, and flashy choreo, these groups appealed to a worldwide audience and helped promote K-pop, after they released hit after hit. Some notable songs include TVXQ's Mirotic, Big Bang's Fantastic Baby, SHINee's Replay, and Super Junior's Sorry Sorry. These singles gave fans memorable first impressions of K-pop. Wonder Girls, Girl's Generation, and 2NE1 also introduced many fans to the genre. All of them produced different music styles and songs that became popular worldwide. Wonder Girl's Nobody, SNSD's Gee, and 2NE1’s I Am The Best attracted many fans from the West, myself included. Their singles never got old. They create much nostalgia of people's childhood or early memories of K-pop. Their music videos are never forgotten, either. As for 3rd generation groups, the ones who currently have the biggest impact on K-pop are BTS, EXO, Seventeen, Blackpink, NCT (who will eventually expand to around 30 members), Twice, and Red Velvet.

Well, to make it simple I’ll break down my favorite K-pop groups into three tiers. Tier 1 is called “I love this group to the point that I don’t find it cringey to call myself *insert fandom name here*”Tier 2 is called “I unknowingly go on a 16 hour rampage of streaming their music/MVs/variety content every now and then and enjoy every minute of it”Tier 3 is called “The groups I heavily judged/despised in the beginning for whatever reasons but am now starting to fall hard for without even realizing”Honorable Mentions - 2nd gen groups that I admire for their music and concepts but never really got around to ‘stanning’ because I was not into K-pop when they were at the peak of their popularityHere it goes: Tier 1 - EXOI love this group to the point that I am willing to proudly call myself an EXO-L. I used to cringe when people referred to themselves Directioners, Beliebers, Arianators or Smiley Mileys (lol, idk what the Hannah Montana fandom is called). I vowed to never become a part of that population but then…EXO hit me hard, really hard. Now, I’m obsessed to the point where my WiFi name is….take a guess ;) lol, okay, it’s EXO-L. Tier 2 - WINNER, GOT7, BTS, VIXX, B1A4Once I start out with watching any of their variety content on YouTube, I jump onto their MV playlist then their comeback stages then their live performances and by the time I am done it’s usually 2 or 3 am. Tier 3 - TWICE, iKON, 2PMAs recent as last year, these groups possessed the capability to induce a nauseating feeling inside of me. I know it sounds bad, but I just could not stand them, like at all. Tell you what though, I wholeheartedly accept that I was a huge ass fool for subjecting them to my endless negative judgments. They’re super talented and deserve every bit of recognition they have received. I sincerely wish for IKON to rise even higher and for TWICE to take over the world! As for 2PM I just have this to say “Where have y’all been all my life?!?!!!” I am just fascinated by the fact that even though I gave a listen to many 2nd gen groups when I finally got into K-pop, I completely skipped over 2PM! What can I say, I am repenting for my sins now. Honorable Mentions (and forever legendary) - SNSD, SHINee, Super Junior, BIGBANG

BigBang Despite all of their controversies and especially Seungri’s controversy and departure from the group, this group remains my favorite as a whole. I appreciate the fact that when they started, they weren’t popular by any means but they managed to become the “kings” of K-Pop with hard work. YG Entertainment, despite their poor management skills, produces hits that are geared towards a Western audience instead of utilizing the typical K-Pop sound. Part of this has to do with BigBang’s leader G-Dragon who writes and produces a lot of their material as well as songs for other YG artists. He had a drug scandal, which I am not necessarily saying is ok by any means but when you really look at his career, you can see that he has worked extremely hard to get to where he is today. Taeyang and Daesung’s vocals fit a wide range of music. They can tackle pop, hip hop, rap, trot, R&B, etc. Their vocals also compliment each other in their songs (like Bae Bae, where they sing the same verse but they both bring something different to the table). In addition to that, both are successful solo artists, especially Daesung who is really popular in Japan. TOP is just weird, which makes him all the more interesting. His deep voice and rapping skill opposes G-Dragon’s higher and nasal tone, which adds more diversity to their songs. I won’t talk about Seungri due to recent events and the fact that he was my least favorite member (more due to his lack of vocals in comparison to all of the other members). Out of all of the Generation 2 groups in K-Pop, I feel like BigBang was one of the first to really emphasize the western sound. Their music usually revolves around rap and hip-hop but thanks to their vocal lineup, their songs feel really balanced and you don’t tend to focus on one member. Thanks to them, they set the seeds for other YG artists to succeed in being popular with the more international audience and they were the main reason why YG Entertainment became of the Big 3. They are also very influential and other groups have claimed that BigBang are their role models (BTS, Monsta X, etc.)

To be very honest, I'm a huge multi stan (shocker, as if my name didn't give that out) but on a serious note I stan a lot of groups that if I was this serious about my studies, I'd honestly be Albert Einstein smart. Even though I'm relatively new to kpop having gotten into them late last year, I've honestly come across many talented groups, bands and solo artists. I'm starting from my ultimate kpop group. 1. Ateez  My best rookie group!!! Now, I know they're rookies and all and they're just beginning their career, like they haven't even been around for a year but these guys completely and passionately stole my heart. I don't know what it is about them that I just love so much, maybe its the way they perform, the energy and vibe they radiate in both MVs and on stage, the vocals, the synchronized dances, their personalities, the visuals! Or maybe because I'm a 4th generation kpop fan (yes, I dared to say that) and I basically started with them from their pre-debut, I just have this special connection with them! Everything about them seems so alluring. I'm totally whipped for them and you can't imagine how excited I must be for their comeback! My bias is our one and only Korean Big Minion, leader Hongjoong! He's really amazing in every way possible that I can't even begin to count. The other members are my bias wreckers, Every. Single. One! They all bias wreck me so bad I'm actually considering it illegal. Moving on! 2. Exo  They were my first love in kpop! If not for them, I don't think I'd have gotten into kpop as much as I'm in now. The first time I heard their song, ‘Monster', the inner detective in me arose that I immediately went to the web and learnt all their names and other information written about them on kpop profiles within five minutes. I never knew I could store so much information in my brain during that time frame. The vocals, the visuals, the way they moved just enticed me and I fell for them instantly. Had it been I hadn't yet found Ateez they'd have been my ultimate group. 3. Bts  I'm sure some expected them to be on the list. As happy as I am to admit, I'm a proud Army. I’m going to choose 6 of my favorite groups - 3 boy groups and 3 girl groups. First up: Twice  Twice has an extraordinary discography and they’re similar to Apink in that they continuously grow better and better the longer they’re together. This is the group that got me into K-pop and have stayed at the top of my list as my ult female group for the past 2 1/2 years I’ve been a fan. They’re letting their inner artists show themselves more and I’m forever proud of them. Next: Stray Kids  Stray Kids were the first boy group I ever became a fan of, and they got me interested in other boy groups. I held them at the top of my list for a long time until certain things happened. I still really love their music and think that they’re going to continuously do amazing in the music world. ITZY  They’re new, yes, but I think they’re doing really well and are slowly settling into their skin. Their music is good and they have a lot of potential to continue their rise to stardom. I also like that all of them are within my age range (born after 2000) which allows me to relate to them a bit more than some of the other groups I like. I feel inspired seeing them do what they love. Now, for the NON-JYP groups 😂 Ateez  Ateez have stolen my heart and they are truly phenomenal. From the passionate performances they give literally ALL THE TIME to the chaos and hilarity that they bring with them, Ateez is truly carving a place for themselves as one of the groups to pay attention to. Their music is fun and theatrical, but also meaningful and emotional. Their brotherhood is something to admire, and if you like storylines behind the music and MV’s, Ateez is definitely the group for you. Everything has a meaning - from the stage outfits to the sets. Mamamoo  Mamamoo are truly amazing. They have outstanding vocals and beautiful personalities, and they know how to hype up a crowd. Mamamoo are versatile in style and can pull off a variety of concepts. They truly are some of the Queens of K-Pop. You can trust in their performances 100%. Finally, Seventeen  Seventeen are powerhouses. From the focused units playing to their strengths and the family-like bond they share, Seventeen truly have some of the most talented individuals. Dance, vocals, rap - all of it is superb. They also make sure to feed Carats the content they’re craving. Seventeen are really impressive and absolutely hilarious, so I love them a lot. I know that half the groups have been around for 5+ years and the other half have over a year to their name, but these are just some of the groups whose music I enjoy. There are so many talented groups who deserve the recognition, but I didn’t want to spend hours on a post lol.

This is goigg to be a long list, bare with me. In no particular order: Astro. I really love them. I started liking them two days after their debut ( a new record) after I stumbled upon their song accidentally. I really hated the cute concept and theirs was such a cute concept. But the song was catchy, the choreography was interesting and there was a moment that convinced me. I still like them a lot, I feel like, even though they are from a less experience d company, they themselves are really great idols. Each one has a specialty that they master, and together they are a very competent and complete group. They're also really chaotic and funny and I really like their songs, even (sometimes especially) the B-tracks.Seventeen. Again, I really love them. It took me a while to give them a chance, because I (was the only one in the world who) didn't like Mansae. But once I did, I became a fan right away. I love their professionalism, their songs and choreographies. But I also love that each one is different, to a greater extent than many other groups, and that they seem to genuinely have a good relationship within the group. I love that the more quiet members still get attention and shine, and I love that the more out-there members do their best to include everyone. That was what really got me into them, the way they seem to promote each other before promoting themselves. In an industry with that high competition, it is not as easy to do as it seems.Shinee. God, I used to love them. Lately my time for kpop was limited to zero, and they were the first to fall, but they are so so good. Except for Minho (don't come for me, it's just an opinion). I really loved their songs, and their vocal ability always blew me away. Jonghyun might have been the best vocalist in kpop, in my very subjective opinion. And the rest were super good too. Sherlock will forever be my favourite Kpop song.Super Junior. They're crazy. And that's why I'm a fan. Because they're crazy. I discovered them by mistake when I was watching Shinee stuff back in the day, and the first one I found was Heechul. Best way to start right there. I really like their songs, most of them. I went through their entire discography a few times and I like about 80% of it, which is a lot seeing as it's huge and it goes through a lot of different kpop levels. But still, what I mostly like about them is their craziness.Vixx. I haven't followed them in a while but I used to like them a lot. N was probably my favourite dancer in kpop, and I really liked Ken’s voice and Ravi. I didn't really like Shangri La, don't know why, and after that I stopped having the time to follow them like before, but they are really talented. I don't really like Leo’s singing technique, but that again is a subjective thing. He is really talented.EXO. Mainly the up-to-Monster eras, but after as well. They were my first group (kind of, but yeah) and I joined during their Love me right times. I really liked them, from Baekhyun’s chaos to Lay’s chill and from Xiumin’s sexy self to Xiumin’s cute self. I can see their experience showing while they perform, especially lately that I don't really like the materials they get. What drew me to them was… Well…Baekhyun being crazy mainly. And I used to really like Suho as a whole. It kind of hurts to see them fade away, but it was bound to happen, they have left their legacy behind and will continue to thrive in the future.Old NCT stuff. I used to love NCT before they moved their focus to the US. Their vocalists were so good and their dancers were so good. Marks “long ass ride” will stay with me forever. I don't really like their style of music, it isn't for me, and that is OK. I have kind of moved on from them when my time for kpop diminished, but they are really good. Don't be scared by the number, it doesn't matter. Pick the group you like and it's just like any other group. I know all 21 of them, but I learnt them by chunk and it didn't feel like too much. I felt they were more distinctive than idols in other groups, but that depends on each person.I should include some girl groups as well, so Mamamoo. They are so so good, I loved their singing and their live performances. I like many of their songs, too. I can't say much about their personalities, because I started liking them in a time when I couldn't really follow them anymore, but still. They're great singers.Dreamcatcher. I loved loved loved the concept and their songs. They are the only girl group I follow now, just the songs because that's all I have time for. I really like them, the rock-ish sound and the horror concepts.Bands probably don't count, but if they do, FtIsland is right there on top. Fighting for the first spot. Because if Jonghyun is the best vocalist in kpop, Hongki is the best vocalist ever. I love their songs, pretty much all of them, and Hongki is so so good. I first discovered them when I was watching Super Junior stuff and Hongki was always right there with Heechul, but it took me a while to realise that Hongki and this Hongki were the same Hongki. I love him, and his group mates as well (not Jonghoon, I didn't really like him from the start but now I actually have a reason). I love their honesty, even if it's harsh, and I love their music.

Get ready for a long explanation. 1. BTS  People who don’t listen to BTS often think of them as overrated. But it’s truly impressive the success they have received worldwide. And it’s not just their popularity and fame that is mindblowing, but the influence they have over youths today as well as their outstanding talent. They write about deeply profound things that people of my generation struggle with today. Not only do they speak through their music, but through the causes they take up. They launched a campaign called Love Myself, in an effort to end violence toward children and teens. You can see the passion they have for such causes in everything they do. All in all, you can tell each member has a big heart with so much to give to the world. All we need to do is listen. Bias: Jungkook  Not only do I think he has an angelic voice and can dance very well, but he’s overall just a genuine, passionate individual. I admire those qualities in a person. He also enjoys doing photography like me. 2. SHINee  Where do I even begin? This group has been through so much. I felt it only right that I include a picture of them with the late Jonghyun. In December of 2017, he committed suicide. Since then, SHINee has continued to go strong, still releasing quality music. But they will always be different without him. Still, SHINee is the first K-pop group I listened to. They were what got me into the K-pop fandom with their hit “Sherlock.” Bias: Taemin  I knew immediately that Taemin, the maknae, was my bias. In fact, he’s my ultimate bias in all of K-pop. I still stan him to this day even in his solo career. I think he’s one of the most talented people in K-pop. He has a strong eye for aesthetics, and he comes up with some of the nicest concepts for his own music videos. If you haven’t seen the dance choreography for his hit “Move,” you need to! 3. B.A.P  I realize B.A.P is going through a lot right now. Yongguk left (supposedly,) Himchan has been accused of sexual assault, their contracts are nearing their expiration. Overall, their future is very uncertain. I only really mention B.A.P specifically because of how talented they are. Even though he’s no longer a member, I want to speak on Yongguk a little bit. On their second studio album “Noir,” he, along with Zelo, wrote one of the deepest, most meaningful songs based on his own struggles with mental illness, called “Pray.” He has never performed it live because he says that he felt so bad while writing the lyrics, that he doesn’t want to relive those feelings. Having depression and anxiety myself, it really touched me on a personal level. I admire the fact that he’s not afraid to write or speak about such things, and I really feel for him. Another thing…if you haven’t seen any of their music videos, you need to go on YouTube and watch them now. Specifically the ones for “One Shot” and “Skydive.” This group deserves an Oscar. Also, Zelo answered a comment of mine on a live stream once. You can imagine what a happy BABY I was. Bias: Yongguk  I know, I know. He’s not a member anymore. But the bias award goes to him nevertheless. Because, despite not personally knowing him, I still feel a personal understanding with regards to him and his own struggles. And he’s so talented in writing song lyrics that convey those struggles. Other honorable mentions, in no particular order: EXONCTMonsta XBlackpinkPentagonINFINITEWinnerBig BangGOT7K.A.R.D

And RingDingDong RingDingDong RingDingDong. They are the kings.

Monsta X. Obvisouly :) I've been a Monbebe since they had their debut. I've been with them since No Mercy but since the group hadn't officially had their debut, there wasn't a fandom name at the time of 'No Mercy'. Although they weren't the first group to get me into K-Pop (that was BIGBANG) nor were they the first group I fell in love with (that was also BIGBANG), they immediately caught my attention. Although I still love BIGBANG, I love Monsta X more than any other group or soloist. There's just something about them that I vibe really well with. I love being able to watch them grow and become more successful and start to get the amount of recognition, love, and care they should be receiving (it's still not nearly enough). As you guessed it, I'm going to be explaining what I love about every member and how they captivated my attention. Lets start with the leader himself, Shownu (Son Hyunwoo)    I love this man, so much. At first you may think he’s quiet, boring, and reserved. Well, he’s not. He’s a dork, just like the rest of the members. His dancing skills really impressed me along with his vocals. He deserves so much love and care, so much. He deserves all the success he’s worked to earn and more. His talent should not go unrecognized. Nor should his beauty. Next member up is Lee/Shin Hoseok AKA Wonho!    I love him so much. You don’t even understand the amount of love I have for him. I am ready to fight in order to keep him safe, protected, happy, and loved. He means the absolute world to me and I can’t ever imagine that changing. Yes, he has a nice body but he also has an absolutely amazing personality. He is so sensitive and so caring. He cares deeply for others, especially the people he loves. I can’t begin to explain how this man is the absolute best. You can disagree but don’t you dare leave any nasty comments about him. I don’t care what you think, just keep your thoughts to yourself. Keep your nasty, hateful comments away from Wonho. I don’t want him seeing them. No MONBEBE would ever want any of the members seeing a hurtful comment, especially Wonho. Why especially Wonho? He’s the most caring, sensitive, emotional member of Monsta X. We want to protect our little baby bunny. He doesn’t deserve any hate thrown his way and he needs to be protected from all the bad things in the world. His vocals are amazing. He’s amazing. His visuals are amazing. No matter what anyone says, Wonho will always be an important member of Monsta X. All of them are important. That includes Wonho. I’m sick and tired of seeing posts that say “Oh, Monsta X wouldn’t be any different without Wonho”. Actually, yes it would. There would be no Monsta X if there was no Wonho. They are all like a family and they wouldn’t let one member be removed and continue promoting without him. They stick together, no matter what. That’s already been proven. He is a crucial member of the group. I wouldn’t have the group any other way. Nor would I have Wonho in any other group than Monsta X. If you can’t see how much he is worth than you’re not a true MONBEBE. You’re just blind. This man deserves the entire world. He deserves so much love, protection, care, and kindness. It’s time that he gets the amount of love, respect, protection, care, and kindness that he has been giving to us. Alright, Next member. Lee Minhyuk.    The quirky little boy. The sunshine of the group. I love him so very much! His energy is something I vibe with really well. He never fails to put a smile on my face. He can cheer me up in a heartbeat. That’s how contagious his mood is. He’s absolutely hilarious. His vocals are outstanding and his visuals are just wow. I’m so happy he had his debut. Monsta X wouldn’t be complete without him. Next member is Lee Kihyun.    Such a cutie. I love him so much. His vocals are absolutely the best, no matter what anyone says. Listen to him sing and you’ll agree. His visuals, wow, I refuse to believe he isn’t a visual. He’s so pretty. Don’t look his pretty looks deceive you though. He’s evil. He’s an evil little short, powerful, sensitive vocalist. I love him though and I will protect him with my whole heart. Can you guess who’s next? If I’m going in order of age…..Chae Hyungwon    Wow. I love this man so much. No joke. He means so much to me. He is literally Kermit the frog. His visuals are absolutely amazing and his vocals are stunning. Starship needs to give him more lines. Let his voice shine! He is seriously such a dork though. You can’t help BUT to fall in love with him. We got the one who spits fire up next. Lee Jooheon.    The man himself. I love him so, so much. He was my first ever bias in Monsta X. He captivated my attention and heart. The love I have for him is so powerful and strong. It’s impossible for me to ever get rid of that love. He has made me smile and laugh when I needed to the most. He is very important to me, just like all the other members. He holds a special place in my heart and no one will ever take that away from him. Next we got the oldest looking maknae. Im Changkyun    I love him. Really, I do. Nothing in this world could ever change that. He makes my heart beat fast and my eyes light up whenever I see him. His voice is ultimately my favorite in Monsta X, maybe even in the entire K-Pop industry. His dorky side is what made me fall in love with him though. He’s so quirky and lovable. He tries to act tough but in reality, he is a big baby who needs all the protection there is. His raps are literal fire. When he raps, I get immersed into the song. Whether it be if I’m jamming out to Monsta X’s music or walking with earbuds in listening to their music, whenever Changkyun raps, I stop. I stop and listen to his voice. His voice is so soothing.

response.answer_text: Here are my top 4 in no particular order: MAMAMOO- When it comes to just pure talent, these four women are number one. They don’t need flashy choreo or the typical Kpop girl group style to put on a great show. Just give these girls a microphone and a stage, and they’ll blow you away. They write some of their own songs, choreograph the majority of their own dances, and I can’t stress how heavenly their voices are. I wish more people would recognize their talent. They truly deserve so much more success. BigBang- I don’t need to say much here. If you know Kpop then you know BigBang. They’re the Kings. ‘Nuff said. BTS- About 2–3 years ago I saw my first ever Kpop mv and these guys blew me away. My life hasn’t been the same since. They give me so much hope and I learned how to dream again because of them. Their success didn’t come as a surprise to me. It was only a matter of time before the whole world saw them like I did. And I hope that their popularity will bring more foreign artists into mainstream music. Loona- I honestly surprised myself when I turned into a Loona stan lmao. If I would’ve heard “Hi High” like a year ago, I wouldn’t even think about listening to them (not because it’s a bad song but it’s so cutsie omfg). But their debut process was so unique and I got to see what each member is actually like, so I feel more invested in them. Plus although “Hi High” is kinda cutsie, it’s also a bop lol so I can’t be mad. Plus they’re literally all living memes so how could I not stan. I do look forward to their next comeback tho. Stan Loona BeLisMamamoo Love Yourself Let’s meet again when the flowers bloom

If I’m to be perfectly honest, Super Junior.  There’s a few things that drew me to them, and I wanna rant about em, so yay you get that now. The first is the strength that these boys (men…) have shown, even through everything. They’ve been together 13 years, and are still fairly popular even after all members going through military. They’ve helped each other through several car accidents, the loss of family members, scandals, marriages, and run ins with the law (coughkangincough) and come out of it stronger. They’re hilarious, and don’t care all that much about an “image”, per say. They’ll pay each other out at any opportunity (go watch Super TV or their episodes of Intimate Note, Knowing Brothers and Weekly Idol if you don’t believe me). They’ve gotten up on stage and shamelessly pulled off Elsa costumes (or in Heechul’s case, Anna), Beyonce costumes, Lady GaGa, Sistar, Power Rangers, Avengers, you name it, they’ve probably done it. And let’s not forget Leeteuk’s “Sexy Elsa” and Eunhyuk’s Marilyn Monroe (in the airport, mind you).   (and honestly, how pretty is Hyukkie here???) But even when they’re not together, you can see them everywhere. Heechul is well known as one of the temporary hosts of Weekly Idol, and a permanent one in Knowing Brothers. Leeteuk hosts Star Show 360, among other things, and appears on so many others (I haven’t seen them all yet…). I know for a fact Shindong also does show hosting, but I don’t recall where. Ryeowook (and Leeteuk) used to host Sukira (Super Junior Kiss The Radio) before he went to the military. They all have their points of appeal when doing these shows; Heechul’s crazy temperament is well known to most Kpop fans. They’re also doing so much good for this world. Siwon, in particular, aids a lot of different humanitarian groups and causes. I just got lucky on one of his recent Instagram posts; he posted a wonderfully touching speech about bullying, and responded to my comment… it’s clear that even if it isn’t his priority (which, honestly, it may be), be certainly wants to spread awareness, and that is something that means a lot to me, as the cause is close to my heart.  (and yes, it was an insane experience to be noticed, and my god am I thankful for it… it saved me that night… screenshot from Siwon’s twitter; cause I couldn’t get it all in one shot) There’s also the subgroups and songs they have. D&E is doing so well right now, and I’m so proud of them; if you watch those two through the years, they’re actual friendship goals, being around the same age and their personalities complimenting each other so well. SuJu T was possibly one of my favourites, being the reason Rokkugo came about; the song is so fun and light, and also that TeukChul right there. (Also kinda jealous of Heechul’s hairstyle).  And with SuJu you also have half a dozen solo artists. Chinese members Zhoumi and Henry are both active soloists, as are all three main vocals (Yesung, Ryeowook and Kyuhyun). There are some gorgeous titles within their discographies, with my favourites being Henry’s Trap and Fantastic (as a violinist…) and Ryeowook’s The Little Prince.    But finally, I need to rant a little about my bias; leader and precious angel Leeteuk. Teuk has been so strong, so selfless over the years, and it’s his thoughtful character (and good looks, not about to deny the good looks) that draw me to him. He’s been through a lot. He stayed strong through Hangeng’s lawsuits and Kibum’s departure. He helped Donghae through his father’s death, and Heechul through the proceeding car accident. He was the first to enter the military, and chose to go on active duty rather than a military police role. He suffered through the pain and grieving of his father’s suicide, and his grandparent’s murder, not to mention his fathers scathing last words and debt. He pulled Kangin through his DUI scandal, and is dealing with the second. He was caught in the car accident that nearly robbed Kyuhyun of his life and voice, and was badly injured, but told paramedics to go to Kyuhyun first; “he’s worse than me” (Shindong’s reports later say that Teuk was bleeding very badly as well, though he’s right, Kyuhyun was worse). He stood by Siwon during his scandal (something regarding his dog; I didn’t pay a whole lot of attention to it). I don’t doubt that he’ll be standing by Sungmin with his wedding scandal (which shouldn’t be a scandal honestly; boy fell in love, what’s the big deal? He is like thirty something, it was about time anyway). Teuk is Super Junior’s angel, and mine too. I hope that, maybe, as time goes on, things can be easier for him, and the rain in his life may let up, but for now I want to thank him for inspiring me. And that is why you should stan Super Junior xx

I like, and love, a lot of groups, so I’m going to list some that especially stand out to me. I’ll break them down into two categories - the ones I like and love. I’ll also give brief explanations as to how they stole my heart. Here they are: LIKEFromis_9 The first song I heard from them was “Love Bomb”, and it was the best thing that happened to me the entire month. I was hooked to that song. The chorus gave me these “sad but happy” vibes, and I thought it was very unique and creative. I began to search them up and listen to more of their songs. Some of them I like, others are just not my style.Momoland If you guessed I discovered them through “Bboom Bboom”, then you’re right. 7th-grade me religiously listened to it every. single. day. No matter how much hate they get, I will still continue to enjoy their music and respect the members.ONEUS Some of their songs don’t really appeal to me, but I love “Come Back Home” and “Lit”. I haven’t heard much of “To Be or Not To Be” to really give a statement about the song; nevertheless, I’m curious about what types of music they’ll release in the future.Victon They’re really underrated, but their songs are top-tier. Some are even better than certain title tracks released by top groups. They also have a lot of talent, and I think that should never be ignored.Seventeen I’ve never seen any other Kpop group release the type of music they make. Their vocalists sing with overflowing emotion, and that’s what caught my eye (or ears) the most along with their unique discography.Red Velvet Do I even need to explain? They are IT, and nobody else can do it like they do. Their songs deserve all the awards, wins, and support they got. In my opinion, they have the one of the best vocal line-ups in their generation.LOVEDreamcatcher I can write a whole essay about this group. They are SO underrated, yet their discography is one of the best, if not the BEST, I’ve stumbled upon in this generation of Kpop. They have NO bad songs AT ALL in my opinion, and the albums keep getting better each comeback. Not only do they have great songs, but their personalities are amazing. They have superb chemistry and are really funny, cute, kind, and caring. I watched the following video titled “[Guide] Dreamcatcher 드림캐쳐- Collecting Hearts Of Other Idols (Elris Gugudan KARD Everglow Izone Etc)” yesterday, and I find it to be one of the most wholesome and entertaining videos I’ve seen in weeks. Link: Loona “Butterfly” took my breath away. It was the first ever song I heard from them, and I’ve stanned them ever since. The more I discover facts about them and listen to their music, the more I love and cherish them. They’re also one of a few idols who openly support the LGBT+ community, of which I am a part of. I felt a sense of “pride” (pun intended?) when I learned that; furthermore, their songs are among the best I’ve listened to, and I never get tired of them. STAN LOONA.I apologize if reading this gave you a headache. My English has been getting worse each year ;-;

BTS was my first kpop group and they’re pretty up there but there are two groups above them. Topp Dogg (#1) They’re a very talented, VERY underrated, unappreciated group. Their songs are so so original and the members are hilariously unique. I’ve never seen such an animated, talented self producing group like them. They debuted in 2013 and have no one has ever given them much attention aside from their 2015 song “The Beat”. Their company, HUNUS, practically ignores them and manages them terribly. They’ve gone through around 20 member changes (including sub groups) and their career has been overall exhausting for them. They’ve been on countless hiatuses and no one even knows if they’ll have a comeback again or if some members are still there. They deserve so so much better and I love them with all my heart. Pentagon (#2) They’re a fairly new group, only debuting in October 2016, but they are already so talented and making waves in the industry. Their leader, Hui, is becoming a very sought after and highly acclaimed composer. Hui and member E’Dawn debuted in a group with Hyuna call Triple H. Wooseok and E’Dawn are features on Hyuna’s upcoming album. Jinho used to be in SM Ballad and Hongseok almost debuted with iKON on Mix & Match. They all participated in Pentagon Maker and they are honestly so talented and deserving of good comebacks, wins, and recognition. I love them a lot and their personalities are just so hard to not fall in love with.

BTS is my favorite Kpop group for many reason. I love them because of their passion and love for music. They are a group of very dedicated men. They’ve had to struggle to the top. They’ve also had to face many obstacles along the way, however, they all decided to push through it and keep going. It’s becuase of this that they have a genuine bond. They are one of the few groups out there to participate in writing, composing, and producing their own music. Which is very admirable. BTS actually write their own lyrics. Each of the rappers even have their own mixtape. (RM, Agust D, Hope World, Mono) Also Suga is one the fastest rappers in the industry. Listen to Cypher pt 2 and you’ll see. RM likes to do a lot of wordplay and such in some songs. In Ddaeng, RM mocks other rappers that stutters by incorporating stutters into his part of the song which is clever. BTS even practice their dancing up to 12 hours a day. Especially those who aren’t a part of the dance line. Whats also admirable about them is the fact that they are very humble and accepting. BTS are known to be supportive of the LGBTQ+ community. In the speech that they gave at the United Nations ceremony, RM said “no matter who you are, where you’re from, your skin color, your gender identity, just speak yourself”. They love to inspire us and give us encouraging messages. There are also times where they forget that they are celebrities. (For example, when one of the members tried on a unique pair of sunglasses he responded with “wow I feel like a celebrity”) They also get very excited they’re versing each other in games for prizes such as a Nintendo switch or a rice cooker even though they’re are millionaires lol. BTS also breaks social norms. One of the rappers (Suga) ends up making some songs about struggling with depression and social anxiety. This is amazing because talking about mental illness is considered a taboo in South Korea. Some people don’t even like to associate BTS with Kpop anymore because of how diverse their music is. They do many genres such as pop, hip hop, ballads, EDM, and even Latin pop! They love to experiment and change it up every time. Also BTS has a storyline with their music videos and clips. Fans love making theories based off of their music videos and clips. Each member has a unique story and people love to figure it out. They also don’t create simple concepts that every other group does. With their recent concept photos, it was a very weird yet interesting style. Members were put into boxes while there were hands, eyes, and cameras sticking into the boxes. Many fans theorized that it could’ve been a metaphor for how they feel while being mobbed at airports. This turned out to be longer than I thought, but I hope you took the time to read it. Basically BTS is not like other Kpop groups and seriously deserves a chance to be heard and not to be stereotyped as “another boy group”.

Also Bobby is the only idol and the youngest person to win Show Me the Money while B.I is the first idol to win Songwriter of the Year at MMA.Honorable Mentions: Stray Kids(litterly the cutest group and a great concept) and YG Treasure Box(whoever is picked in the survival show will probably become my 3nd ult)AKMU- A brother-sister duo under YG Entertainment How could you not love them? If only the choreography was easier, I bet everyone would be dancing to it like Sorry Sorry. Then have songs like Idol and Boy With Luv and they also have songs like I Need U and Fake Love. If I weigh these songs, it’s all balanced. Only BTS can do it. 5. SNSD Second generation SM idols were true gems. they were so talented. Taeyeon is one of the best female singers in kpop. I don’t think there’s any argument in that. Hyoyeon is one of the best dancers. Let’s not forget the beauty of Yoona, Yuri, and Seohyun. Their songs were mostly cute but Girl’s Generation could still make you feel the heat.
