It is a small group here on Quora! But of course there are some of us… It seems like there’s no place on the internet without at least a few kpop fans these days! ^^ I’ll just head straight into listing my faves, and I’ll try to keep it short, k? In no particular order: 1- Block B  I really enjoy the kind of music they release. Usually I love every single song off their albums (which is kinda rare for me, I tend to skip ballads even from my faves). Woo Jiho is an incredible musician and producer! And while I’ve been a fan of the group since Nillili Mambo in 2012, the struggle they went through with their lawsuit [Block B - Wikipedia] made me an even bigger fan. I respect them for publicly calling out Stardom Ent’s horrible treatment of them because it’s all too common in the kpop industry, but few idols will risk the public’s judgement of them in such a situation. I also love the fact that they stuck together as 7, although it would certainly have been easier (for certain members) to ditch the group and try their luck as soloists. They must be good friends, to be so loyal to each other. And it paid off! 2- Mamamoo  Their vocals are amazing, they’re without question some of the most talented people in the “idol” category right now. They’re a lot of fun to watch on stage because they have a level of confidence and intimacy with the audience that I’ve honestly never seen in kpop before. I like the fact that they’re so close as friends too, Wheein and Hwasa have known each other since they were little kids together and it’s just adorable to think that they’re fulfilling their dream of becoming entertainers together as adults. They also have a sort of reputation for being LGBT friendly as idols and as people, and that appeals to me. 3- Stellar  I love Stellar because they have never given up. They’re not at all popular in Korea (except with army men) and they’re constantly criticized for their “overly sexy” image and songs. Leaving aside the “too sexy” debate (because that’s a matter of opinion and preference) the fact that these girls have continued to try to reach out to new fans and make new music is really admirable. They’ve told stories about being so broke as a group that they share one dinner between all four of them, and of being so unpopular that when a more popular girl group walks by at a performance or salon, they’d hide out of shame. They’ve come to the brink of disbandment several times, but their luck is turning a little lately. There’s a company called Makestar that basically connects less well known kpop idols with international fans in a fundraising effort. Stellar’s fans (myself included) crowdfunded their last two albums to over 400% of the goal! Now they can keep making music and trying new things to appeal to the public, without being forced to live like paupers. Well that ended up not being short at all, so I’ll stop here. There are a lot more groups I’m following though. Thanks for the A2A! Hopefully it’s not considered spam if I include a link to my blog? In case anyone reading wants to find more kpop groups or chat with me!~ PINK&FUNKY

My favourite kpop groups? Oh boy get ready for a long answer My top 3 boy groups:  Seventeen: would have to be my ult group. I don’t remember how I discovered them but I remember the first music video I watched was “Aju Nice” followed by “Don’t Wanna Cry”at the end of 2017. My first thought was “why the hell are they’re so many of them?!” What I love abt Seventeen the most is their synchronisation while dancing, not one of them is just average. I also love how there are three sub-units catered for each member who specialise in a specific area (performance, vocal and hip-hop). I specifically want to mention the three leaders of the sub-groups. S.coups shows how hardworking he is by leading all 12 members as well as being the leader for the hip-hop unit. I don’t know how he does it, but Hoshi is able to choreograph a lot of the group’s dances, which is beyond my talent. He is also able to sing and rap just as well. Lastly, Woozi deserves continuous praise for producing almost all of Seventeen’s songs. He literally has me wondering sometimes how he has that much talent, the fact that his artistic control creates such catchy and meaningful songs which are completed by the other members. NCT: is just a whole ass group full of visuals and talent. I really appreciate the diversity in the group (international fans can relate) and although I think the ‘limitless’ member concept is uneccessary, I still think it’s unique. They provide lots of fanservice which makes them easy to follow, not to mention their songs are weird as fuck, which what makes them interesting. The member I appreciate the most is Mark. He is able to be in all 3 units of NCT, remember ALL of their choreography and write his own raps at the age of 19. DON’T GET ME STARTED ON THEIR DANCING, TEN AND JISUNG WHAT THE FUCK. I also think that Taeil’s vocals aren’t appreciated enough. They’re just a bunch of crackheads who really know how to sing, rap and dance. (MFAL IS THE SUPERIOR SONG). BTS: were the first group that introduced me to K-pop back in 2017 with their song “Dope”. Probably one of the most inpirising groups in terms of musical creativity. They delve into topics that are taboo and aren’t ones you would think about, they even encouraged me to paint an artwork based off the lyrics in “Baepsae” and “Go Go.” In my opinion they have one of the strongest rap-lines with RM, Suga and J-hope. Although they are not my ult group anymore, they are one of the most inspiring and will always have a place in my heart as being my first K-pop group discovery.Top 2 Girl Groups:  Red Velvet: are my ult girl group. Their name is evidence of their ability to switch from sweet bubblegum-pop to seductive ‘velvet’ concepts. Wendy’s voice can switch from strong and powerful to sweet and sultry. They also cater to r&b based tracks, which I am a huge fan of (I JUST AND KINGDOM COME CAN LIKE, GET IT). To people who think that Yeri was not a worthy addition to the group, she might’ve not been the best when she debuted but has definitely improved since then and has proved that her vocal and dancing skills are worthy. Mamamoo: are a close second. I first saw their performance in the 2018 Seoul Music Awards and decided to watch their “Yes I Am” music video. It’s one of my favorite songs because it promotes self-acceptance and confidence, and defies Korean beauty standards. I personally think that Moonbyul is one of the best female rappers with her low register and nice flow. Solar is also notable for her extremely strong vocals. I love their fun songs the most because they are all able to execute strong stage presence.Honorable Mentions: DeanKim ChunghaStray KidsPentagonEXOHyuna

SEVENTEEN I am a huge fan of SEVENTEEN. I have been following them since their predebut era, way before some of the members even joined the group. I have been a Kpop fan since 2008 and have liked several groups in the past, but once I found SEVENTEEN, my entire outlook of Kpop changed. I will list some of the reasons for why I like them so much. SELF-PRODUCING IDOLS. Some people think SVT uses the “self-producing idols” tag because it’s trendy. But very few know that the title itself was coined by the Korean media to describe SVT. Although a few groups had been making their own songs before SVT debuted, SVT was a self-producing group in the truest sense, because they wrote, composed, and choreographed their own stuff. This was all because the company wasn’t in the position to provide in-house songwriters, producers (except for Bumzu), and choreographers (they have a dance instructor named Hyelim). Woozi learned to compose songs on GarageBand. As of today, all members have songwriting credits on KOMCA, with Woozi having nearly 80 songs under his belt, followed by Vernon with over 55 songs. They even designed their own mascot and promoted themselves to the public to make their debut happen.They made their debut happen. This might seem odd, but it was actually the members who took it upon themselves to debut. They had been waiting for their debut for years, but their company kept pushing it, because the company has serious management issues. They promoted themselves by doing street performances, performed in schools and hospitals for free, in order to gain some attention.They’re a classic example of rags-to-riches. Back in 2015, when they debuted, Pledis was not in a good position, financially. All 13 boys were crammed in a small dorm, and their living conditions were so poor that they even had to fight for toothpaste and other basic necessities! Some members even came on the verge of leaving because their future looked blurry with an uncertain debut and the company’s lack of proper management. Even after debut, it wasn’t easy for SVT. You might know that artists who perform on stage require in-ear monitors. However, since those are very expensive and the company could not afford them, they had to use regular earphones. Since those aren’t suitable, the members had to borrow money from their parents to buy in-ears. However, they saw a silver lining when they became the best-selling rookie group that year and was the only kpop group to be listed in Billboard’s “21 Under 21 2015: Music's Hottest Young Stars” and their rookie album appeared on Billboard’s "10 Best K-pop Albums of 2015" chart. They broke even in 2016, and soon established their company’s status as one of the top entertainment companies. Right now, they are one of the Top 3 best selling kpop boy groups in 2019.SVT is quite different from your everyday Kpop groups. Back then, grungy, bad-boy concepts were more popular. SVT popularized fresh, funky concepts and developed their music over the years.They write meaningful songs. This is one of the lesser-known things about them, but SVT writes very well-thought-out songs. They have songs that encourage introspection, songs about empowerment, songs that thank fans, songs about heartbreak, and a plethora of other topics. Their lyrics are often humble and based on their real experiences.One of the most all-rounded groups. I think this is the only group I know where every member plays at least one instrument, participates in songwriting, and come up with insanely catchy choreos. Their synchronization is on another level, which they are very well-known for. All members are vocalists, despite having a dedicated vocal unit. Moreover, all members are dancers, although they do have a dedicated performance unit to make the choreos. The rappers of the group are very talented and have released very listen-worthy tracks and mixtapes.Perhaps the least problematic group. Kpop has had its fair share of controversies, with either some members saying or doing something inappropriate, insensitive, or ignorant, or the entire group engaging in a circus fest. SVT might be the only group that has managed to avoid controversies. The members themselves are very aware of the issues of colorism, racism, sexism, and other social issues. You will see this reflected in their lyrics, their actions, or simply the way they treat others. They are very respectful of fellow idols and staff members and remain humble.The best choreos and some of the best songs. One of the most important aspects of a group is how much you can enjoy them. SVT is well-known for their intricate and creative choreographies. If you notice their live stages, you will see how their dances have a theatrical vibe. They’re very passionate performers and never slack no matter how tired they are. Music taste, I know, is subjective. SVT is one of those groups that experiment with different genres, with most of their songs leaning towards R&B, Soul, Hiphop, Pop, Orchestral EDM, and Rock, leaving something for everyone.I don’t think I have and will come across another group as unique as SEVENTEEN. They changed the way I view Kpop and made me realize that 13 members is not too many, when you get 13 equally-talented and equally-involved members with unique personalities that never fail to amaze you.

I can talk page up and page down about SHINee, but I’ll do it quickly. SHINee is my favourite K-pop group and the reason is very simple - they’re wonderful. Their music ranges from sweet ballads to upbeat dance songs. Wikipedia describes their genres from ranging from contemporary RnB to funk rock to complextro to deep house. SHINee experiments with music and the outcome is always wonderful because SHINee’s vocals are not only suited for one genre. They’re extremely talented and passionate in their art and many of the members like to veer into other aspects than just performing. The notion that K-pop groups don’t make their own music doesn’t stand true with SHINee either as both Minho and Key have been actively participating in writing the lyrics to their raps, Jonghyun both has composed and written lyrics to several of SHINee’s songs and Onew also has written the lyrics to a few of their songs. As far as I know, Taemin has only been penning the lyrics for his own solo songs so far. But not only is their music really really wonderful to listen to, the 5 members of SHINee presents themselves in such a familiar way, that if you first start following SHINee, you will soon find yourself with 5 friends. They have all matured a lot since their debut and it’s obvious. You can tell the development in them. And they never once faked their relationship. Key got a small hit for saying they were only colleagues back in the day, but as such he spoke the truth. Jonghyun also revealed that he saw them as colleagues - they were brought together by work. You will get to know little tidbits of SHINee because they are genuine yet not overly open. And you’ll be able to feel their bond as well. The collegian bond they share but still makes them so very fond of each other. So I said I was gonna be quick and now I ramble on and on. That’s what SHINee does to you. As for favourite song? It’s probably SHINee’s discography.

Let me give you my top 5 list(; 1.BTS This is probably not surprising to you since BTS has been taking the world by storm these last two years. The reason why I love BTS so much is that they have such a strong bond with each other and their fans, and the songs they write are so meaningful. I love them for the fact that they love every single individual fan and they call ARMY their extended family. This makes us feel so close to them and the fact that we matter means so much. So if you haven't listened to BTS, I'm telling you, STOP READING THIS AND PUT ON YOUR HEADPHONES. btw, my bias is Jungkookie!<3 2. Black Pink This is also a predictable one, but Black Pink is by far my favorite girl group ever. Since they debuted, they've only released five songs and they're growing in popularity by the minute. I love Black Pink because they are unique and have such an edge to their songs. The rappers are full of swag and the vocalists are sweet as honey, which is a nice contrast. If your gonna listen to a girl group, Black Pink is a good choice! btw, my bias is Lisa! <3 3. Red Velvet This girl group is sweeter than the actual cake, and it's not hard to believe why. The group debuted in early 2014, and have been making epic comebacks ever since. I love these girls because they have an American Pop feel to them. They have different sound effects than a usual K Pop group, especially in the tracks "Bad Boy" and "Peek-a-Boo". They have grown so much since debut and I am awaiting a new comeback! btw, my bias is Wendy!<3 4. SEVENTEEN My second favorite boy band! SEVENTEEN is amazing because their songs have that "ocean" feel to them, and their choreography is just amazing with all twelve members going at it. They are in a way like BTS, but they brach off into their own definition with their diverse members and different grades of talent. If you ever find yourself a SEVENTEEN fan, congratulations! They're an excellent choice! btw, my bias is Wonwoo!<3 5. TWICE You saw this coming. Since TWICE is the most popular girl group, it's not difficult to believe that they would make it onto this list. These girls are sweet as sugar and I love their music because it's the classic girl group "bubblegum-like" songs and dances. They have such light voices, and their rappers can never be too edgy either. They have an amazing Christmas album, which I listen to over the holidays, and their songs are probably most like Anime openings. I can never say enough about these girls, but there you have it. btw, my bias is Momo!<3 That is my top 5 picks for K-Pop groups! I hope you listen to some of their songs if you haven't, and always remember that "Once you Jimin, you can't Jimout!" So be careful or else you'll get sucked into deep fandom! ARMY FIGHTING!

I’m just gonna copy and paste my answer to a previous question.  Without a doubt, BTS!!! It was this past Labor Day, when I was relaxing and watching YouTube videos of different kinds of people reacting to different video. Then I came across a video of “Teens reacting to K-Pop”, and what do you know? BTS happened to be on there with their video for “Blood Sweat and Tears”. I thought to myself, “This sounds so good. Let me check it out.” After watching the music video in its entirety, I was completely SOLD! From there, it led me to checking out some more of their music. I really got drawn into how their lyrics/choreography are things that you don’t see or hear in today’s pop music anymore. They actually write/produce their own songs which talk about relatable social issues. They’re also not afraid to express their dorky yet genuine selves in interviews and offstage. That’s how I became a fan. In the beginning, I did not have a bias. And to be honest, I do not have an ultimate bias because I love and support every single member in different ways. That being said, my current bias is Jungkook with Suga being my wrecker.

This Group consist of 5 sub-units as of now. NCT U (rotational unit), NCT 127, NCT 2018, NCT DREAM and WAYV/Weisheng V (recently formed unit with 3 new recruited members). response.answer_text: Okay sisters, I hope you’re ready to stan the girl group of the next generation of K-pop, because you will not be able to read this answer without stanning. “And what group would that be,” I hear you asking. Well, let me tell you. Na na na nana na na na nanaNanana nananaEVERGLOWNa na na nana na na na nanaNanana nanana First off, who is EVERGLOW?  EVERGLOW is a rookie K-pop girl group that debuted under Yuehua (Yoo-eh-hwa) Entertainment on March 18th, 2019 with their debut song, Bon Bon Chocolat. EVERGLOW has six members. 1. Kim Sihyeon (Sihyeon) is the second oldest member, lead vocalist, visual and face of the group. She was the fifth member to be revealed, and is known for her bunny teeth and sweet vocals.  2. Han Eunji (Mia) is the third oldest member, main vocalist and main dancer. She was the second member to be revealed, and is known for looking like a younger version of 2ne1’s CL.  3. Jo Serim (Onda) is the third youngest member and lead vocalist. She was the third member to be revealed, and is known for her incredible dance skills and nearly perfect smile.  4. Wang Yiren (Yiren) is the maknae, vocalist, visual, center and lead dancer. She was the fourth member to be revealed, and is known for her incredible visuals, cute appearance, traditional Chinese dance and flexibility.  5. Park Jiwon (E:U) is the oldest member, leader, main rapper, main dancer and main vocalist. She was the fifth member to be revealed, and is known for her iconic platinum blonde hair that she has had since before debut.  6. Heo Yoorim (Aisha) is the second youngest member, lead rapper and vocalist. She was the final member to be revealed, and is known for her height (she’s one of the tallest female idols in all of K-pop at 5′ 8″!).   Next up, the music. Sure, EVERGLOW only has three songs:    BUT— each of them are vastly different from the other two. The range and diversity that they displayed in this debut album is incredibly impressive. I mean they already have more variety in their music than some popular-girl-groups-with-four-members-that-debuted-in-2016-with-one-of-my-favorite-debuts-of-all-time. I would highly recommend listening to each of the songs and basking in the beautiful vocals, especially in Moon and D+1.  The music video. They currently have only one music video (but a new one is dropping with their comeback on Monday!), ignoring that that is a very sad fact for those of us that stan these girls, it is a fantastic music video. They really wanted to show off their superb choreography and beautiful visuals with this video, and they did just that. It is one of my favorite debut music videos of all time, and I would highly recommend it.   This may just be their strongest point: their dance and choreography is out of this world. There’s a clip of BTS circulating on Twitter again of them dancing to “Save ME” and they’re so in sync it’s kind of scary and stan twitter is shook over it. Yeah, that’s EVERGLOW all the time. I mean, just watch these dance covers:    Especially these next three:    Yeah. I know. You’re welcome.  And now, what I consider to be the most important factor in any musical group: chemistry. These girls are best friends and complete crackheads. You can tell that they’re all incredibly close, which is what I’d attribute a great deal of BTS’s own success to. If they continue to show their chemistry, I think they have the potential to climb to the top of the industry just as BTS did.    And now I will leave you with this YouTube playlist I compiled: try not to stan EVERGLOW challenge (impossible!!1! she did what?!) - YouTube This playlist includes every video I linked in this answer as well as some I didn’t. I will be adding to this playlist as EVERGLOW keeps pumping out stan-worthy content.  in closing: stan everglow for clear skin.

I have been waiting for this question FOREVER. My top two kpop ships are MoonSun (Moonbyul and Solar from Mamamoo) and Nyongtory (Seungri and Gdragon from Big Bang). If you don’t ship MoonSun or stan Mamamoo yet, I don’t even know what you’re doing. How fun and flirty they are together. Precious Solar combined with straightforward Moonbyul makes the cuteness even more overwhelming.  Greasy/perverted Moonbyul.  The gayness of Mamamoo in general.  All of this, without even considering MoonSun’s onstage chemistry. I think they are actually together, but no one would know except for the two of them. Nyongtory, in case you didn’t know, is GRi but in Korean (G for Gdragon and Ri for Seungri). It’s difficult to ship any of the Big Bang members with each other because each member can be shipped with almost anyone else, without even taking 2ne1 into account. Gdragon and Seungri are so flirty onstage, and Gdragon always looks like he is falling for Seungri. As a VIP, this ship is everything to me. I think it’s just fan servicing, but who cares? They’re still so adorable and I know and hope that one day it will become cannon. Gdragon has declared his love for Seungri.  There are too many videos of the two of them…so I just picked this one. I hope that all of them will be able to be with the ones they truly love and continue to make great music.

The group that got me into K-Pop—Blackpink. I first heard Boombayah in a slime video, I kid you not. The intro was catchy, and, curious, I looked them up. I listened to their songs, watched their interactions. I decided, wow, I like them! And suddenly, I entered the world of K-Pop. The group that made me stay—Orange Caramel. Interesting choice, right? Orange Caramel isn’t exactly everyone’s first pick these days (sadly), but that didn’t stop me from falling in love with their music. Their music videos are hilarious, cute, and aesthetically pleasing. Their music is catchy, fun, and never fails to put a smile on my face. Their personalities are entertaining, and even philosophical sometimes. To this day, Nana is still my ultimate bias. Had I not discovered Orange Caramel, I wouldn’t have become so devoted to this genre of music, nor would I have taken the time to appreciate other groups. But, with Orange Caramel’s indefinite hiatus, I was forced to find other groups. The group that won my heart—Twice. I love these girls. It feels weird saying that, since I’ve never met any of them in my life and I don’t know them personally. With other idols, I’m sometimes cautious of how they act on camera. Maybe someone I thought was a nice person is actually nasty in real life, and I could never know. But Twice changed my mind—they’re such pleasant girls: down-to-earth, humble, fun-loving, hilarious, and personable. Not to mention, I love cute concepts, and Twice has such a unique sound. Their style can’t be found in Western pop. I will forever rave to me likey and jjirit jjirit and I’m like TT until the end of time, I kid you not. Twice brings light into my life—through their charming personalities and captivating music. Seriously, stan Twice. But what about boy groups? Me? Forget? I would never. While I’m mainly a girl group stan, some boys have really left an impression on me. The boy group with my favorite music—Astro. Boy groups with cute concepts make my day. Hide and Seek is so catchy and adorable and fun; I can play it in the morning, at night, in the afternoon, whenever. All Night is an absolute banger. Always You is beautiful, and Innocent Love is a nice ballad song. I just really like Astro. Thank you for reading! I hope you enjoyed it as much as I did.

My favorite kpop band is BTS (this is a gif)  I’m sure you may or may not be wondering, “Ava, why do you like them so much?” *hint-hint look at the gif above* Lol, no it’s not just that. BTS have literally everything I need right now- The musicMotivation to keep livingThem being themselves/memes/adorable/oops I’m pregnant nowThe fandomTheir music is special. Yes, I feel like they are getting more westernized, but if you go look back at their older songs, they really seem to have their own sound in my opinion. They sing/rap about loving yourself and not worrying about the haters. I think that’s really cool. Their music and their personalities make me want to wake up each day and hear them singing/rapping. To hear Jimin’s high note in Am I Wrong?, to listen to Suga/Agust D rap The Last, to see Jhope dance to Just Dance, etc. They make me want to wake up and get out of bed. To go to school when I don’t want to. And I applaud them for that. Also their dualities are on FIRE. Like, Jhope (my bias) can go from cocoa butter sunshine flower boi to me saying under my breath, “Shit my ovaries.” They are all hilarious and watching a run episode now and then is really fun. The fandom is really nice. I’ve never met a “toxic” A.R.M.Y before, and that’s great. There are a few fan boys I know at my school and my two friends and I are big fans as well. There are a lot of people who know them, but don’t listen to them as well at my school. The A.R.M.Y projects they do for BTS is outstanding. I’ve never been more proud to call myself something like this is a long time. ~ I was originally gonna make this answer longer, so that’s why it was taking me a while. I hope this helped you and I’m sorry I didn’t answer it as quickly as I should’ve. Ava~

I'm an exo-L, army, moomoo, sunday and meu but in my opinion, infinite is the most impressive kpop group I have ever seen. In the beginning I didn't pay much attention to them, I just thought they were like shinee version2. But I am so glad I got to know so much more about them. Sunggyu, sometimes dismissed as a funny sloth, is not only an amazing vocalist, but is also the best leader I have seen so far. He made me cry in the first episode of infinite showtime itself. Woohyun is a top class vocalist and is so funny. Don't take L to be just a pretty face. He's a true gentleman and has an adorable personality. And unlike other groups with useless visuals, this guy can sure sing (watch him on masked singer) and nobody looks as handsome as him while playing a guitar. Ah and our precious Dongwoo. He will never fail to put a smile on his face. He i's a human embodiment of sunshine. Even though his father recently passed away, he did not give up on promotions or get into a gloomy mood. He tried his best. Hoya, hot Hoya. If you watch hit the stage, you know how fire this dude is. Definitely one of the best dancers in kpop. Also an amazing rapper. Sungyeol imo is the most handsome guy I've ever seen with the best proportions. He is known to be a vocalist BUT WHEN HE RAPS IT'S KDJJDJDJ. He will make you laugh so hard your stomach will hurt. And then we have the maknae, Sungjong. He is the purest, sweetest kid I have ever seen or heard. Period. If you don't know much about infinite you must give them a chance. They will steal your hearts. Amazing albums, meaningful mvs and world famous knife sharp choroes (gods of synchronisation I must add). Watch any episode of weekly idol with them as guests, it will make your day.

Short answer: Hi! I definitely recommend a group called highlight, formerly beast. They used to be under cube ent and have a 6th member but he left then the other 5 guys left cube to make their own company.  long answer: As they're their own bosses it gives lots of freedom. Freedom to have fun on stage, get some sleep, eat a healthy amount, and enjoy themselves tbh. I always see other fans talking about how worried they are for their bias but highlight fans are able to sleep easy knowing that highlight isn't pressured or harmed by a big label. To describe their music in one word it would be too difficult so instead ill describe it as an action. Picture someone doing the cha-cha slide but they're sobbing at the same time. I say this because their overall sound is very happy but songs like ‘sleep tight’ and ‘its still beautiful’ are so beautifully sad. ALSO since they run their own company, their own member Junhyung produces and writes the lyrics for each song. Lastly, there are also plenty of solo activities. Yang yoseob has a mini album which is very calming with amazing vocals. Lee Gikwang has a mini album out and its just a fun set of songs which his voice adds nicely to. Yong Junhyung has a mini album and will be coming out with a full one in a bit his songs are calming until you read translations then they're pretty sad. Son Dongwoon has been the mc for a few shows and on variety shows, and their leader Yoon dujun has been taking up acting and dang he’s good. Thanks for reading, check them out if you want!

I have quite a lot of favorites but I’ll give a quick run down on my top 5. EXO: I’ve been with exo since before their debut and they hold a very special place in my heart. Each member is so talented in everything they do. Exo’s discography is one of the best out there. Exo has some of the best vocalists and dancers. Exo is just an all around great group. Red Velvet: I am absolutely in love with each member from Red Velvet. They are all SO talented and they are all so charismatic, it’s hard not to fall for them. Their songs have so much variety, from fun, bubblegum pop to smooth, captivating r&b to powerful, emotional ballads. Seulgi is one of the best girl group dancers I’ve seen. NCT: Even though their concept is a little messy and kind of all over the place, but their members are extremely talented. Ten is one of my favorite dancers in Kpop next to Taemin. The vocalists are very good as well. Their title tracks go hard for no reason and so do their B-Sides. Their choreography is extremely difficult and I give them mad props for executing it so well. Seventeen: They’ve been training since they were super young and all that training really paid off. Their vocals are the most stable in the Kpop industry even while doing that difficult choreography they usually have. They are also one of the most in sync groups while dancing. Each member can sing and dance to almost perfection. Their music is great and each member gets a chance to shine. BTS: I’ve been with them since debut and I’m very glad I got to see them four times in concert and got to meet them. I’m so proud of everything they’ve accomplished this far and there’s no where else to go except up from here. Even though I’m not liking their new music, I can appreciate the message they’re sending. There’s no doubt that all the members are extremely talented and that their songs are all great.

EXO Their name can fit anywhere; lightsticks, album covers, etc. Every single design is so creative and incorporates the group name into it. I love their logo as well, it’s extremely flexible. Whoever dreamed up their name deserves a promotion! STRAY KIDS What makes this name so special to me is the fact that the members came up with it themselves. “Stray” means that they are pushing the barriers of the music world, “straying” away from the norms. I also think it could mean that they are trying to find themselves as “stray” could refer to being lost, especially with their I AM: trilogy. The group’s name can also be abbrievated as SKZ, in case some people find it too long. RED VELVET It’s perfect for their concept. They have their “red” side, which is fresh, cutesy, and cheerful (Power Up, Happiness, Red Flavor). Then they have their “velvet” side, which can be creepy, mature and dark (Bad Boy, Peek-A-Boo). Once again, a win for the SM staff! NCT 127 First, NCT is so cool. It stands for Neo Culture Technology, and they are introducing a whole new “technology” with their creative music and concept! 127 is the coordinates of South Korea, which is pretty awesome. TXT It stands for “TOMORROW X TOGETHER”. The 5 of them are facing “tomorrow” “together”, and all came together because of 1 dream. I just think the combination of the two words is so beautiful, and the idea of this “friendship” is really cute. ATEEZ ATEEZ means A to Z, which is really creative actually. But how cool is it to say “ATEEZ”? It’s like the perfect name that would instantly make you think of a K-Pop group. So catchy and easy to market. Even their fandom’s name, ATINY, is lovely as well. DREAMCATCHER Yet another group whose name fits their concept. This name is just so ethereal, and I love that it can either be a dream or a nightmare. A dreamcatcher is actually an object which is really pretty, just like the group’s concept.

The best Doesn’t exist. popular, does though. But i’m going to say my personal favorite (there’s others but I’m in class trying to waste time writing) STRAY KIDS:  I really look up to 3RACHA, Their predebut rap/hiphop group. Chan Is such a great leader and I hear a lot of ARMY’S and EXO-Ls (Not so much exo-ls) Saying that their rap line is superior. I had an EXO-L the other day (PURE EXO-L) tell us how well SKZ had preformed at MAMA and how thankful they are to have performed EXO songs as well over time. An ARMY who isnt familiar with SKZ Much says that our rap line is top tier and that she hopes that SKZ and STAY go far in the contract time we have. Minho and Felix’s Elimination:JYP must have saw how differently they acted without the other two. when they were brought back for their “Last performance” they pushed through so hard only because it was their last chance of having Minho and Felix back. Chan’s Late nights: “Chan-hyung would stay at the studio til 5 am every day and then go back at 10 am. If I was him I would have collapsed by now,Really, Hes just amazing” —Jisung (Stray kids show) He did this so he could get them to debut sooner, and he did it out of love for his members “He teaches the choreography, and whenever we dont get it right, he reteaches until we do” —Jisung (SKZ show) 4 albums, 9months: FOUR albums and they’ve only been Debuted for NINE months. and for the LONGEST time we were the “Unnamed fandom” by other fandoms. Who else has done that in that SHORT of time? 3Racha: They had put almost every member at risk except for a few, and they were rappers. If JYP wanted a rap group, they should have debuted 3Racha. Granted, I miss their music but they’ve got SKZ. MAMA 2018: Hi, Little more of a rant now. First of, I want a StrayKids flag. Second, DISTRICT 9 ROCK VERSION: A CONCEPT 3rd: Minho had said he was nervous to perform in front of of Bangtan because he, a few years back, was a backup dancer for them. and yet… he killed it. 4th: Felix was SO SO SO SO SO energetic! I was proud uwu 5th: 3RACHA P.A.C.E. performance. It was so powerful and happy! 6th: Jisung’s “STRAYKIDS IN THE BUILDINGGGGGG” These kids deserve the world. Stan SKZ

Day6 This band. I thought I couldn’t love a group more than BTS, but then I found Day6. And it’s not that I’ve given up on the BTS boys (not even close). I’m still a full-blown army. But since diving into Day6’s music, I’ve discovered a depth and rawness that isn’t often encountered in Kpop or American pop music. Day6 writes most of their own songs, and one of their members, YoungK, writes almost all of their lyrics. As a result, they have a very distinctive sound and lyrical presence. It’s a band, so they all play instruments. Their talent is incredible! And of course, they are so funny. Their members are always making My Days (their fangroup) smile. Stan talent! Stan Day6! Loona One quite underrated and special woman groups nowadays in my opinion. They premiered in 2018, after months and months of buzz. Actually, it absolutely was one of many coolest marketing and advertising methods I’ve ever before present in Kpop. Fundamentally, Loona was like, “Hi, we’re perhaps not likely to be a woman group that perhaps eventually ends up having a couple solamente musician projects in some years. Many of us are going to be solo musicians and artists INITIALLY, and then we’ll bond which will make anything even better-a woman team made up of crazy skilled, *individual* musicians.” So that is among fundemental concepts of Loona. Ahead of debut, each one of the 12 people debuted separately due to their own solamente songs. In addition, subgroup paths had been introduced. This is why method, Loona currently features a large track record, despite having just debuted last summer. If you would like development, you’ll def like Loona. :)

GOT7  GOT7 is my favorite Group and no matter how much I like songs from other groups etc. no group is for me like GOT7 and here are some reasons why. PersonalityI think that they have one of the most honest personalities in KPOP. They say their thoughts and opinions, they're saying mostly their struggles and hardships. They are honestly talking about their relationship and their fights. They are so thankful and thoughtful. They have problems and issues just like everyone else. They are doing mistakes and they are learning from their mistakes. They are one of the loveliest and most caring idols I personally know. And they have two groups that are really really really close to them. MONSTA X      And BTOB     2. Hardwork I know that every other group is working hard. GOT7 has foreign members. And they had to sacrifice a lot to debut. Just like the Korean members. They had in 2016 or 17 a really hard time and they felt really bad. Jackson cried while talking about the hardship they had to went through. Everyone had their struggles and they had their own hardships. They are doing their best and are thanking their fans for everything but..we feel like that we don't do enough. Bambam is crying everytime when he feel bad for us. And he usually don't cry. We never saw him crying since the letter from his mother that he became when he went with Jackson to a survival show. He felt so bad for us..told us so many sad things..oh god when I think about it I have to cry again… he told us that we should care about us more, that we shouldn't do everything for GOT7 but for our selves too. That he things that we are doing so much but they don't…. Arghh this boy… What I want to say: They worked so hard but still didn't got that what they deserve. But they created a wonderful fandom. They created us Ahgases. So he shouldn't feel bad. Because I'm so happy. They are recently the only ones that can give me a smile..  3. Friendship They don't have only a good relationship with BTOB and Monsta X. And the maknaes with some 97 liner (Bts, Seventeen…) they also have a really good relationship with each members family. No joke xD. The family members also have a wonderful relationship together! GOT7s relationship is one of the most genuine relationships ever. They fight or fought a lot xD but that's how they grew more and more together. They have different tastes or different personalities but they are getting along so well …WOW. They are so close together and that's so sweet. Like bambam said:  They went through a lot together. That's why they are not only group members but real friends..a real family. And that's another point why I love them so much. Here are some family pics: JB, Yugyeom and Mark with Marks family  The Mothers( except Jacksons mother because she couldn't come), who are doing GOT7s Sign.  JB with Jacksons Parents  Mark and Jackson with Jacksons Family  GOT7 is such a lovely group ^^ And their friendship is Gold. And I love how supportive their familys are..even when some of them weren't really happy with this choice at first 4. Everything else Their music -masterpieces Their reality shows -hilarious Their talent -amazing …. These were some examples why I love them so much ^^. For me they couldn't be better. They are doing what they love. And even when they regret some things that they did. These things lead them to GOT7. They are perfect in their imperfection. GOT7 stands for 7 people that came together. With different backgrounds, different nationalities and different personalities. That is what makes this group so unique. Like Jackson said: 7 for 7, 7 or nothing. GOT7 only exists with all of them. And We IGOT7s, we AHGASES only exist when GOT7 exist. I hope that you liked my post^^

To be honest, I am a hardcore fan of BTS, Blackpink, Exo and (G)-idle. That means, I am an Army, Blink, Exo-L and Neverland. But I am also fond of some other kpop groups. These are… 1.Mamamoo: Mamamoo is a 4 member girl group. Mamamoo debuted on 18th June, 2014 under RBW.   2.AB6IX: AB6IX(pronounced as "A B Six" which means “Absolute six") is a five member boy group formed by Brand New Music on 22th May, 2019.   3.CIX: CIX (Pronounced as C-I-X, short for Complete in X) is a five member boy group formed by C9 Entertainment on 23th July, 2019.   4.CLC: CLC (An acronym for "Crystal Clear") is a girl group formed by Cube Entertainment on 19th March, 2015. The group consists of seven members.   5.Oneus: Oneus (Pronounced as "One Us") is a Boy group formed by RBW. The group consists of six members. They debuted on 9th January, 2019.   6.Nu'est: NU'EST (Short for New Establish Style Tempo) is a 5 member boy group formed by Pledis Entertainment.The group debuted on March 15, 2012.   7. TXT: Tomorrow X Together commonly known as TXT is a five-member boy group formed by Big Hit Entertainment. They debuted on 4th March, 2019.   8. Twice: Twice is formed by JYP Entertainment on 20th October, 2015. The group is composed of nine members.   9. Everglow: Everglow is a 6 member girl group under Yuehua Entertainment. The group debuted on 18th March, 2019.   10. Seventeen: Seventeen, also stylized as SVT, is a boy group formed by Pledis Entertainment in 2015. The group consists of 13 members divided into three sub-units.   That's it…I know, I am very crazy about kpop♡♡♡

INFINITE.  My beautiful boys, Infinite. I don’t think I can provide the perfect answer for the reason why I stan them. I’ve been a fan for four years, and I can’t stop but love them each and every day. They make me smile, laugh, cry, they make me live. The fandom and Infinite are going through a hard time right now. Fans are already taking sides, blaming each other and even leaving the fandom. I know everyone has their own opinions, but if they have been sincere when they carved “Inspirit” on their chest throughout the years they supported Infinite, they would have stayed and fought for Infinite. Just as the six members have fought to keep the name “Infinite”. I’m not saying that Hoya is the bad one here, I’m sure it was hard for him to make a decision in leaving the group too. It’s hard and I still feel weird for seeing only six members in the grp, but I respect and support his choice. He can go far with his talents. I believe in him. If I have to answer the reason why I stan them (and Hoya), it’s because I felt the sincerity from them. It’s hard to see that in other groups. They take care of the fans well and make us their priority. They worried abt us a lot, they got angry and complained if the staffs mistreated the fans, and they always try to give back as much as we give. I feel so loved being in the fandom. It’s like I’m being squished from their hugs and they refused to let go of my hands. I guess they lived up to their songs for being an obsessive boyfriend lol. They are all so sweet. Never it has crossed in my mind, to leave the fandom. I still have a lot more to give back to them from all their loves and efforts. So I should support them til the end. I hope Inspirits who are reading this will stay strong for Infinite. Have faith in Infinite and Hoya!

SHINee SHINee wasn't even my first kpop group I actually got into kpop because of infinite n super junior but SHINee attracted me with their bops and sucked me deep into their blackhole with their ballads(SHINee has legendary bops but their b-side tracks n ballads are absolute winners so good n soothing on ears n their solo works are amazing too). I have always been a sucker for good harmonies n SHINee’s harmonies are probably most of the best harmonies that I have listened to(seriously listen to 1000 years by your side 130920 SHINee 2013 United States Odaiba Alarm live_(480p) - 동영상 Dailymotion (from 12:51) it's such a beautiful song). When it comes to performances they are absolutely amazing it's not just shawols who agree with it. The way they sound so stable n amazing while doing their complicated n hard choreographies is unbelievable. The fact that there was a server breakdown in england due to the ticket bookings for a SHINee act wayback in 2011 to the completely sold out recent Tokyo dome shows how relevant they had been in the kpop act dispite them being a 10year old group. The way they treat their fans n the way they express their gratitude towards their fans is beautiful you can just feel it. The mutual respect that SHINee n shawols share is really incredible(Remember how key requested for the fans to keep his holiday a secret n release the pics later after he finishes his holiday n how they acknowledged his request. How they held mini fanmeets while waiting in the studio for music show recordings or performances). SHINee really are one of those groups that cannot be disliked even if you are not a SHINee fan, (maybe not stan them) you will still end up liking them. Their discography is so broad that you will find atleast a couple of songs of your liking for sure. SHINee will always be the top group for me. While stanning a single group in Kpop you will come across many other groups n kpop has so much to offer that it's really hard to ignore others so the other groups that I follow are big bang, vixx, super junior, dbsk, snsd, f(x), 4minute, exo, btob, seventeen, 2ne1, infinite, cnblue, akmu n many more mostly 2nd n 3rd gen kpop n just a few new gen groups. Note: Shawols struggles are way too real when it comes to picking a bias so I didn't mention my bias.

There are too many on my list, because I love to appreciate all groups, whether they’re big, small, or different in any way. In no particular order, here are some of my favorites. I’ll list the girls first. Red Velvet - The members are all so beautiful, and I appreciate their versatility in their concept, as well as their consistency in quality. Wendy is also a top-tier vocalist. Seulgi has a very distinct tone. Irene is a high-grade visual, and Joy is my bias. Yeri is the relatable maknae. They’re very cohesive. If they have a concert in my state, I will buy tickets and rush there with my friends. Gfriend - I love their concept; it’s like a breath of fresh air. Their style is clean and classy, and I adore the girls. They’re one of the first girl groups I became a fan of when getting into kpop groups. I also appreciate that their agency lets them try new styles; it’s great! Yuju is a very good vocalist as well. If they perform in my state, I will also rush to see them. TWICE - I’m very basic, and so I love their music. That’s mostly what it is. And I’ve also been a huge fan of Jeonghan ever since the beginning, before I even liked the group. I don’t know the members very well, but I just appreciate when Jeonghan gets more attention and lines. It makes me happy. Oh My Girl - They have some really nice hits, like “Liar Liar” and “Windy Day”. Their group has such a quirky but cute and sweet style; it’s really something amazing. I’m sure they are plenty successful in South Korea, too. I also was a big fan of their “Banana Allergy Monkey” comeback with the unit. Lovelyz - This group has some very interesting sounds in their music. I find it to be full of satisfying synth sounds for certain songs; their songs are not stereotypically catchy like TWICE, but their melodies are a little more complex and still interesting at the same time. Also Kei is an amazing vocalist. Girls’ Generation - Can’t beat it, they are the queens. Classic group, legendary members, with so many talents. I love a lot of their music, and they are such powerful women; over time, their influence has reached a very high level. I appreciate Taeyeon, Tiffany, and Jessica’s vocal talents a lot too. LOONA - I’ve been following them since Kim Lip’s Eclipse came out, and I really love the effort their company puts in for them. Promotion was done so well; they also hired Monotree to direct their videos, which was a great choice. The songs are high quality and satisfying, and the girls are versatile. Orbits forever. This is a group I would attend a concert to see. KHAN - The two members from the disbanded group The Ark are in this duo. They have amazing talent in dancing and singing; their stability is amazing. I believe they have not lip synced on stage a single day at all when they promoted “I’m Your Girl”. I watched close to all of their lives and I can tell. Dancing and singing at the same time, but perfectly? They are the bomb. BLACKPINK - I discovered them from the beginning… right at debut. I was 15 and excited. I watched “Boombayah” and I knew I wanted to stan these unnies right away. So I did, and more than two years later, I’m still with them, supporting them. (I don’t buy physical stuff but I purchase their songs on iTunes, being a poor college student lol) This is a group that I want to attend a concert for someday. 4minute (disbanded) - I didn’t get into kpop until after they disbanded, but I really like their high energy songs; so impactful, while also being total jams. Hyuna is a beast, by the way. Can’t escape her power. SISTAR (disbanded) - I believe I may have seen an MV of theirs while out and about at restaurants, but I wasn’t into pop at the time even, sadly. I discovered their summer bops and it was glorious. I now follow the activities of Hyolyn. I.O.I. (disbanded) - Quite possibly could be named as one of the best idol groups of all time. Full of visual and true talent; the best of the best, trained through their own companies AND a survival show. Faced a lot of trials. I really appreciated that there were a good amount of members who could speak English, as that’s something a majority of idol groups lack nowadays. I find it helps to really increase international appeal. Those are all the groups that I invest time in following to the best of my ability. I like more groups, but this list would be too long if I included everyone. Onto the boys! There are a lot less that I really like. BTS - I don’t like to call myself an A.R.M.Y., but I do like BTS music. I don’t follow all their releases because I’m so swamped in my girl group world, but this is the boy group that I’ve purchased the most songs from on iTunes. And I’m really stingy, so this says a lot. I appreciate these men a lot, and their hard work. VIXX - I enjoy their classy and sensual style. As a group, they work together well. I really have to admit, I became a fan of them initially because of “Chained Up”. It’s such an amazing song and a really pretty video. A lot of their music videos are so artistic and inspiring. As a visual artist myself, I like taking a look at their MVs every now and then. GOT7 - I haven’t been into them enough in order to say I’m an iGOT7, but I appreciate them as a group and I like “Just Right” quite a lot. As someone who has done martial arts for 11 years myself, I appreciate Mark Tuan’s martial arts tricking skills a lot; actually he is my bias. I just kind of related right there. Also their visuals are on point. SEVENTEEN - I have invested a lot of time in this group; I’ve tried so hard to learn the members and I’ve gotten pretty far, so I’ll keep going. But aside from that, their hard work and sheer dedication to being an incredibly self-sufficient group is incredible. SEVENTEEN has got to be my absolute personal favorite boy group of all time. Their songs are consistently good and they pull off every concept so well. They commit to it. I truly admire them… hats off to the oppas. NCT Dream - I became a fan of them right when they debuted; I was 15, I related to them, and I connected more easily because I was the same age as them (granted, Chenle and Jisung were 13 at the time, but you get the point). I liked their cute bubblegum pop sound, and their dance skills were quite good. Their visuals were nice as well; although they’ve grown out of the little boy image, I still appreciate them a lot. ASTRO is a group that I want to appreciate; hopefully I can find more time to look into them. I hear Cha Eun-woo is becoming very popular recently. I liked their song “Hide and Seek” quite a lot, and I find the members to be adorable, so hopefully I can do more research about them. And those are the personal favorites I can think of at the moment! I know there are other groups out there that could be just as amazing as these, and I have yet to discover them.

Seventeen, or SVT. S(ynchonization), V(isuals), T(alent). Hands down. They came from nothing, locked away in the basement of a failing and poor company, their debut kept getting pushed back (for 2/3 years!). They worked so hard, promoting themselves, and look where they are now. They produce all of their own music and award winning choreographies. They’re so damn synchronized , its insane. Their best known is probably Dont Wanna Cry, which won 5 awards since it’s such a work of ART. I recommend that you watch it, they’re all so synchronized (which is hard to do with a group of THIRTEEN boys) and dance so well. They are all such genuinely nice, talented, and kind people. They thanks and love their fans so much. They’ve even made a title song just for their fans, called Thanks. I have heard COUNTLESS firsthand stories of the kindness of seventeen from so many types of people, from fans to reporters. They also have a bond that no other group can really compare to. They work so well as a team and love each other so much, it so evident. There are so many examples of this; you can find them anywhere on youtube. Each member has a ring that they got when they debuted. They’re all identical and they really bind the members together. They treasure their rings and their connections to each other so much. Bonus: EVERY SINGLE NIGHT, they have heart to heart conversations AS A GROUP, reflecting on the day and themselves and each other. EVERY NIGHT. Find me another group that has a bond as strong as theirs. I’ll wait

Stray Kids i love their music because it’s so different. i’ve never heard anything like Side Effects in the K-pop community. their songs like District 9, Miroh, Side Effects, Victory Song etc. make me feel like a badass, and if i had a bad day, these are my go to songs. i also like their music because 3racha (chan, changbin, jisung) write and produce most of their songs. it’s just something about groups making their own music that really intrigues me. BTS i love BTS’s music because well, it’s the complete opposite of Stray Kids. my favorite album my them is Love yourself Her, which consists mostly of really soft songs. if i need to cry, i always listen to Epiphany or Euphoria. i love the MOTS album, and Home is a bop. they also make a lot of their music, but i’m not sure if they actually produce all of them (like Stray Kids). i really appreciated that yoongi wrote / produced his solo mixtape. ~aria louise

My favorite kpop group, and honestly the only one that i stan with my entire heart is BTS. These hardworking, humble and talented angels put a smile on my face every. single. day. When my family asks if i'm smilling to my phone because i'm talking to my boyfriend it's always because i'm looking at a picture or video of BTS. They make me happy in a way that nothing else except my best friend can. And since she is also an ARMY, 80% of our conversations are about them. Their music makes me sing, dance, smile, laugh, cry, scream my lungs out while jumping around the house. I know their lyrics, their choreographys, i have thousands of photos and videos of them on my phone, all of their songs, even the covers. BTS are present in every part of my life. My ringtone is a BTS song. I wake up everyday to a BTS song. I fall asleep everyday to BTS songs. Even my damn credit card password is BTS related. And what i love the most about them is their personality. Even tho they are so famous, they're still the most humble people i've ever known. And they're SO hard working. They deserve the fucking world. I found out I had depression (i still do) a few months after I fell in love with them. And honestly if it wasn't for them (and my best friend) i would probably be dead by now. These seven boys give me a reason to wake up and get out of bed everyday. To keep trying. To keep fighting. To keep living. To be 100% fucking honest i would die for these boys because they saved my life.

That's up to your taste. Kpop has a lot different ‘feeling’ groups. Kpop isn't nt always limited to the pop genre. Exo, red velvet, seventeen, gfriend, infinite are very clean cut, very smooth and a lot of emphasis on vocal quality. You'll get the more rebel, free and almost going against the grain kind of kpop that focuses on hip hop like BTS, B. A. P, monsta x, stray kids, ikon. (nct is like refined form of this style) The legendary big bang, 2ne1, girls generations, super junior, tvxq, jyj, boa, rain, Lee hyori. Some groups are equally popular for the personality as they are for their talent like mamamoo, btob, got7, twice, hilight. The bands like the rose, Day6, F. T island, drug restaurant. The exceptions like winner and vixx-good Quality, different aesthetics. If you wanna support some lesser popular groups or some younger groups, there's ohmygirl, pentagon, A. C. E, April, loona, wjsn, gwsn, sf9, nct dream, the Boyz g-idle. There's only one co-ed fixed group which is KARD. Of course there's more but way too many to mention all. Once you into it, YouTube just starts suggesting a whole lot of stuff.

Hai, i was kpopers, back when kpop was hits in 2010. I get that you already has many people recommend you to BTS or other groups that popular nowadays, but i’ll give you another one, that you totally regret for not knowing them when you still learned about kpop hehehe.So, i'm going to recommend you this boygroup you really need to know (from 2nd gen ofc). They are Beast/Highlight B2st or Beast was boygrup from Cube Ent. they debuted in 2009, with six people (from top left: Dongwoon, Doojoon, Yoseob, Hyunseung; bottom left: Junhyung, Gikwang)  But in 2016, Hyunseung left the group. then in 2017 the 5 remain boy made decision that they would left the agency, but bcs of some disagreement, the boy can’t use their group name, so then they build their own company, Around Us Ent, and change their name to Highlight (was also the name of their recent song that time).  actually i’m not into kpop after 2013 or so, but up until now i still root for them (Just two bands, Super Junior and them!) i personally would recommend ‘Fiction’ or ‘Good Luck’ for starter, bcs i think that it was their best M/V and dance. if you into ballad, you can try ‘On Rainy Days’ or ‘Will You be Alright’, for fun song ‘Beautiful Night’ or ‘Plz Don’t be Sad’ And fact, they ranked as the stable male group along with Shinee and Infinite, the three of them called Shi-Bea-In. Beast/Highlight also one of the group that billboard recommended for best group you should know in 2015 article (spoiler, the most of that recommend was 90s group) Along with this recommend, i should tell you sad news too, recently the sex scandal that also involved Seungri Bigbang, made Junhyung left Highlight, bcs he admitted that he know about it, and feels sorry for not thinking that it would make a big problem. (Sad sad info, Junhyung is writer, producer and excellent rapper of group) they all now enlisted to military. and will be back in 2020 i think, maybe with just 4 members left. as the old boyband, they won many award, well mannered, cute when in fact they all almost hit 30 ._., they have loyal fans and not toxic i think. So, if you don’t know them, give it a try, you would’t regret. (from former kpopers, to just stan Highlight & SuJu)

Yay for the answer request - people gonna say BTS, so I’m gonna do some non-BTS ones. ——— Stray Kids Debuted in 2018, they came from a survival show, SKZ is very unique, because the members were put together by their leader Bang Chan, and they mainly rely on their self-producing (Han, Changbin and Chan have producing credits on 99% of their songs). They won multiple ROTY-awards, have a crazy amount of songs already 30+ in 1,5 years, dabbled into multiple genres. They have stable vocals, powerful main dancers, and one of the strongest raplines in the entire k-pop industry. Fun fact: if we count every rapper SKZ has 6 rappers.  Members are: Woojin, Chan, Minho (Lee Know), Changbin, Hyunjin, Han (Jisung), Felix, Seungmin, I.N (Jeongin)  They are adorable, funny and weird, did a lot of cool stuff, like walked on NYC Pride, and are generally really considerate and sweet idiots. Also fandom is called STAY, mainly international, but luckily they are slowly gaining popularity in SK too. Monsta X Sweet, woke and amazing members.  MX has one of the strongest visual as a group in the entire kpop, often performing in revealing clothes - however this is really not why they should be stanned. Kihyun is probably the best male main vocalist as of now (don’t hate me other fandoms), who also happens to be ridicolously stable while doing MX choreos (which are not easy), and the rest of the vocal line is great too.  Their rapline: Joohoney (Jooheon) and I.M (Changkyun) may only be two people but holy they are a force to be reckoned when it comes to rap. Jooheon is often considered to be the best idol rapper right now, and well, it’s either him or Stray Kids Han/Changbin. Their dance line: MX as a group is really synchronized. Members: Shownu, Wonho, Minhyuk, Kihyun, Hyungwon, Jooheon, I.M iKON They are very underrated and deserve more love. I don’t want to talk about the Hanbin thing - I’m just gonna say I miss him badly.  iKON has pretty decent title tracks, but why I fell in love with them are their b-sides, which have songs like this masterpiece:  Fandom is called iKonic, members are: Bobby, Jay, Ju-ne, Song, DK, Chan, (and B.I who used to be their leader, but was forced out by YG.)

Hey there!! Kpop is one tricky thing, there are always new artists debuting and everyone is unsure of who to stan and who to support and whatnot. However, I will definitely say Stray Kids are ABSOLUTELY one group you should support and I will tell you why. Stray Kids are a group of 9 boys: Kim Woojin (the oldest), Bang Chan (the leader), Lee Minho (Lee Know) Seo Changbin, Hwang Hyunjin, Han Jisung, Lee Felix (Yongbok), Kim Seungmin and yang Jeongin (The youngest/Maknae) These boys went through a survival show called Stray Kids in which they worked so hard in but unfortunately lost Lee Know and Felix during the show (for ridiculous reasons) however, the remaining 7 boys carried on with the survival show in which a couple of other members like Hyunjin and Jisung were at risk of elimination. Later on in episode 9 of the survival show JYP brought Felix and Lee Know back and Stray Kids had to do a performance on stage as OT7 and OT9 and then the public decided whether Stray Kids would debut as 7 or as 9. Fortunately, 96% of the public voted for OT9 which i was so happy about because all of the boys worked so hard. Stray Kids make relatable songs talking about societal struggles and dealing with mental health issues such as Depression, Anxiety, Insomnia since the members too have struggled with mental health issues. Chan the leader does a Vlive once every week to talk and to play people`s favourite songs since he knows people struggle to sleep at night. Chan has such a beautiful heart and does and would do anything for STAY. he comforts his members, he helps out where he can and I can pretty much say that for each of the members of Stray Kids. Stray Kids are a self produced, self written, self made group in which Chan chose each of the other 8 members by himself in which JYP did not even get to meet until the survival show. STAY`s write letter to the boys and they do the most beautiful and most humbling thing, they read the problems that their fans are facing and they use STAY`s letters to make songs and to deliver such a passionate piece of music or pieces of music I should say and help their fans overcome or get through any troubles. Stray Kids have won 13 ROTY awards in under one year and a half, they have been on America tours, Asia Tours, toured Australia and are coming to perform in multiple places in Europe e.g. England, Russia, Germany, France this month!! :) Stray Kids do not just feel like “another boy group” they are honestly like your best friends and family, they used to do Q and A sessions on Twitter and KakaoTalk and would respond, mainly Felix and Chan reply but the other members of course would too. Felix`s responses were so heartwarming he would call STAY`s love, darling and the most cutest of all Bubby! The boys get a lot of hate from people for no reason especially the leader Chan, even though those people know Chan would do literally anything for them yet they still hate and disrespect him, it would be so lovely to have more people come into the STAY fandom and help the existing STAY like myself give Chan and the rest of the boys as much appreciation, respect, care, love and support as we have already tried to give. Sorry for this being long but I just could not express my love and appreciation for Stray Kids in a minimal couple of sentences. I really hope you become a STAY and enjoy listening to and appreciating the boys as much as I do. #STANOT9 #STAN3RACHA. I also forgot to mention that Jisung, Chan and Changbin formed a group called 3RACHA before Stray Kids existed and the make awesome songs like P.A.C.E, WOW, Placebo, Domestic Banana, For You, Matroshyka, Runners High, Double Knot, ID:a, Cloud -9, Broken Compass, NXT 2 You, Zone, 42. 3RACHA does the majority of the composing, writing of the songs but the other 6 members take part in it too.

Day6 This band. I thought I couldn’t love a group more than BTS, but then I found Day6. And it’s not that I’ve given up on the BTS boys (not even close). I’m still a full-blown army. But since diving into Day6’s music, I’ve discovered a depth and rawness that isn’t often encountered in Kpop or American pop music. Day6 writes most of their own songs, and one of their members, YoungK, writes almost all of their lyrics. As a result, they have a very distinctive sound and lyrical presence. It’s a band, so they all play instruments. Their talent is incredible! And of course, they are so funny. Their members are always making My Days (their fangroup) smile. Stan talent! Stan Day6! Loona One of the most underrated and unique girl groups out there in my opinion. They debuted in 2018, after months and months of hype. In fact, it was one of the coolest marketing strategies I’ve ever seen in Kpop. Basically, Loona was like, “Hey, we’re not going to be a girl group that maybe ends up having a couple solo artist projects in a few years. We are ALL going to be solo artists FIRST, and then we’ll come together to make something even better-a girl group comprised of crazy talented, *individual* artists.” So that’s one of the fundemental concepts of Loona. Prior to debut, each of the 12 members debuted separately with their own solo tracks. Additionally, subgroup tracks were released. Because of this strategy, Loona already has a huge track list, despite having only debuted last summer. If you like innovation, you’ll def like Loona. :)

I have two groups I stan: EXO, my main group, and GOT7. - EXO  Buckle up, because I have a lot to say about EXO. EXO was the group that introduced me to K-Pop. Before EXO, I was a lil dumb shit who assumed that K-Pop = BTS. I discovered EXO's Chen through a drama OST and fell in love with his voice. I decided to check his group out, just so I could hear him sing more. Lo and behold, EXO had a Chinese subgroup. I was shocked, as I thought K-Pop groups were, well, strictly Korean. And it happens that I'm Chinese, so their Chinese songs were very enjoyable to listen to. The Chinese members were relatable in a way, I guess. I told myself I would only listen to EXO-M. If you're an EXO-L, you know that it's impossible to stan only one member/subgroup/etc. Migrated to stanning the whole of EXO. Best damn decision. EXO's vocals, imo, can't be matched. No other group's vocals are powerful as theirs. I find all of their songs bops, even the non-title track ones. They also release a wide range of songs - pop, R&B, ballades, etc. I can always listen to EXO no matter what mood I'm in. Briefly mentioning their close bond as to keep the answer short. Haha. It's not short. - GOT7  Let me talk about their relationships. They. Are. Super. Close. They're brothers from different mothers. You can tell by the way they act that they aren't faking it. They're super entertaining to watch. Trust me on this. They're very kind to their fans, and always keep an eye out for them. Jackson once bought a bunch of water for the Ahgases (fans) who were standing outside for them on a hot day. Many kind acts. Bops. Some of their songs are whole ass bops. They mainly release trappy/poppy songs. When I'm in the mood, there's nothing better (maybe except for EXO, hehe) to listen to. - Thanks for the request! Hope you enjoyed. :)

As a fan of different k-pop groups all at the same time, it’s pretty hard to pick a favorite. For context here’s the list of K-pop groups that i listen to BTS, EXO, NCT(including the sub-units NCT U, NCT DREAM, NCT 127 & WayV ), Straykids, SuperM, BlackPink, ITZY, Twice, Red Velvet, CLC, Everglow, and other artists like IU, AgustD, Wonho, Taemin, Baekhyun, etc. Now that you’ve seen how many groups i listen to and if you have listened to as many as i have, it is pretty difficult to pick a favorite out of these many groups, cause each of them has their own style of singing, rapping, and performing. If you make a playlist of their songs, you could listen to so many different types of music or, should i say k-pop in the span of just 20 songs. But if i had to pick a favorite out of these, i would say i’m a little biased towards EXO, cause i’m drawn towards vocals and EXO is best at it, not that the other groups have really good vocalists, but each of them has their own style and each style corresponds to a different mood, for example BTS is for relaxing, EXO is for more upbeat, NCT if i want to party, Red velvet, CLC, Everglow, Blackpink, ITZY, etc for more mature and sassy kind of mood, Twice just makes me happy, and others are just for time-pass or if i had to do some kind of work of some kind of work or other. And yeah that’s how i would describe my favorite groups. and if you guys want to check out a playlist for all their songs, you could at the link below K_POP_ARCHIVES, a playlist by Abhinav Bammidi on Spotify this is my personal collection of all the songs that i like, make sure to check it out
