Yes! I love love love K-pop. I just recently got interested in the genre of music this summer but these are my favorite groups: Male Groups Monsta X— this is my ult group, and the group is consisted of 7 members but most of the groups I stan are made up of 7 members which I find a funny coincidence. But the seven members are … Shownu, the leader, main dancer & lead vocalist The main vocalist, Kihyun Lead dancer & vocalist + visual, Wonho Vocalist and visual Minhyuk Vocalist and other lead dancer + visual Hyungwon Main rapper, vocalist Jooheon Lead rapper, vocalist & maknae I.M And here I grant you the 7 visuals, vocalists, and rappers and most importantly the 7 gods that make up Monsta X. But this of course is coming from a Monbebe so if you don’t agree then that’s ok with me. But moving on, the rap line for Monsta X is crazy, so that’s why I gave them gifs instead of pictures. Jooheon and I.M’s charisma is sensational and their stage presence is always full of energy and vigor. The vocal line for MX is also very special; the main vocalist, Kihyun has the most beautiful voice. His high notes are always a success, and the way his voice runs over notes in songs are so pretty to me. His voice is my favorite ever, and that goes for all artists I listen to, Western or Korean. Shownu’s voice is sweet, and soft and elegant. He has great voice control, and whenever I listen to a Monsta X song I’m always soothed whenever I hear his verse. Ah, Wonho. His voice is sultry, and raspy and deep and manlier than a manly man’s. But it can hit high notes, express sadness, and leave audiences dumbfounded. Wonho’s voice is very beautiful, and I love listening to it while watching the lyrics meanings because it always sounds more beautiful when the words are full of meaningful sentiments (which most times, they are). Minhyuk’s voice is so cute. I find his voice to be the most calm out of the whole vocal line but also the one that has the most passion (besides Kihyun’s) if that makes sense. Idk, whenever I hear him sing I just hear a lot of emotion or attitude or sass. His voice always stands out. Hyungwon is like that one vocalist in the group that never gets enough lines, if any. But that’s the worst part because his voice is honestly the most distinct (to me at least) in the group, but maybe that’s because I barely hear it so when I do I’m usually like “oh yup that’s my baby Hyungwon!!” But in 2018, many Monbebe are rooting for Starship to give Hyungwon more lines because he deserves it, but the fact that in most performances he’s center stage because he’s a lead dancer makes up for it. He’s also a DJ/producer and in his pre-debut days he was a model. But that’s about it for my ult boy K-pop group Monsta X. I’d say a lot more about the members as individuals and them as a group, but then that’d take too long so I’ll just move onto other groups I like (p.s, Monsta X is the only group I love, other groups I like lol). SF9 I got into SF9 a few months after finding Monsta X and it was from their song Easy Love that I found them. Afterwards, I just kept watching more and more MVs and that’s how I became to be a Fantasy. SF9 stands for Sensational Feeling 9, and there are nine members with five of them making up the vocal line and the leftover 4 being the rappers. The leader is a rapper, Youngbin, and the vocal line is …. InseongTaeyangJaeyoonRo WoonDawonAnd aside from Youngbin, the three remaining rappers are the maknae, Chani, whose voice is scary deep for his age (he’s 17!!!), the main rapper Zu Ho (my bias!) and Hwi Young. I love SF9 mostly because of their music, although I do love them as individuals very much. They also really love us Fantasies and always make special MVs or extra clips for us. SF9’s music varies a lot, and their latest comeback O Sole Mio is unlike a lot of K-pop songs. I feel like SF9 makes really unique songs with different beats and basses, their just so eccentric and electric (some of their coolest songs are Fanfare, ROAR, and K.O—you should give them all a listen!!) They also have difficult choreo often with their songs, and their lives are consistently breathtaking and I love watching their old comeback stages from last year to their latest ones because you can see how much they’ve improved and how far their getting. Each of their personalities are just super kawaii too. I hope that they each achieve stardom together as SF9. They also just debuted last year in 2016 so I’m wishing that 2018 being their third year since debut brings many blessings their way. SF9 fighting!! #onceafantasy #alwaysafantasy  Top row L2R: (Zu Ho, Taeyang, Dawon, Hwi Young, Jaeyoon) Bottom row L2R: (Ro Woon, Youngbin, Chani, Inseong) And with those two groups out of the way and accounted for, there really aren’t any other Kpop boy groups that I stan as hard as I do with these two. However I do listen to other groups such as Got7, BTS, KNK, Super Junior, TVXQ, JYJ, BIGBANG, and SEVENTEEN. I only know Got7’s Fly, but it’s one of my favorite songs. Jackson’s swag is awesome, and I love Mark and JB’s voice. For BTS, my bias is Suga and my bias wrecker is V and I love the BTS songs Fire, Blood Sweat & Tears, and I Need U. I only just learned of Super Junior by stumbling upon their song “Sorry Sorry” from a concert Monsta X did. This is like a staple song in K-pop y’all, everybody and anybody who likes K-pop should be put onto this song. “Sorry Sorry” is one of the catchiest songs ever made!! KNK isn’t a too popular group but I love their songs “U” and “Rain”— their definitely worth giving a listen. The fandom name is super adorable too, we’re called Tinkerbells! TVXQ was originally a group of 5, but eventually the group split into a duo, which kept the name TVXQ and the three members that left formed a trio, JYJ. TVXQ is the biggest legend in K-pop. This is something I will always believe and no one can ever tell me otherwise. Mirotic, which is the true staple song of K-pop, is a single that broke records on records on records. TVXQ as a 5 was everything. The members before disbandment, Yunho, Changmin, Jaejoong, Junsu and Yoochun were formidable. Their stage presence couldn’t be denied and this is the one boy group in K-pop history that I feel like as individuals, the members were capable of everything that another was able to do. The high notes in their songs were breathtaking, the choreo was the most difficult I’ve ever seen esp taking in that the songs they were performing along with it weren’t made for low notes but mid to high ones, and despite all odds they made it. But enough about TVXQ as a 5, since that’s old news that still breaks my heart but even separated, both TVXQ as a duo and JYJ are doing well. I also still love their songs and Mirotic was actually the first ever K-pop song I ever heard. BIGBANG is just an awesome group. Their songs are so hype and G Dragon is like just one of the most beautiful people to me; he’s so effortlessly cool!! Daesung is also hilarious, I love his goofy personality. Seungri is another member too, and he’s one of the most friendly idols ever. Taeyang is the “sexy” one in the group and him and GD are supposed to be enlisted into the military soon although BIGBANG won’t disband but they will take a hiatus. BIGBANG fighting!! The last member, T.O.P is the oldest of the group and the maknae btw is Seungri. The only songs I’ve listened to by BIGBANG are Sober, Fantastic Baby and BANG BANG BANG. I love every one of them!! I’ve also watched their Weekly Idols on YouTube and seeing GD and Daesung dance to TWICE songs honestly made my entire month of December jolly. The last (but not least!!) group that I’ve yet to mention that I like & listen to is SEVENTEEN. SVT has 13 members, and I don’t even know half of their names. I only know S. Coups, Hoshi, Mingyu and The8. But before the year ends I hope to put a name to each of the faces unfamiliar. I love their latest song Clap, and Don’t Wanna Cry. Their both very different songs but I love them both and listen to them everyday. I hope to become a good Carat and help support them. Fun fact: Monsta X and SEVENTEEN both debuted in 2015 and both groups are very very close. Just watch the fancams where they watch each other’s performances! All the members of each group know almost all the words to one another’s comeback songs (Monsta X to SEVENTEEN’s Clap and SEVENTEEN to Monsta X’s Dramarama). Their also pretty much brother groups and they both support each other a lot and get along very well <33 Partly the reason of why I’m a Carat is because of how much MX seem to love and support SEVENTEEN. Ah! And before I go into the female K-pop groups that I like I also like the group NCT and their music. However I only know one song, and that’s Cherry Bomb from the sub unit NCT 127. But it’s a very cool song that has a lot of hot, handsome and very sexy and swag vibes to it. I hope to hear more of their music! Girl Groups Since I’m super tired of typing b/c of my overkill on male K-pop groups I like, I’ll just list my favorite K-pop girl groups from the ones I like and listen to the most to least. EXIDSISTARBLACKPINKAOATWICE4MINUTEPLAYBACKRED VELVET

I stan many groups but my favourite and first kpop band I got into would be BTS, they are a 7-member boy band under bighit entertainment. Their english name used to be bulletproof scouts but now it’s Beyond the Scene. They have 7 members, 4 vocalists and 3 rappers (however, sometimes they do exchange roles, because they are good at both) and they produce music.  This picture is from their repackage album, you never walk alone (they do have a new album coming soon). From left to right, Jin, J-hope, Jimin, Jungkook, Suga, V, Rap monster That is literally the most simplistic way I say it ^^ I will briefly introduce the members now. Jin a.k.a Kim Seokjin- He is the eldest member of BTS and he is well known for his flower boy looks and his very broad shoulders. He is a vocalist in BTS. J-Hope a.k.a Jung Hoseok- He used to be in a street dance group so he is very good at dancing, he is a rapper and he is very good at rapping very fast. Jimin a.k.a Park Jimin- He studied in Busan’s top dance school so he is very good at different styles of dancing, he is well known for his abs. He is a vocalist and his voice is VERY high :) Jungkook a.k.a Jeon Jungkook- He is the ‘Golden maknae’ (youngest member) because he is good at everything. He is a vocalist too and he is known for his muscular body (trust me, when you see you, you’ll understand) Suga a.k.a Min Yoongi- He is a rapper in BTS, he is known for his accurate pronunciation of words and he is also known as August D, which is his own rap songs. V a.k.a Kim Taehyung- He is a vocalist and is known for his deep soulful voice, and his 4D personality (he doesn’t like being called that tho), he’s just very funny and cute and clumsy, you can always tell it’s him. Rap Monster a.k.a Kim Namjoon- He is the leader of BTS, and a very good leader, he always makes the prep talk for them and organises them. He can speak very good english tho and he is a rapper, sometimes he raps in english too. Hope this helps!! :)

Depends on what you by band as band can be so easily mistaken for a group. I’ll just answer both ways. My favorite kpop group is BTOB. Back when I only cared for Korean dramas and variety shows, I despised kpop. It was something that caused a small rift in my family. When I heard that they were incredible singers, I felt really doubtful and decided to hate them for no real reason. I don’t know why, but something pulled me to watch to “Way Back Home” stage. It’s difficult to listen to BTOB sing and deny their talent, but I somehow did. Months passed and I saw Missing You on YouTube. I listened and fell in love. The song was so different from the other kpop songs I hear everywhere. It felt so much more meaningful and deep. Ever since, I’ve been obsessed with these loud, talented guys. My favorite band is The Rose. It was about a year after I started stanning BTOB. When you stan a group as talented as them, it’s hard to be impressed by anyone. So there I was, unsatisfied by anything that wasn’t BTOB. I heard that The Rose was extremely talented so I listened to “Sorry”. My god… they were insanely good. While my heart doesn’t go to them as it does to BTOB, they’re definitely one of my favorite artists. Their songs, like BTOB, didn’t feel factory-produced like most of kpop songs. It felt real. The emotions in the song was so heavy. It was exactly what I loved. So yeah, The Rose is now my favorite band.

Tough decision, but Day6. I got into them recently, before they did the ‘one video per month’ thing, but later than the album before this last one I explored their music more after that one ‘day in the life of Day6’ or that ‘dorm room video tour’ and I just kept clicking links to their songs…anyway I fell in love, stanned almost instantly. It is truely rare for me to like every single song a group puts out, but here we are, loving every song and bopping when I get the chance. What attracted me most was their ability to actually PLAY their own instruments and sing while they're at it (their vocals and harmonies are no joke). Haven't seen that since CNBLUE. Their English covers are top notch too, I suggest that if you haven't listened to their cover of “Stop and Stare” by One Republic (or any of the other ones) give it a listen. (Last reason I swear) I grew up on rock and rock subgenres, and pop music was another favorite, so those are key factors as to why I like them so much. Pop and rock mixed together?? Sign me the hell up. They also write a huge amount of their work, so bonus if you like groups that write their own stuff. (I'm sorry) This isn't the group themselves, but the fandom is chill (YouTube, as far as I know) and you don't see those “C’MON STREAM GET THIS TO THE MASSES WE NEED MORE VIEWS” comments either. They all just sit and bask in their glory.

BLACKPINK- I love all of the four members, especially their show BLACKPINK House. My favourite member among them is Jisoo, what a cutie. For me, the group is able to pull off their ‘girl-crush’ concept well with both (in my opinion) a strong vocal and rap-line. That and I feel the genuine friendship amongst all the girls, which, in all honesty, is refreshing to see.  TWICE- Twice is definitely one of my favourite groups as of right now. I have a soft spot for all of the 9 members. I can't choose a favourite can you blame me? Recently I went through a hard time with one of my friends passing away, and Twice’s bright music, personalities and smilies (as cheesy as it sounds) really helped me take my mind of it. I also love their side tracks. They're hidden gems, to be honest.  Seventeen- Seventeen is definitely one of my favourite boy groups. I guess my favourite would have to be Jeonghan. RIP long hair, You'll never be forgetton. Anyways, Seventeen’s cheography, vocals and rap are just amazing, why wouldn't I put them on this list? Again, like BLACKPINK and Twice, you can really feel that genuine connection with all of the members and can see that they're close with each other.  It seemed like you were only asking for one group but I had a hard time choosing. Sorry.

my fav kpop group is bts. now im not gonna talk about their visuals or their underdog story but rather, i would say because they are artists themselves. (other groups too) im an emotional person and i find to like songs that are relatable to me. as we all know, bts writes lyrics that are delve and taboo topics and i respect them for their courage to speak up about these things. this made me a fan of their music. onto the artist themselves, i like their personalities. i love how each of them have different habits, how they love each other, how they appreciate their fans, and how humble they are. i also like the fact that they involve themselves in creating their songs which makes it feel like i have more connection to the artists themselves. i also like rap a lot so that’s a given. i dont know if others also think of this but i believe that bts is one of the groups with the best rap lines. i like the fact that rm, suga, and j-hope has their own style and they are distinguishable even if you close your eyes. though the vocal line is not the best among all kpop groups, i still like them because their voices have different colors. jimin with his soft and high pitched voice, v with his low and deep voice, jungkook with his angelic voice, and jin with his sweet voice. (i recommend you to listen and watch the truth untold lyrics or just the audio itself and you can definitely differentiate and recognize their voices). all in all, i can say that they’re my fav group because they are great artists and people. lets spread love and remember whar they always say “love myself, love yourself”.

Ok, a lot people don’t realize that a kpop group and a kpop band are not the same thing. A kpop group has a lot hard dance choreography and a kpop band plays instruments and doesn’t dance. BTS, Twice, Ateez, Got7 are all kpop groups. Day6, Onewe, and The Rose are kpop bands. Ok, now that we’ve sorted that out: My favorite kpop band is Day6. I also love N.Flying, The Rose, and Onewe. Day6: My Bias is Jae and bias wrecker is Young K. I would say my favorite songs from them are Time of Our Life and Man in a Movie.  N. Flying : Bias is Hun and my bias wrecker is Jaehyun. Favorite songs are Rooftop and Flowerwork is a bop!  The Rose: My bias is Woosung and bias wrecker is Jaehyeong. Favorite songs are Like We Used To and She’s In The Rain.  Onewe: They are the band counter part to the group Oneus. Bias is Dongmyeong and bias wrecker is Kanghyun. Favorite songs are Regulus and Kousikondou. If you were wondering what my favorite Kpop groups are: AteezStray KidsBTSNCTGot7

My top 10 would be: 10. BTS They’re talented, hardworking and extremely kind to their fans. I personally really love the rap line of BTS, and also their visuals shocked me too. Also, most of BTS members can produce and compose music as well, and I don’t think a lot know this fact. Now, I’m not an ARMY, but I really enjoy their music and I love the fact that they love each other like family and always care for their fans. In fact, the reason why I started to like Kpop was because of BTS. Even though I don’t stan them, I always support their music and follow their shows frequently. 9. GFriend GFriend is also in my top due to the fact that they are extremely talented and funny. We all know that they’re incredible dancers, every. single. one. of. them. And they’re really stable when singing and dancing as well, even though their dances are really hard. They're considered one of the most talented girl groups in the Kpop industry. Also, even though faced criticism, they still stand strong and be positive, and they worked even harder to prove those antis are wrong. 8. Seventeen Like GFriend, they’re also awesome dancers. Most of their choreos are really hard to follow and need to have a lot of energy when dancing, so I seriously admire them so much. Like really, how can they dance like that while also being so stable singing it live?!?!?! Seventeen is extremely funny, really watch their reality shows :)) Not only that, Woozi in SVT can compose music - he actually composed most of SVT title tracks. Wow, talk about talents. 7. CLC They’re very underrated despite being so talented and coming from a popular industry. After working for years, they finally got their first win with their newest song - NO. CLC composed of talents - dancing, rapping, singing, visuals, charisma. They have it all. And they worked extremely hard to promote themselves, not only as a group but as individuals as well. They frequently posted dancing videos (did I mention that they’re all incredible dancers?) on Youtube and participated in shows, etc. CLC deserved more than just this. 6. EXO They have awesome music talents. I really love and admire the vocals of EXO as they can just do acapella out of sudden interests. Check out their videos on Youtube, you’ll be amazed. The members are all good dancers as well. Really, EXO is full of talents. And really, you can’t find a visual hole in their group, I don’t even know who’s the main visual in the group anymore :) But yeah, EXO is a combination of talents and visuals, definitely one of my favs. 5. Everglow I know that they’re still new, but really they’re one of the best rookies of this year. I love their debut song as well as their other songs in the album. And the fact that this group is full of visuals as well like Yiren, Sihyun, etc. They’re all very talented, like every single member of their group is good in every position. They can all dance, rap and sing stable and are very well-rounded. And not to mention that they’re very charismatic on the stage too. Definitely one of the very promising rookies. 4. Mamamoo Ah, the vocal queens! There’s no need to argue about - Mamamoo is extremely talented vocal girls. And rap too. They are all incredible singers and have a wide vocal range (check out their lives) and they can easily switch positions from rap to vocal, from vocal to rap. They’re also creative with their songs lines so that it will always be the original. They can just invent the words out on stage and it still fits with the music. (check out um oh ah yeah stages - they change their catchlines different times, different places) They’re also really funny, carefree and kind to each other and their fans. 3. G-idle I stan them since their debut. The fact that the whole group is so talented that it’s a crime :) They all can dance well, can sing lives stable and extremely, extremely charismatic. Really, see their up-close videos, it was just wow. The whole group is a pack - they’re literally dinosaur rookies. Their songs and accomplishments are something most rookies can only dream of. Even though the whole group is really young (their leader is really 22 years old) and they already reached so many achievements that they’re admirable. Their songs are super catchy and girl-crushed, it’s hard not to notice them. And did I mention their visuals? 2. IOI I love them straight out of Produce 101. They’re talented in every single field - from vocal, rap, dance to reality shows, charismatic, visual. They’re seriously one of the best and biggest girl groups back when they still have their contract. They are also funny and welcoming, heart warmed and kind to their fans. To me, IOI is a perfect group and they could have been so much more famous now. Even though they only have 9 months together, their 9 months are a legend. Winning a lot of prices even though under a very short time is very impressive. And to this day they’re still well-known even though under different groups and industries. All of their fans (including me) are still waiting for their reunion that we hope will someday come true. T.T Wanna OneI know, I have a habit of liking reality shows groups. :) It’s weird really. But like, to me, Wanna One is perfect really. They have incredible vocal lines, cool rap lines, amazing dance lines, and an all visual group. They can produce and compose music, can play musical instruments and have many crazy individual talents. They’re also extremely funny, opened, caring, kind, and hardworking. To me, Wanna One is very perfect and it’s my best decision to stan them. Even though also a temporary group, they had incredible records - 101 cups they have won and so much more prizes - and they are considered one of the best rookies. It’s a shame that they broke off too soon, but I’m glad that they got put together and created an extremely talented, whole-rounded group.

I’ve been listening to K-pop for 6~7 years. If you asked me this question every year I’ve been into K-pop, chances are I’d have a different answer each time. Therefore, I’ll give you my top 3 K-pop groups as of right now! The Boyz - LORD OKAY… I have stanned The Boyz since they wrapped up their debut’s promotional period! I instantly fell in love after listening to “I’m Your Boy” and have never looked back. The Boyz quickly became my ult group in a matter of weeks. They are such a versatile group, and that versatility extends past discography and into the group dynamics of The Boyz. It’s been an absolute honor being a The B and having the opportunity to see them live at KCON NY! They put on a great performance and have improved immensely over the years. All of these attributes (and my love for Kevin) lead me to make this decision: TBZ is my favorite band!KNK - Coincidentally, today’s KNK member Jihun’s birthday! I got exposed to these clowns when I came across their teaser for their comeback title song “U.” Those 30 seconds (probably less) changed it ALL for me. KNK consistently produce BOPS with amazing vocals and performances. I’ve also gotten the opportunity to see them live at KCON NY in 2018 and at their first solo tour in the States last year, on their 3rd anniversary. Needless to say, they never disappoint. Beyond their flawless discography, the KNK members are all literal COMEDIANS. Please take a couple minutes out of your day to watch a compilation of their antics, it’s a guaranteed fun time!EXO - I think it’s safe to say that EXO is that group. EXO are basically a household name for K-pop, and happen to be the first K-pop boy group I ever listened to! Years later, and I would still consider myself an EXO-L. EXO have an incredible catalog of music and are incredibly entertaining people. I always look back fondly on EXO as they are a group I have a lot of appreciation for, for leading me to the genre of music that has brought me to meet so many friends and to make countless memories.

I used to have lot of favourite groups until I have seen an episode of Running Man. Episode 52- 6 members of SNSD were the guests and a couple race happened. After that episode I have watched all the variety shows Girls’ Generation were a part of. (Star Golden Bell, Strong Heart, Family Outing, etc.). The girls are very funny and really good at variety shows.  Till then I only listened to Gee, I got a Boy tracks from SNSD. I was never wholly into Kpop (only Kdrama and Kshow fan) at that time. To see what the artist which is termed as ‘Korea’s National Singers’ can offer me, I have started listening their tracks from the debut song Into the New World. By the time I reached Run Devil Run I became SNSD addict. I have 80 tracks of SNSD in my iTunes playlist which have a total play count reaching 1000. The only thing I regret in my life is not witnessing the rise and growth of SNSD. I am a new Kpop fan (discovered this amazing world in 2016) and I wish I have a ‘Time Machine ‘ so that I can go to 2007 and Stan this perfect group from debut.  To explain why Girls Generation is a perfect Kpop group there is a video which I watched recently on youtube- ‘This is Kpop’  All the things explained in the video for Kpop as a whole can be explained just using SNSD. (exclude extreme concepts like creepy, stellar level sexy) Singers - Taeyeon, Jessica (EX-SNSD member), Seohyun, Tiffany, Sunny Dancers- Yuri, Hyoyeon, Sooyoung, Yoona Rappers- Hyoyeon, Soyoung SNSD have songs in multiple music genre and tried all the possible concepts. All their members have a successful solo careers. Taeyeon- Solo female artist with 2 studio albums, Part of TTS Yoona- Popular actress with dramas and films in Korea and China Yuri- Actress in couple of dramas and variety shows Sooyoung - Model and Actress (drama currently airing) Seohyun- Female Solo Artist with a Studio Album, Part of TTS, Actress (drama currently airing) Sunny - Radio Shows, Variety Shows, Also has plans for an album Hyoyeon - Participated in dance variety shows, Has 2 singles Tiffany - Studio Album, Was a main cast of popular variety show (Slam dunk) Jessica - Solo Artist, Actress (In China) SNSD (Shoujo Jidai) also has a very good popularity in Japan. I personally like Japanese albums more than Korean ones. They also received a lot of awards and set many benchmarks (Not calling them records because a record is broken every day in the current digital world). I think SNSD is the epitome of every Kpop group and all the groups should strive to reach it to become legends So Girls Generation is my favourite artist and I am pretty sure that I am a sone forever. Jigeum-eun Sonyeoshidae!! Ap-eulodo Sonyeoshidae!!! Yeong-woni Sonyeoshidae!!!!!

Okay then, even though I discovered K-Pop through BTS, I’ve got to say, I LOVE Seventeen. I mean have you seen these thirteen wonderful boys? (actually they were supposed to debut with 17, hence the name, but 4 left, including Samuel, who is now a solo artist under Brave Ent.) They have actually released quite a few songs this month, such as “Lilili Yabbay - Performance Unit (Hoshi, Dino, Jun, The8)”, “Trauma - Hip Hop Unit (S.Coups, Vernon, Wonwoo, Mingyu)”, “Pinwheel - Vocal Unit (Woozi, Jeonghan, Seungkwan, Joshua, DK)”, and “Change Up - Unit Leaders (Woozi, S.Coups, Hoshi)”, and they’re all such bops! They have such a good rhythm~ I am not ready for their new comeback omggg. Also, they have great personalities. Seungkwan being his loud, extra, and friendly self, Dino being Jeonghan’s baby (they are honestly such cutiess omg my fangirl heart giewwig). And Woozi, the short, adorable bean that doesn’t want to be cute (he’s pretty scary actually, lmao he used a guitar as a weapon once). Oh and don’t forget Joshua’s slight obsession with Resse’s Puffs (oh and since his name is Jisoo, many Carats have made this kinda old meme a while ago called ‘you need Jisoos’), and Vernon once looking like young Leonardo DiCaprio. This is what kinda lead me to stan Seventeen honestly hah, their amazing personalities and their interactions and cooperation with each other. And to think, they came from the bottom, to have to share one bottle of toothpaste with 13 people and rooming with each other, to all having rooms of their own… ;—; very similar to BTS’s story tbh… Anyways, I hope this was a good answer, and always remember… “Slip in to the diamond life~” P.S. No, the fandom name is not ‘carrot’ as Wonwoo once said with Hoshi… (well, most of the members pronounce it that way lmao).. The fandom name is actually Carat, like 24 carat gold. ARE YOU KIMBAP KIDDING ME (Seungkwan quote ;D)? I ALMOST FORGOT… Some of my favorite Seventeen related channels are LoliKitty and ftwseventeen. And I recommend watching Adore U (their debut song), Highlight (by performance team, you might hear a misheard lyric.. “I’m like a bird, not a turkey~”), Shining Diamond, Swimming Fool, My I (omgsofreakinglittjwie), Mansae (mansaemansaemansae :)))), Ah Yeah (though it may be old, it’s lit), and the English Time playlist on LoliKitty’s channel (you won’t regret it). Omg this answer is so freaking long, just tell me if you’d like me to introduce you to the members if you don’t know them yet <3 Much love~ edit: y’all carats go watch clap m/v, it was released earlier today and its so littt :))

I like many, but I love, respect, and admire EXID and Red Velvet. It isn’t solely based on looks and choreography, but how they climb up the ladder to get to where they are now. Red Velvet’s story isn’t as poignant as EXID, but I love RV’s personalities and chemistry, their songs are catchy and great, either in Ballad or Dance songs. These girls aren’t as explosive as other popular girl bands in terms of popularity, but they keep the quality high every time they perform, you might have heard about RV members shivering on stage but keeps on performing, that’s what I admire from them, their personal stories are fun to heard, too! EXID came back from the ashes. In 2012 when they debuted, songs aren’t hitting the chart, some member left and formed another group. These happened for 2 years, Hani said in an interview on Happy Together, she even went to China to study because EXID wasn’t popular, and she’s about to gave up. But she realized she shouldn’t let people dictate her dream, and because of Pharkil (fancammer), their title song Up & Down skyrocketed and topped charts even though promotion period ended. There was also a story where there was only 15 people came to EXID’s fan meeting, including their families. Seeing them rising makes me respect them right away. Not that I discredit popular groups, but to witness a group persistent is something great.

As of November 2016, I currently stan 4 groups: EXO, GOT7, EXID and KNK. Most of you guys probably know about the former three, so I’ll be introducing you to KNK. Here’s an excerpt from Wikipedia about them. KNK (Hangul: 크나큰; RR: Keunakeun, lit. "great" or "to be great") is a five-member South Korean boy band under YNB Entertainment, the company's first male idol group. KNK is an initialism which stands for K-pop kNocK. They held their debut showcase on February 29, 2016 and officially released their debut single album entitled Knock on March 3, 2016. KNK’s a relatively new group. The offical fanclub name is ‘Tinkerbell’, and according to allkpop, here’s the story behind it. "We were watching the movie 'Tinker Bell' and came to think that our fans are our tinker bells that protect us. So that's how the name was chosen." Yeah I know how cheesy that sounds. But I’ll also admit that I first got into them because of their heights - KNK’s average height is 1.85m. The tallest member (Seungjun) is 1.89m while the shortest (Heejun) is 1.78m. I repeat. THE SHORTEST.  Here’s them standing beside Heechul in Weekly Idol. The member in the first pic is Seungjun. In the second pic - the order from left to right is Jihun, Inseong, Seungjun, Heejun and Youjin. Why is this so important to me? Well, my height is 1.75m. So I’m taller than or around the same height as about 50% – 80% of the members in any given male k-pop group. Imagine my pain when they give out interviews like ‘My ideal type is shorter girls’. And yes, I know I’m being delusional but whatever, I’m content with just the thought that I fit into my bias’ ideal type. Except that it rarely happens. Why? Because I’m 1.75 and get disqualified as soon as height is mentioned (read: very quickly). *cries* Nevertheless, KNK soon grew on me and now they are one of my favourite groups along with GOT7. They recently cameback with a song called ‘U’ but decided to promote without an MV. (Their lable said that the MV had low-quality). So here’s their comeback stage at Inkigayo.  Apparently, the tinkerbell who subbed the video had same thoughts as me.   If you’re interested to know more about KNK, as a start, I highly recommend watcing their weekly idol episode. They’re all funny, charming, talented and dedicated hard-workers. All of their past singles are good too. KNK is a group that definitely deserves more recognition. TL;DR. WE HAVE TALL ASIAN MEN JOIN US.

“stan” is a word i use very cautiously, lol. to me, to stan a group means investing your time into that group and giving the effort to learn their names, their backgrounds, and their overall story as a group. what i mean by that isn’t remembering the exact date each of the members were born or even buying their merchandise, but instead, supporting them in your own way :). MY FAV GROUPS: Got7 members (l to r): Jinyoung, BamBam, Youngjae, JB, Mark, Jackson, Yugyeom  (2020 album: Dye) (title song: “Not By the Moon”) this group is so talented on so many levels. they’re music is tasteful, the group’s good looking, and most importantly, they, as in themselves, are good people. we don’t know these idols in person, of course, but Got7 is known as one of the most down to earth groups in K-Pop at the moment. it’s truly inspiring to see how humbly they present themselves, despite their fame. one person i’d really like to point out is BamBam, their Thai member.  he’s one of the three foreign members, and while i’m not in any way disregarding jackson’s or mark’s troubles, it seems that the media has a particular liking to pointing out BamBam’s ethnicity over everything else when he does something unfavorable. an example would be when he messes up the choreography, misses the beat, etc. (which is all normal stuff). haters do this to Lisa of Blackpink as well, and frankly, it’s disgusting. but despite that mess, Got7 is full of good people with amazing personalities. i could watch videos like this of them all day:  2. Monsta X  members (l to r): I.M, Joohoney, Minhyuk, Hyungwon, Kihyun  (2020 album: Fantasia X) (title song: “Fantasia”) i’m pretty sure this album will be my favorite album of 2020. it’s a little soon to say, but i’m in love with the display! the colors, the aesthetic, and the vibe is just jaw dropping. Joohoney’s part ^^ is a replay after replay all day, every day. it’s just so smooth, haha. but apart from their amazing talent and staggering vocal ability, the group’s personality is favorable as well! that seems to be a reoccurrence throughout this list, you’ll see. the thing with that, though, is that if i take the time to learn their names and learn about them as more than “Monsta X” and really dive deep into the fandom, i would need to enjoy watching them. you know what i’m saying? there’s no point in watching a group i don’t find entertaining. groups with big personalities like Super Junior, EXID, Exo, Got7, BIGBANG, f(x), etc. are enjoying to watch because i’m constantly laughing along! anyways Monsta X is at the top of the list because they deserve to be. and go ahead and listen to their new album! it’s really good! 💛 3. G-Idle  members (l to r): Shuhua, Minnie, Miyeon, Soyeon, Yuqi, Soojin  (2020 album: I Trust) (title song: “Oh My God”) finally, a girl group! honestly, i was never into girl groups as much i was into male groups because of a few things. the main reason was the song choices. the usual girl group song would be cute and sweet, and super high pitched. there’s nothing wrong with that! but it’s just not my go-to song style. anywho G-Idle is the first girl group i’ve ever stanned :). their voices are incredible as well as the vibe they each portray. they’re very fun to watch too, and i find them humorous lol. i’m mostly interested in their music though. the song above is amazing and i’ve been playing it on repeat since it came out a few months ago. the aesthetic they chose for this mv is almost mouthwatering. it’s definitely my favorite mv of all time! and the girls look totally gorgeous as well. i’d also like to point out Soyeon’s voice- omg. it’s just.. so cool. her rapping makes me wanna dance naked hahaha! no, i’m just kidding, lol. but seriously, i love each of their voices! — so! to recap, i like Got7 because of their personality, Monsta X because of their music, and G-Idle because of their aesthetic. lol. nahh, i love G-Idle’s music too lol! i’m a huge fan of these three 🤍

Favourite groups ever: SNSD and SHINee SNSD- True living queens. Probably the best discography among all girl groups. Iconic Songs. Breathtaking visuals. Stunning Vocals. Amazing Dancing. I absolutely love them. Any 3rd gen 4th gen k-pop stan who knows who they are awesome, and it you don’t, it’s not too late to check them out. They technically aren’t disbanded yet so they may comeback in the future. But they’re just awesome. Stan these queens. Check out The boys, Run devil Run, Gee and Into the New World if you haven’t already! SHINee- The “princes of k-pop”, Shinee are among the newer 2nd gen groups but have nonetheless made a mark on the industry. Absolutely amazing songs, amazing dancing, Jaw dropping vocals, amazing stage presence, SHINee is worth loving in all the good ways. Lucifer, Sherlock, and Ring Dong Dong will forever remain iconic songs that shaped k-pop history itself, and they are still active. RIP Jonghyun, we will forever miss our beloved Main Vocalist of Shinee who’s soulful voice and kind spirit will remain in our hearts forever. And that’s basically it.

SHINee is my favourite K-pop group I have been a massive fan of SHINee since I found them probably 6–7 years ago. I immediately fell in love with Minho when I saw him in the Korean drama To The Beautiful You and had to know more. So I googled him and found SHINee. I remember the first song from SHINee I heard was ‘Hello’ and that is still my favourite SHINee song to this day. Im not sure I can really pin point one thing that made me fall in love with them, but I did. I cant think of a song of theirs that I don’t like, and i’ve listened to their whole discography. The boys are a family and you can really see the love they have for each other. After Jonghyun passed i was terrified they may disband. and even though i would have supported them no matter what i would have been heart broken. Finding SHINee helped me in many ways. And even now when i am feeling down or upset their music, dramas, variety, and reality shows always bring me so much joy and happiness. I will always love them.

By far, VIXX. No doubt. Why? heres some reasons, concept kings. They almost never do similar concepts. They did 2017 Conception which was a 3 mv storyline about Greek Gods, kratos, hades, love potions, Zelos, Jelousy and desctruction. They have also been love slaves, traveled to ultimate peace in shangri la, been cyborgs, voodoo dolls and much more concepts in the last 6 years. much unique to many kpop groups. 2. Choreography. Their dances usally tell their stories in a powerful way. So strong and graceful. 3. Vocals.Anybody who doesnt think they can sing should check out live versions of Fantasy and Error. Watch them sing Shangri La on Dingo. Listen to Love Letter and all of their ballads. If you listen to all their songs it proves how well they can sing. Ken and Leo may be the main vocals but the others are no joke too. True vocal kings. 4. Ravi, the rapper. He spends most of his time and free time writing songs and lyrics for VIXX, and his own music that he has 1 album, and multiple mixtapes that he releases many times a year. His rapping is amazing. Most of them are songwriters and composers, But Ravi has by far done the most songs, Leo comes in at second. 5. They are silly and quite wierd, but they all have diffrent personalities. All are serious about work. N is the talkitive, kind of annoying leader who loves on everyone too much, praises himself too much, main dancer with the honey voice. Leo is the soft spoken one,eccept when hes singing, he can blow out your ears. He used to never talk but now hes very giggily and wierd, Loves hugging especally Ken. Ken is also the main vocal who sounds amazing while singing, but loves making strange noises, screaming and is the king of Aegyo. Acts like the maknae but everyone loves him. Ravi, Rapper, is silly and cute but looks tough, acts crazy when you dont expect him too, most seriousn when it comes to work. He loves Ken more then anything. Hongbin is the Visual with the brightest smile that will light up your whole world, deep singing voice, cringes at almost everything. Hyuk, the huge evil Maknae that loves throwing them to the ground, especally Leo. Powerhouse dancer. All loves their fans. This has been long but no words can explain how much I love these wonderful boys. They have made me happy many times.

i stan lots of boygroups and girlgroups, but the main group i support is…*drumroll* *＊✿❀NCT! ❀✿＊* now, a lot of people haven’t heard about them, or refuse to get into them because of the amount of members (as of 2019, there are 21 members ^_^). i was like that until i clicked on one of their music videos and got sucked in, hehe～but in all honesty, all of these boys are so unique and contribute individually to the group!  as for their music, i admit it’s a bit different, but not out-of-this-world different. for all those people who say that NCT’s music isn’t ‘your style’, please remember that the boys don’t get to produce (on rare occasions) and/or make their own music like your favs. they might write their lyrics sometimes, but most of the time the producers at SM (their agency) do all the work. i love and support these boys and stanning them has not been a waste of time. anyways, please check out these crackheads if you have time, i’m sure you’ll find a bias. or two. oooor three. you’re always welcome to the NCTy (n-city) where NCTzens (N-citizens) are unproblematic, as far as i’ve experienced ≧﹏≦ peace out!

Right now I can confidently say it’s Akdong Musician but I call them AKMU, consisting of brother-sister duo Lee Chanhyuk and Lee Suhyun.  They debuted 7 April 2014 with the song 200% (which is still my least favourite AKMU song, forgive me) after emerging the winners of Kpop Star. I have never watched it, but what I constantly hear is that they were excellent performers, so I might watch it out of curiosity. Over the years, they have never failed to improve more and more, and their sound always impresses me. Reasons why I love them: Their music doesn’t fit the typical standard in K-Pop, they rarely have any tropical house or hip-hop. There’s something about their sound that’s so organic and refreshing. We have Chanhyuk to thank largely, resident songwriter and composer for AKMU’s songs. The lyrics alternate between deep and thought-provoking to fun and light-hearted. And Suhyun’s vocals are above average, she has a pretty powerful voice.They may not have the ideal appearance for K-Pop stars but I love them for how cute and unique their facial features are. I’ve seen them receive flak for it, but I disagree that Suhyun and Chanhyuk are ugly. They are easily some of the most good-looking Koreans I have ever seen. What makes it even sweeter is how as brother-sister, you can clearly see their resemblance to each other.I can relate to them. As an older sister, I have younger siblings whom I love but at the same time am exasperated with. Hearing them talk about how they were when younger and recount past fights while laughing over it or when they interact with each other on variety shows reminds me of my own sibling relationships and how much they are like my family. It helps me establish a sense of closeness to them.Lastly, their music videos are the best I’ve ever seen. ‘Re-Bye’ has a theatre themed storyline with a twist at the end which always blows my mind because I couldn’t see it coming. ‘How People Move’ has a crisp, bright aesthetic and is my favourite music video. It includes Escher’s stairs as part of the set-up. ‘Melted’ is the story of a boy struggling to make it in the world and brings tears to my eyes. It’s all so good. There are many more but these are the highlights. I’d recommend any person who’s interested to hear their music, these tunes to begin with: How People MoveRe-ByePlay UglyMeltedDinosaurLast GoodbyeChocoladyTo end off, right here’s a lovely image of all of them.  Particularly, an image of Lee Chanhyuk. Suhyun is amazing but he deserves more love.

As a Korean, I’ve listened to K-Pop for a while. After carefully thinking it over, I’ve decided my favorite K-Pop band is not from South Korea, but from North Korea: the Moranbong Band!  WHAT?! Why? My favorite K-Pop is from the 90s. North Korea’s a couple years behind, and thus their music (for some reason) reminds me of the 90s.They play their own instruments! These days, many groups have their music done on computers — but not the Moranbong Band! While they do use electronic instruments, they know how to play them and the piano isn’t electronic at all.Their lyrics are… interesting… to say the least.The ladies in here are the best of the best (in North Korea) — there’s no competition between rival groups, etc. Also, they have the approval of Kim Jong-Un himself, who supposedly hand-picked them.A lot of their music videos are basically slideshows set to some music. Bling Bling SHINee. I know they are not the most popular group now, nobody would actually care much for this answer. I’ve shared my story on how I got into Kpop because of taemin’s dancing. He singlehandedlt changed my perception of kpop. There was not too much uneeded flash and glammour in his dance; each move is instead supported by years of hard work and limitless talent. His move so delicate yet powerful, he was really untouchable back in the days. Slowly, I into all of SHINee and branched out to look at other groups. I always returned back to SHINee because none could captivate me like the 5 members did. Almighty Key, Bling Bling Jonghyun, Dubu leader Onew, Flaming charisma Minho and Maknae Taemin. The 5 of them literally defined my first half of Kpop life. Then EXO happened. SHINee lost momentum and fans get to see them less and less. Still, their comebacks focused nothing but quality. Through thick and thin, SHINee members have stuck together. In 2013 alone, they had 5 combacks: breaking news, dreamgirl, why so serious, boys meet you and everybody. Taemin had additional commitments with henry’s solo. For each comeback , they had to record at least 5 songs and learn choreography for 2 songs. Not to mention back in their rookie days, they attended literally ALL musical events including all the small ones hosted in universities (check out their fancams, they had a lot). The point is that, they are super hardworking and talented. They should be appreciated more. I don’t know why they aren’t.

Oh yeah! Finally a question that asks for my favourite groups! In plural form! Thank you! ❤️ My recent favourite boy group is Seventeen. They have my favourite concept of all time: non women-degrading nor excessively possessive lyrics, fresh but intricate choreography, easy to listen melody, strong but not overly done raps. I also love that they don’t take a sexy concept yet, even when they started trying a much darker concept than their usual. It’s just everything they do is on the right dose, not too much but not too little. They also have active schedule throughout the year. And when they are resting and/or have no official on-air schedule, they would still give the fans some updates, sometimes going on a surprise live broadcasts or chat with fans on fancafe, VLive, or twitter. So I have no time to get bored and forget about them, and I think that’s a great marketing system. For a girl group, my all time favourite is Lovelyz. I started being a fan right after their debut with Candy Jelly Love, and cry whenever they release new albums because they always show improvements each time. I also love VIXX, mainly for their versatilability. I love that they can take ANY concept and execute them perfectly. Sensual? Cute? Boyish? Dark? Real dark? Traditional? They’ve done them all, and it feels like they own those concept. Infinite, well, I don’t know why I love them in the first place, but I love the mad synchronization in their choreography, especially when Hoya was still in the group. And their songs are nice, too! Girl’s Generation was my first favourite group, and my bias was Tiffany. If I were to mention other groups I also like and have their entire discography saved on my streaming account but not to the level that I play their songs everyday: Mamamoo, Cosmic Girls (WJSN), Gfriend, LOONA, Oh My Girl, and Girl’s Day.

I’m a devoted shawol (SHINee fan) and i first like SHINee mainly because their music is outstanding. They’re one of, if not the most, experimental group in terms of music in kpop. They don’t follow the trend, they make the trend. They’re not afraid of making new sounds that might be unfamiliar for the public at the time, and usually being the one that introduces new sounds that’ll be the trend all over kpop months after they started it. Their choreographies and dancing in general is also mindblowingly amazing. They make such high quality music with such marvelous artistry and aesthetic, also consistently powerful performances. They’re just basically A+ in music artistry, vocals, dances, just everything included for a perfect performance.    Besides the music and performances, SHINee members are all very amazing human-beings, not being exaggerated at all. I could write 100 pages full essay as to why SHINee members are amazing, but i’ll keep it short here. They’re all very nice, intelligent, genuine, human-beings and the amount of love that they give for shawol (SHINee World; SHINee fandom) is unbelievable. They’re very real people that also care about social situations and more often than not can be seen supporting constructive movements with their own voices which is so amazing. They’re also very hardworking people that’s always pushing for improvements and also genuinely love what they do, and love to perform with each other in front of their fans.  And also, what makes me love SHINee more and more is because of SHINee World itself. SHINee World as a fandom is to die for, honestly. Shawol have such beautiful fandom culture that’s very genuine, kind, driven by love, and just overall goodness. I do believe that a fandom’s personality definitely mirrors the group’s personality and i feel like because SHINee is so genuine, loving, and respectful towards each other and towards their fandom, shawol can’t help but mirror that and being even more genuine, loving, and also respectful towards them as well.  p.s: Buy MOVE by Taemin on iTunes and watch the MV on Youtube!

For Wendy i like her because of her amazing kind-hearted personality and amazing vocal. She seems to be very humble and far away from the word greedy and always know how to make the members smile + although she’s said to be the least out of the others in terms of dancing, i totally appreciate how she still dances with energy and tries. For Yeri, i LOVE love love her personality. I think she keeps it very real with the audience about herself, not forcing aegyo, not forcing her coolness/savageness, not being fake when caring about her members, just real! People judge her for all sorts of stuff but i can totally see how she (deep inside) cares and loves her older members very much. It shows a lot in her agressive yet clingy and playful behaviour. I currently have 5 main groups I listen to right now. These are in no particular order: Big Bang  Practically everyone knows them. They’ve been in the industry since 2006. Many consider them to be the kings of kpop, and rightfully so. I love how all of their voices are distinctly different. G-Dragon’s voice has a slightly higher pitch, but it is still nice to listen to. TOP has a mesmerizing deep voice that suits both rapping and singing. Taeyang’s voice is very smooth-sounding to me. He has a very good range and very good control. Seungri’s voice is very sweet sounding, with a good upper range and lower range. Daesung’s voice is deep and very powerful. As soon as I heard his voice, I needed to know who he is. Needless to say, this group is legendary. Recommended songs: Bang Bang Bang, Blue, Last Dance, Sober, If You Dreamcatcher  This group, contrary to Big Bang, is less known. Their primary genre is rock, which not many people in Korea listen to. Their newest album, The Tree of Language, they have songs exploring different genres. In my opinion, it’s their best album so far. I really hope they get their first win this year, they deserve it. Their vocals are some of the best I’ve heard. Siyeon’s voice sends me to a different plane of existence. Dami’s rapping is incredible, but she is also very good at singing (just listen to the bridge of Jazz Bar). Sua’s dancing is too good for words. I love them so much. Recommended songs: You and I, Chase Me, Jazz Bar, Sahara, Scream Day6  Out of most Kpop bands (N Flying, Onewe, etc.), Day6 is more well known. A few of their music videos have a story line that some people think needs to be put into the form of a K-drama. They also have different genres in their discography. Like Big Bang, their voices are also very distinct. Young K has an amazing range, and he can go from a deep, gentle tone to a strong falsetto. Jae’s voice is smooth, sweet sounding, and full of emotion. Sungjin’s voice is very raspy, and he also has a very good range like Young K. His voice sounds good if he is singing softly or belting. Wonpil’s voice has a higher tone, and is very stable. Like Jae, his voice is also full of emotion, especially in sadder songs. Finally, Dowoon’s voice is deep and smooth. He doesn’t sing much, as he’s the drummer, but look out for songs where he has a small part. Recommended songs: Like a Flowing Wind, Sweet Chaos, Shoot Me, I’ll Try, I Like You Exo  They went from being called SM’s biggest mistake back in 2012/13, to being one of the most recognized Kpop groups today. They went through 3 members leaving the group in 2014/15. Their discography is one of the best in Kpop, with a wide range of genres. Many people say that they have the best vocal line in all of Kpop. All of them can sing, but the main vocalists (Chen, Baekhyun, and D.O.) shine the most. Even when he isn’t being serious, Chen can hit extremely high notes (When he sang Tears on Knowing Bros). Baekhyun’s voice is incredibly soothing. Listen to UN Village, it’s an amazing song. D.O. can have either a powerful voice (Monster) or a softer voice (Sing For You). Overall, they are an amazing group with an amazing discography. Mamamoo  Amazing vocalists. Amazing performers. Absolutely hilarious. Mamamoo might be lesser known that Blackpink or Twice, but they still have a decently sized fanbase that is incredibly loyal. On stage, they have an air of charisma and confidence about them, and off stage, they are hilarious, genuine people. They don’t feel the need to put up a facade, and they let people see their real personalities. If you ask practically anyone that knows them, you will hear that their vocals are unlike practically everyone in the industry. Even the main rapper, Moonbyul, has an incredible voice. On a side note, Hwasa’s new solo is coming out on the 29th, so go listen to that when is comes out. Reccomeded songs: Decalcomanie, Universe, Starry Night, Wind Flower, 4x4ever  (Insert signature here)

I’m not real mainstream in terms of my music taste, so you might not recognize these groups. There are a lot of groups I listen to here and there, these are just my top picks. N.flying  N.flying is a band under FNC. Some of my favorite songs by them are “Hot Potato”, “The Real”, “Lonely”, and “Like a Flower”. Apart from having great music, this is probably the wildest group I’ve encountered. They’re funny and charming and, most notably, incredibly weird. Gotta love them, though. SF9  SF9 is also under FNC, although they’re more of an idol group than a band. Some of my favorites by them: “Easy Love”, “O Sole Mio”, “Mamma Mia”. These boys are also pretty wild, to be honest; just look at their Immigration video or their Cleopatra games. Aside from that, they’re really good live and they have really great covers. Day6  Day6 is of course under JYP. They’re a band, like N.flying, although their concepts are usually a lot softer. Favorites: “I Need Somebody”, “Colors”, “I Would”, “Shoot Me”. Oh, my babies. The members are so sweet and funny and are just really lovely, if occasionally weird. They have great covers in both English and Korean, too - 10/10 recommend. The Rose  The Rose is under J&Star and are a fairly new group - newest on this list, anyway, having debuted in August of 2017. They only have a couple of songs out so far, but my favorites at the moment are “Sorry”, “She’s in the Rain”, and “Baby”. These boys are really the softest, sweetest human beings on the planet. They’ve got so much talent and I’m super excited to see what they’ll come out with next. That’s my favorite K-pop groups in a nutshell. Other really good groups include Astro (especially their new releases, which I personally like a lot more than the older songs), Rad Museum, Monsta X, Seventeen, and others that have probably just slipped my mind.

I'm a 39 year old man who enjoys all music, as long as they're good. The way I understand K-pop is that it consists of boy or girl groups and there's another section that is more adult. The first has groups like BTS and Blackpink. I have some tracks on my iPod that qualify as K-pop like SNSD's Mr. Mr, Apink's Mr. Chu and EXO's Growl. My Korean music collection consists almost entirely of the 2nd section I mentioned earlier. If you can imagine a pie chart, this wedge would be 85–90%. Thanks to Apple Music, I have the full albums of Shinhwa, Davichi, Akdong Musician and Ailee. I've never checked but I probably have 200 tracks and music videos by those 4 artistes. To answer your question, my favorite Korean musician is Ailee. She has impressive vocal range and isn't difficult to look at, admittedly.

My favorite k-pop idol is HyunA. I love her work and how she’s always pushing boundaries, though I’m not saying she’s the only one who does this or that she’s the best at this, but I’ve always liked her music since I first heard change in 2010. Her solo debut was deemed too inappropriate but as we all know she came out with an even more provocative video, “Bubble Pop” in the next year, I love how she sticks with what she wants to do even if it’s frowned upon. I love her sound and her stage presence is so overpowering that it’s actually it’s actually fun watching her perform. Also, her music varies from different genres from going to a ballad, rnb, and pop, this is must evident in her song “Red” which she did a marvellous job in the transition of music styles. I also love how well-rounded she is. She can rap, sing, and dance so well. She may not be the best singer but her voice in her song “Serene” was so mesmerising, I definitely suggest giving that song a listen. I know she gets a lot of criticism because of her sexy image, but she stated herself that it empowers her and I think that’s a great message that you shouldn’t be ashamed of what makes you feel powerful. Anyways, those are the reasons on why I’m an A-ing(official fandom name).

You probably might get this answer a lot, but BTS is my favorite Kpop group. You might also get the same answer for why people like their music, but here’s just my perspective. There are legit A LOT of reasons why people like BTS. People like BTS for Their visualsTheir hard and intense choreographyTheir overall stage-presenceTheir song-writing skillsTheir messagesTheir infamous story linePersonally, I like BTS more for their messages. A lot of BTS songs have a very emotional meaning behind it. RM (leader) is a bookworm, and he reads a lot of literature, which is where he gets his ideas from. That’s why a lot of their music is beautiful. I’m not saying this in a ‘dramatic’ way; I really mean it. Their song ‘Blood Sweat and Tears’ was inspired by the Icarus story and a book called Demian. Below is the basic summary of the book:Herman Hesse's novel Demian tells of a young boy named Emil Sinclair and his childhood growing up during pre-World War I. Emil struggles to find his new self-knowledge in the immoral world and is caught between good and evil, which is represented as the light and dark realms. 2. Spring Day, a song about the loss of a friend, a song about leaving a place where there is fake happiness, a song about carrying on. It is a song inspired by a book called ‘The Ones Who Walk Away From Omelas’. Below is the summary of the book: Omelas is a utopian city where the people lead lives that are happy, in the best sense of the word. HOWEVER, the happiness and success the people in this ‘town’ is based on a child’s suffering. This child is locked away somewhere below the city, with no clothes and no sense of comfort. The more this child suffers like this, the longer the people’s prosperity lasts. Spring Day is also based on the movie ‘Snowpiercer’. Snowpiercer is a story set in 2031, where due to some failed test, all life on earth is gone, except for those aboard the train ‘Snowpiercer’. The Snowpiercer continues to travel around the world without an end. I can’t explain verything here, but I suggest you check the plot out to understand. But how is it connected to Spring Day? At the end of the Snowpiercer movie, something hit the train, making it fall on it’s side and stop. The people inside can finally come out. They are breaking free from that ‘dungeon’. One last thing about Spring Day, is that they show how important friendship is. In one scene, they show JK lighting a match alone in a room, but it blows out. He then lights ANOTHER match, and he is no longer alone in the room-his friends are sitting with him. The match doesn’t blow out. 3. Another song that is possibly inspired by literature, was the song ‘The Truth Untold’. That song is amazing. The Truth Untold is (possibly) based on La Citta di Smeraldo. It's the story of a man who lived in a castle and kept to himself because he thought himself to be ugly. One day a woman came near his castle and picked his flowers. He was angry at first but eventually became curious and waited for her. He found out that she was actually selling those flowers for a living. The man fell in love but didn't want to show himself because he was "too ugly" (you know that I can't show you me, give you me..) So he decided to plant a flower that didn't exist on the planet so she could sell it at an expensive price. Eventually he manage to fill his garden with them but the women stopped coming. He then learned that she had died. That part where they sing 'but I still want you' is about him regretting not telling her his feelings all because he didn't love himself first. Isn’t that just a beautiful way to bring literature into music? That’s why I like BTS. Personally, I like literature too, so that’s another reason why I connect to BTS. And as a person who struggles with self-love, their songs really speak to you. It’s not only melodically warm, it’s lyrically beautiful. Someone once said, ‘When you’re happy, you listen to the elody; when you’re sad, you connect with the lyrics’. In conclusion, BTS don’t write songs, they write beautiful stories

I'd really like to address @User-10757409031954706390 There's a difference between a trend group and a group with influence. BTS is trending right now, they're not necessarily the most popular group. You could ask someone if they knew BTS and they'd say “Yes I've heard of them”, but if you ask for a song name a lot of people wouldn't be able to give one, whereas most people in Korea know ‘Growl’ and ‘Call Me baby’. BTS can trend all they want but that doesn't mean they have influence over listeners like EXO & BIGBANG. Ps. BTS got a million sales off of 2 combined albums (Wings & Wings : YNWA) whereas EXO got 1 millions sales in 24 Days for ‘The War’ album & BIGBANG can get 2 million slaes off only 1 album. BTS isn't as popular as a lot of people seem to think. & EXO has beat BTS for multiple popularity awards (Just recently won a popularity awards @ the Soribada Music Awards) & not to mention EXO has 19 Daesangs & BB has 10 while BTS has 3 lol

I already have an answer that fits this, so I’ll just paste it in here since I’m way too lazy… Stray Kids. They’re such talented boys. My first Stray Kids song being Hellevator, I never really heard anything like it before. But off stage they were such precious little kids it was impossible to hate them (and here begins my journey, after I tripped into the hole called ‘YOU’RE STAYING FOREVER’) They improved so much since their survival show. Felix was nearly eliminated because of his korean, and Lee Know made many mistakes, and the ones who really stood out were 3RACHA. Now, none of them really lack any skills. The biggest reason why I became a fan is when I found out they write and produce their own music, including their predebut mixtape. It might seem normal, but to me it’s impressive that such young boys openly and honestly write about such good subjects (debut struggles, society problems, etc) while this type of music is slowly shrinking away. I heard they also work on their own choreographies. Have I mentioned that Changbin (SpearB), Bang Chan (CB97) and Han (J.One) wrote many amazing songs under the name 3RACHA on their own? Some are just hilarious (Wow, Hoodie Season) and some just made my jaw drop (Placebo, Broken Compass). Stray Kids’ are trying out new concepts (Awkward Silence and My Pace) and the members are finding out their best points and weaknesses, their albums keep getting better and better. I hope you all STAY~

Now these are two different things. Every kpop generation has big groups. From what I know Big Bang and SNSD were the biggest groups of their eras. They ruled over kpop for multiple years that even now they are deemed as legends. But in the present era they are more focused on the individual careers but they are considered two of the biggest groups. In the third generation, it is undoubtedly BTS and Exo with a difference of few years. From 2012–2015 Exo was the biggest boy group but by 2015 BTS started gaining momentum both in terms of exposure, critical acclaim as well as revenue. So right now both are the biggest in Kpop. After them Seventeen and Twice are looking like the next big groups because of their wide audience and interest from GP.

So here is the order BTS BLACKPINK EXO TWICE GOT7 RED VELVET BTS BTS is undoubtedly the most popular Kpop band in the world, that has been dominating the pop industry since 2013. The band has no big label but sheer talent with all its seven members exceling in either singing, dancing or rapping. With cute, boy next door charms and colourful videos, each song has deep meanings and has been self written by its own members.      BLACKPINK Blackpink is probably the best and the most popular Girl group ever after Wonder Girls, 2NE1 and Girl’s generation. Based on the concept of girl power, it is very unlikely of any other Korean girl Group. With the big label of YG, this 4 membered group has the best dancer, singer, rapper and visual. I like most K-pop bands in general, but I have a surging amount of spazzing for a particular one because they're just so good. A recently debuted 4-member band called The Rose is, well, the apple of my eye? I fell in love with their debut song Sorry and the two main vocals' voices were absolutely a wonder, especially Woosung's. I first saw them because of the MV, and here I have to mention the cinematography and their acting was as good as their song. (Jaehyung's solo frames had me gaping at his similarities to Luhan—except for the jawline) They already had gigs and events and they covered many English/American and Korean songs months (or ~2 years?) before this, and now I'm catching up with their busker events through fancams in Youtube. Fortunately there's an Instagram account for their international fanbase (unofficial, but the band gained international fans more due to this fan account).

NCT/Red VelvetStray Kids/BLACKPINKSEVENTEEN/CLCI absolutely adore every single one of them, and this list becoming what it is was a process. The rise of NCT and SKZ was noticed by my friends before I realized how much of my attention they truly held. I absolutely adore the variety of sounds they present with their songs, and the members are just fantastic! SEVENTEEN has always been one of my favorite groups but with the release of You Make My Day last year they solidified their spot in my top 3. For the ladies, Red Velvet was the first girl group I really fell in love with. Their duality was a big selling point, they can truly pull off any concept. I don't care what anyone says, BLACKPINK has BOPS! I love their music and through BLACKPINK Diaries I came to love them too~ CLC first snatched me during Hobgoblin era, and with “Where Are You?” they held on. I think they are so talented, and I was incredibly proud when they got their first win this year! There are actually a few groups who could be considered above these 6, but they aren't listed because I view them as unrankable. BIGBANG, SHINEE, EXO, SUJU, AND 2NE1 are those groups. All amazing, all legendary! They hold an extremely special place in my heart~

Well, if you are new to K-pop like me, then best is to follow Big Bang! Now that I have listened to some other boy band groups like EXO, 2PM, Super Junior, BTS, Shinee, BTOB, JYJ, S501 etc, I consider Big Bang are true kings of K-pop. Big Bang is now a veteran boy band group that has been in the music industry for over a decade. Debuted in 2006.  Just in case you don’t know; as per the above photo Big Bang memebers (from left to right) Taeyang, Seungri, G-Dragon (leader), T.O.P and Daesung. I honestly like all their songs. Even though they have released only few albums during the ten years as a group, each of the members have a promising solo career as well. Currently the group activities are on hiatus as the members are enlisting in the army. However, their solo performances are second to none. I totally recommend Big Bang!

My all time favorite is Big Bang. They had their ten year anniversary this year, and they are on hiatus at the moment (military inscription starting up + other problems) but their songs are just great to listen to. They’ve done a ton of different styles, and because of how old they are of a group, they’ve kind of done a lot of the music eras present in these past 10 years. There’ll honestly be at least one song every kpop fan could like. Their more popular songs (if your interested) are: “fantastic baby”, “blue”, “last dance”, “haru haru”. Other than these, I personally love their songs “love song” “Tell me goodbye” “Oh my friend” and “beautiful hangover” (TOP’s part in beautiful hangover is awesome) They’re a bit old but definitely worth looking into, especially their old songs. I also recommend 2ne1 (disbanded), 2pm, TVXQ, FTIsland and Jay Park (he’s not a group but he can sing and rap really well. Careful with some songs though- their mv’s might be 18+)

I'm wondering why someone requested this while I have said “everywhere” that I'm a hardcore SNSD fan. I remember there are some group that I like at first but in the end I only love them. And for the question ‘Why?’ I actually can give you 5 sheets of A4 paper and that's still not enough to write all of the reasons. But here I go with the main reasons: I love their bond (or chemistry). Their friendship is really too big for this world. 9 different personalities trying to fit to each other. Even though it's 8 officially :’ I sometimes love to watch dorky member play along well with quite member. I love how 180° different personality can go together well.Their hardwork are amazing. I often feel me myself isn't really a hardworking person so I really respect those who admirably hardworking. And for me the level of SNSD’s hardwork and devotion are amazing. Being an Idol itself, for me, can be categorized as hardworking and perfectionist. And I think they're higher than average. When I watched Produce 48 and Produce x 101 it seems like being trainees for 5 years is incredibly long. But I remember many SNSD members have trained for 5 - 7 years. I know right? The bloody 7 years! It's Jessica and Yoona. If I were them maybe I have cried and tell my mom that I can't do it longer. I would simply (and easily) say that being an Idol is not my destiny lol.Their music is amazing. Their music are incredibly diverse. From Taeyeon herself, I can listen to many genres only from her solo albums. I always listen to their songs since years ago and won't be bored. If I'm in bad mood they provide great ballads. Or if I simply want to listen some songs while reading a book I can hear many type of songs ranging from cute, emotional to super badass. When I'm busy and can't follow them up, their songs always nurture my love for them and remind me of how amazing they are. There is a quote, I forget whether it's from fans or from them. Basically it said, “ If you don't love SNSD, Then raise your standard!” ;)

For me, TVXQ. Say what you want but New Generation K-Pop will never be as good as the old generation, sorry to all the new gen fans, but no. Auto tune & western influence in K-Pop got super popular somehow. I think this happened when SM debuted F(X) & YG debuted 2NE1. Live stages started getting less genuine, if a group is singing live you can hardly hear them because the background music is so loud. Miss the days where idols were actually singing during performances, and not lip-syncing. Don't get me wrong, there are a lot of talented idols, but most groups rely heavily on visuals and give lines to their artists according to popularity, there's maybe 1 or 2 average vocalists per group, the rest are usually visuals. Anyways I do prefer most veteran groups over new gens, I know people will hate me for this but hey, it's the truth.

Thanks for the A2A Rebecca Rodriquez. I’m assuming you mean favorite? For official Kpop groups, I’d have to go with the now-defunct 2NE1. YG broke the mold after creating this group in my opinion. Smaller for a girl-group (only 4), they had a fairly unique sound and style all their own. Greatly helped by the lead CL. Overall they came off ‘edgier’ and with a lot more panache than most other ones. Each of the four also had fairly distinctive voices (though sometimes Minzy could sound a bit more like CL or Bom at times), so it was easy to follow who was singing what. Now, if you’re looking at current k-pop (as 2NE1 is now gone), that’s trickier. Technically I might have to go with Girls’ Generation, as they’re still coherent. Most of my favorites have disbanded. As I’ve listed elsewhere, a current K-music group that is a true favorite is MFBTY. Not technically Kpop in that they aren’t run by one of the big-3 k-music corps, and lean more heavily towards rap than ‘pop’. If you’re not familiar with MFBTY, do look them up. Tiger J.K. (Aka Drunken Tiger), Yoon Mi Rae (aka Tasha, T, Baby T, Queen T, Gemini), and Bizzy. Tiger and Yoon are married and have a kid and are generally respected as the king and queen, or perhaps godfather and godmother of Korean Rap (unless that’s changed recently). Both are phenomenal performers together and individually, fluent in Korean, English (and I think potentially Japanese).
