This is asking for opinions, don’t get butthurt, please. I don’t care if you don’t like the groups that I like and that you think your oppars are the best. This is asking for what we, as individuals, think. Thank you.  ——————(  Anyway, I’d say Loona. A twelve membered Girl Group from the company BBC (Block-berry Creative).  (Logo is the one above) ——————( They have an amazing discography, over 3:15 hours of music and they only officially debuted in 2018. Not only this but each song is so unique to the other, listen to Let me in by Haseul and then Egoist by Olivia Hye. Or listen to Hi High and then Butterfly. —————— Their concept is beautiful, there are other groups who tell stories via music (BTS, etc) but I have never seen a group do it like Loona. It’s all so organized and elegant, they take lessons from the real world and from the Loonaverse and it’s mindblowing how it all flows so nicely. It lets you learn about new things and see the world differently, I’d never think that a song and video such as Vivid by Heejin would be so connected to a song and video released a year or so later One&Only by Gowon. ——————( The way the girls were introduced was creative as hell, they were ahead of their time back in 2016 with Vivid. I loved the fact that Orbits had something to look forward to each month, the thrill of finally getting a new piece of Loona will always be dear to me.  ——————( The subunits are amazing. OEC, 1/3 and YYXY are so diverse in sound, looks, and message yet when you look deep they all intertwine so well. It’s all so well done, OEC with their pop-ish and modern like sound, 1/3 was a nice homage to early girl groups and YYXY was dramatic, elegant, and cute. Each unit, each girl fit so well and when you see Loona all together it gives me chills to remember Mix&Match, Max&Match, Love&Live, Love&Evil, Beauty&TheBeat and then you see ++ and xx it’s !!! They all compliment and show how diverse Loona, as a whole, is. ) YYXY | Yves, Chuu, Gowon & Olivia Hye  ) OEC | Kim Lip, Jinsoul & Cheorry  ) 1/3 | Heejin, Hyunjin, Haseul, Yeojin (She doesn’t promote) & Vivi  ——————( The message they send. Female empowerment, self-love, and so much more. They’re also aware that they have a big LQBT+ following and avidly speak out about them. They’re aware of trends we Orbits have and listen to us, and BBC does so too. Don’t get me started on BBC, they’re such a good company who listen to Loona and Orbits alike. They also recognize Orbits and their work, our complaints, everything we say feels like it reaches BBC and Loona. ——————( Overall, Loona is ahead of their time with their message and music, it’s sad to see how non-Orbits treat and see these girls. All 12 of them deserve the world and work their sanity off.  In conclusion; STAN TALENT, STAN LOONA.

These are my four favorite k-pop groups ranked by preference: TWICESNSD (Girl’s Generation)BLACKPINKMOMOLAND(Sorry for being such a girl group bias) Of course, my favorite songs are all from the groups above. As you can tell from my credential and from the list above, I’m especially a big fan of TWICE, but surprisingly (spoiler alert), my overall favorite k-pop song isn’t from TWICE. Anyway, here are my top 10 favorite k-pop songs: 10) What is Love?- TWICE  It was so hard to choose the top 10, and this was the lucky one out of many to barely make it into the list. It has an overall catchy beat that stands apart from other TWICE songs, and I especially love Dahyun and Chaeyoung’s rap segment in this one. As a bonus, shoutout to Mr. JYP who produced this song! 9) Oh!- SNSD  SNSD songs are known for being extremely catchy, and this one is no different. The chorus of “Oh, oh, oh, oh!” is the main highlight of the song that always gets stuck in my head whenever I listen to it. 8) BBoom BBoom- MOMOLAND  As the song that got me into K-pop in the first place, I can’t describe how catchy and upbeat it is. My friend once said, it’s “the song you can play at a party when everyone gets tired but the party must still go on and then they’re all pumped up again.” One of my favorite parts is the on-fire Daisy and JooE rap segment. After the massive success of “Bboom Bboom,” I can’t wait to see what MOMOLAND brings to the table next. 7) BOOMBAYAH- BLACKPINK  I wouldn’t exactly call this “catchy,” but it’s very powerful and upbeat. The chorus isn’t that great, but the buildup is amazing. Plus, Lisa’s rap segment is one of the best in all of K-pop. Badass level: 130% 6) Heart Shaker- TWICE  Again, not really “catchy,” but super upbeat. The entire song just blasts out energy everywhere. Enough said. 5) Genie- SNSD  First of all, I would like to point out that the song gives me Michael Jackson vibes, my favorite non k-pop artist. How do I describe the song itself? It isn’t really catchy nor upbeat compared to the other songs on this list, but it’s very refreshing. Undoubtedly the best part of this song is the final chorus at the end with Taeyeon’s magnificent supporting vocals. 4) I GOT A BOY- SNSD  This song probably stands out the most from the other ones on the list. There are so many different parts to this song, which makes for a perfect combination of catchy, upbeat, and powerful- with amazing transitions in between. Some notable highlights include Tiffany’s badass intro, Yoona+Hyoyeon’s call-and-response rap segment, and Tiffany+Taeyeon’s formidable solo part near the end. Badass level: 200% (Sorry BLACKPINK!) 3) Gee- SNSD  Yes, it’s another one from the queens of k-pop. I don’t think this song needs much explanation, but we can all agree it’s a must-know classic. The reason why it’s the legendary success it is today is because of just how catchy it is. In my honest opinion, it could be considered one of the catchiest songs of all time. The verse of “Gee gee gee gee,” much like “Oh!,” gets stuck in my head every time. I listen to this song multiple times a day and I never get bored of it. 2) Like OOH-AHH- TWICE  Considering the fact that it’s their debut song, this is pretty impressive, eh? It showed the world what TWICE could bring to the table, and it was spectacular. From start to finish, it leaves you with no choice but to keep your earphones on. Mostly because it was their first song, it seemed like each member (except for Jeongyeon) got an equal opportunity to add her own unique voice to the song. Also, the chorus brings on so much energy I just want to dance to it all day long. (Unintentional rhyming right there) 1) AS IF IT’S YOUR LAST- BLACKPINK  BLACKPINK in your area… Even though TWICE came close, my ultimate favorite song goes to BLACKPINK. This is the perfect summer jam. Firstly, each member got a lot of time to shine and provide their respective styles of singing. I absolutely love every single second of it from Jennie’s refreshing intro, Rosé and Jisoo’s charismatic solo buildups, and Lisa’s all-English, on-fire rap segment. But of course, we can’t talk about this song without mentioning the outstanding chorus, which is the most prominent reason I love this song. It’s too upbeat for it’s own good (in a good way). Just blast this in the summer and all the heat will fly away! After this summer hit, I can’t wait for their new comeback in two days…

I like a lot of groups, but right now, even if they’re not my favorite, I have to mention SHINee and INFINITE. I have immense respect for both groups. SHINee is a veteran group. They’ve been around for almost 10 years (2008 debut) and still have all the members and work hard for SM. They’re still really popular, although Shawols aren’t that caught up in raising their YouTube views, but they always sell well, get rewards and bring new sounds into the Kpop industry. All members get lines and work hard to improve. I’d like to point to SHINee’s Taemin; who’s really popular solo as well, who used to just be the maknae, sub vocal, dance machine, but now has released solo albums. SHINee is a group I honestly think that you cannot objectively dislike. Even if you might not be a big fan, you have to respect them. They’re different form all other idol groups. Then you have INFINiTE, who are extremely underrated. They have very strong vocals, dances and visuals. They’re one of the top dancing groups, with dancing machines like Lee Ho-won of Hoya, which killed during Hit the Stage. They have a classic sound, so you can always recognize them. Just like SHINee they’re one of the veteran groups. The band debuted in 2010 and is still going strong, with songs like The Eye. However, they’re usually not nominated for MAMA’s best choreography award, which is simply weird. I’m pretty sure they nominated BIG BANG once. I mean, BIG BANG, I love them, but that’s not right. Both groups are variety kings and have respectful fans. Jonghyun of SHINee even stepped down into the audience to let the fans touch him. The fans all stepped back, afraid that someone would hurt him, sassing fans, however, he said he wasn’t afraid because he trusted his fans, and there are beautiful pictures of this. I’ve always respected INFINITE, but I recently became an Inspirit, while I’ve been a Shawol since I discovered the group in 2012. I am proud to call myself their fan.

My ult group is Momoland!! So they actually weren't the first group I got into Red Velvet was (still love them) but they were the 5th group I got into. When I first got into kpop I didn't have any music service apps like Spotify or Pandora so I would just use youtube. I just made a huge playlist of kpop mvs amd videos of all the songs I like and a lot kf MVs would pop up on my youtube recommended page so I would watch a lot of them. One day Baam popped up on my reccomend page so I listened to it and I really liked it!! But even then I didn't really get into them. But one day a Momoland video from FBE popped up on my youtube where they did a try not to sing or dance challenge and I instantly fell in love. I automatically knew JooE would be my bias and I just loved them so much. I thought it would take a long time for me to learn there names since there's 9 of them but it barely took any time. At the point I stanned 4 other groups Red Velvet, Blackpink, Twice, and Gidle. (Still stan them all) I had stanned Momoland for about a week and realized they are my ults!

NU’ESTI think it’s a super clever name. It literally stands for “New Establish Style Tempo”. I think it’s a very unique name. NCT 127Their name is super awesome, the last 3 numbers are the coordinates of Seoul. How cool is that? SHINee“One who receives the light.” I’ll just leave that there. 2NE1The pronunciation itself is really interesting. Reps of the 21st century, I love that. IZ*ONENow I don’t know if this is the actual meaning but: 12 members who become 1. I think that’s a fantastic name. f(x)Now, my nerdy self loves this name but it actually means ‘Flower Girls’. F standing for ‘flower’ and x representing the female chromosome. Very clever. SF9‘Sensation Feeling’ because they want to WOW everybody with their talent. Confidence, I like it. These are just some of many unique names, they all have a meaning behind it and I love that. <3

My personal ultimate favorite groups are KARD, NCT and EXID, but objectively speaking I'm gonna say the best kpop group is… SEVENTEEN. Their music style is consistent and they always come out with good and unique songs that set the trends instead of following them. Sub-unit songs have their own flavour to them and are all well made. Their dancing skills are unprecedented in the industry — they are very synchronised and not only are their main dancers talented but their vocalists and rappers are also very skilled at dancing. Those same vocalists all have unique vocals and the rap line is very well balanced when it comes to different rap styles. They have the visuals and are fun to watch on variety shows. They seem naturally close and fun to be around. They all have a strong stage presence and are well rounded as individual idols. Their album sales are among the highest in the industry. They always get many wins on music shows or award shows at the end of the year. They're creative, humble and hard-working. Even though they're not one of my so-called “ult" groups I realize that SVT is a group that is outstanding in every aspect that we say define a good kpop group. They're well rounded and that's what sets them apart from other groups who all have their weak spots (which is completely normal!). In conclusion, stan SVT!

My favorite K-pop male groups are BTS (Bangtan Sonyeondan, or Bangtan Boys/Beyond The Scene), TXT (Tomorrow by Together) and Stray Kids. I’ve been a BTS army since 2017 and is really happy to see all their hard work from the past 6 years really pay off these recent years. I’ve been to their concert once and just loves many, many BTS songs. Their latest EP released in April contains amazing 7 songs. I became a TXT fan before their debut as they are also under Big Hit. After TXT released their debut album, I really fell in love with all 5 songs as they are so fresh and unique. I became a stay quite recently after really liking their hits Hellevator and District 9. This question is so ambiguous and open that it’s actually really hard to answer. Honestly? Only you can really say who the best band/group is. Everyone has a different opinion on what the criteria are for a K-pop group/band to be ‘the best in the world’, as you put it. For me personally, I think that EXO or NCT are the best, only because they’re the two who I follow the most. However, if you asked this question to another K-pop fan, you would get a completely different answer. Everything to do with this question is honestly based on your own personal preference and beliefs.

As a multistan, this question has me S T R E S S E D. Although, I can list out a couple bands that I like, then explain one underrated band that I am really into. Girl Groups: TWICE, BLACKPINK, Red Velvet, LOONA, (G)I-DLE, Girls Generation, PRISTIN, EXID, WJSN/ Cosmic Girls, Apink, (and more that I forgot #sad) Boy Groups: NCT (yep, all 21 members), BTS, GOT7, Stray Kids, (and more that I forgot #sad) One group in particular has to be the most underrated but unique K-pop band I have listened to. You may have heard the statement “STAN LOONA” before, but do you know why those “annoying” Orbits repeatedly say this? It is because the band is so unique with their “never-before-done” concept and their distinctive sound but is underrated in South Korea. They work hard, they love their fans, they have expressed women’s rights in their recent song, expressed LGBT topics in their songs, and have very sharp choreography, too!

I don’t listen to a lot of k-pop groups at the moment. I’m a k-drama fan that is slowly getting more involved in k-pop. However, I have always loved EXO and follow them closely despite them being an older group now. I was always impressed by how well they came together when they lost Kris, Luhan, and Tao. Plus, EXO was able to make me appreciate other music genres that I never liked before. I think they’re a good group of guys and I have more of a personal connection to them and their music more so than other artists. For some reason, to this day, my heart never really loved a group other than Girls’ Generation. I know they’ve gotten a lot of hate before, even got boycotted on the 2008 Dream Concert, but they became known as the Nation’s Girl Group and probably can still be considered as is. What was remarkable about them throughout the years was their bond and diversity. You’ve got a lot of dramas going on within the group that was pretty evident also. But working with a bunch of people, there’s always drama that’s bound to happen. It’s just something we wouldn’t know as a person from the outside. The only thing that did break it for them was when OT9 became OT8. Some people have moved on from what happened and just learned to accept what was given to them but there are those, which one of them includes myself, that haven’t moved on from it and are still very curious about what actually happened. Nevertheless, I’m happy to see each member relaxing more now and venturing out of Girls’ Generation as individuals. You still see the bond they have every now and then, especially with the recent collaboration they have together for DJ Hyo’s Dessert.

That’s easy. EXO. I tried to get into other kpop groups out there but they just aren’t the same as EXO to me. I don’t think so but I do feel like I should like more songs to become a proper fan of a group.

I really like BTS (방탄소년단).  BTS came together in 2013 and took their name from the Korean expression Bangtan Sonyeondan, which translates to Bulletproof Boy Scouts and symbolizes youth who don't settle for their current reality and instead open the door and go forward to achieve growth. They focus on more serious topics like mental health, which makes them very unique. In September 2018, BTS became the first K-pop group to speak in front of the United Nations. "Tell me your story. I want to hear your voice, and I want to hear your conviction,no matter who you are, where you're from, your skin color, gender identity: speak yourself." The band members are: KIM NAM JOON 김남준 KIM SEOK JIN 김석진 MIN YOON GI 민윤기 JUNG HO SEOK 정호석 PARK JI MIN 박지민 KIM TAEHYUNG 김태형 JEON JEONG-GUK 전정국

I would recommend dipping your toes in at first and reviewing some of the popular groups first. This might prepare you for the incoming storm of emotions. BTS, Blackpink and Twice would probably be the representative groups of this generation of K-pop. They’re well known, even outside of K-pop. With international and domestic popularity, they thrive with some signature concepts, but also have unexpected releases. BTS’s most friendly eras would be their newer songs from 2017–2020. Songs as Spring Day, DNA, Fake Love and Boy with Luv are generally songs that appeal to the majority of music listeners. Most of Blackpink’s discography are “hit song” material. You can find old school concepts, like Boombayah or Whistle if you like hip hop. Their newer releases are very catchy and lie under the genre of Pop Music. Ddu Ddu Ddu Ddu and Kill This Love are very popular and recent releases. Twice is more known for their cute and girly concept, but recently experimented with an elegant and mature concept. TT, Cheer Up and Ooh Ah seem to be the type of songs Twice gained the majority of their fanbase through. Recently, they released Fancy and Feel Special. A deeper dive into K-pop would take you through Red Velvet, Seventeen, NCT, EXO and many others! I hope my answer is helpful. Enjoy browsing through these groups and let’s all be sensible on the internet!

Though I love and appreciate a lot of groups, my favorite group is TVXQ.  They are easily among the most successful K-POP acts of all time. Their vocals, charisma and stage presence are incredible. Namjoon and Jin or Yoongi and Jimin from BTS. The first two are basically ‘Appa and Eomma' of the group. They are super cute together, as Jin is very careful of everything and Namjoon is a bit of a clutz. Its on to be one though ;). My other favorite is Yoonmin because Yoongi is very… into himself. They are very very cute together but BTS is better with ALL of them together.

This is easy! The best kpop group is Got7, BTS, or Black Pink! I say this because Got7’s choreography is better put together than most and the scene transitions are extraordinairily smooth, while Black Pink and BTS are also extremely well put together Got7 has the best choreography lining up with the beats of the music. Black Pink is very unique puts a good amount of surprise and color and the group members always give off an “aura” of confidence (most female kpop groups do), more so than the boy kpop groups of Got7 and BTS. BTS is extraordinarily good at making lyrics of their songs, and don’t forget the settings! BTS certainly goes more extreme with their sets than Black Pink or Got7 and has more spunk, thought, and time into making the lyrics of their songs and sets. But, in the end this is really all your choice and this is just my opinion, so whatever kpop group tickles your fancy I guess! ;p!

At first, when I was a K-Pop newbie freshly introduced, I listened to Blackpink(because why would I need any other group?). Mostly the title tracks, but when I looked at their B-sides, turns out that there aren’t that many B-sides either. Then I discovered Twice through ‘What is Love’, and let’s just say that I wasn’t very impressed with their former cute concept. ‘Fancy’ was an addicting song, and ‘Feel Special’ had a very meaningful message. My interest dropped after that though. Now, Red Velvet is my one true love—I love all of their title tracks, their B-sides, and I have downloaded so many of their albums you can’t even count (I’m in China, so a QQ music VIP really helps cuz you can listen to their songs without purchasing). Mamamoo follows at a close second. I’m still building up my EXO playlist, but I can confirm that it’s going to be as huge a collection as Red Velvet. I mean, when close to 80 songs in your inventory are from RV it isn’t exactly speedy to build another collection, you know? Have a Yeri because I love this queen so much:  And sometimes you just need short haired Yeri to save your day. ~S.

I was just about to say that the word, ‘stan’, does not exist, except as a foreshortened version of a person named Stanley. I say I was just about to do that when I found this: The casual use of “stan” famously comes from Eminem and Dido’s hit 2000 song of the same name, in which the rapper weaves a harrowing yarn about an obsessive fan trying to get his attention. Nas helped spread the term, rhyming in his 2001 diss track against Jay-Z “Ether,” “You a fan, a phony, a fake, a pussy, a Stan.” “His is the first recorded usage of ‘stan’ as a label (and a pejorative one) for an obsessive fan rather than the name of the fan himself,” as The Outline noted in 2017. Over the years, “stan” has morphed into a go-to slang term for diehard fans and was added [unbefuckinglievably] to the Oxford English Dictionary in 2017.[1] Bloody hell. I always knew Eminem was an asshole, and now, this. Footnotes[1] Eminem-Inspired Use of 'Stan' Added to Merriam-Webster's Dictionary

I honestly don’t think there’s a best at all. Each kpop group has a niche they fill or are trying to fill, so I can’t even compare the ones that I like because they’re in different audience markets. Everyone (for the most part) is hardworking. Everyone tries to be unique too (but I’m biased and find some groups generic). Everyone wants to work to the point of being the best too. So I don’t think comparing work ethic will determine who is the best. Not everyone is capable of producing, writing, or choreographing either, so I can’t compare that and say someone’s the best. A lot of the people I enjoy do aid in the process or do it themselves, so I’m biased in that. So yeah, I can’t really pick a best.

Red Velvet - They have many unique concepts for every song, due to the fact that the Red in Red Velvet means boldness and Velvet means smooth and silky. They have gotten on the chart the most times, they are really good. The members are Joy, Yeri, Irene, Seulgi, and Wendy. I recommend the songs “Ice Cream Cake” and “Bad Boy” Twice - Twice is the cutesy type of group; they have cuteness in every song, serious or bubbly. Twice and Blackpink are near competitors, they’re both really famous. Twice’s songs, in my opinion, kind of sound like anime introductions. They are phenomenal, and I definitely recommend them. The members are Sana, Momo, Mina, Jihyo, Tzuyu, Dahyun, Chaeyoung, Nayeon, and Jeongyeon. I recommend the songs “What is Love?” and “TT” (“TT” is a to-be-continued song and the song “Knock Knock” completes the story). EXID - EXID used to be one of those hidden bands and they were so unpopular that they were about to disband. A fancam showing their most popular member, Hani, at a concert performing “Up & Down” went viral and saved them from disbandment. They are really excellent; they have one of the best vocals from Solji and Hyerin, breathtaking visuals from Jeonghwa and Hani, killer rap from LE, and energetic dancing from Jeonghwa and LE. I recommend the songs “Up & Down”, “Ah Yeah”, and “L.I.E”. (Note: Hani and Jeonghwa are not renewing their contracts and are leaving after “Me&You” promotions are finished). Gfriend - Gfriend always brings you sad songs from a girlfriend’s perspective. Their music and choreography is hands down really good. The members are Sowon, Yerin, Eunha, Yuju, SinB, and Umji. I recommend the songs “Sunrise”, “Time for the moon night”, and “Navillera”. **THIS IS FROM A GIRL GROUP STAN’S PERSPECTIVE**

Girls’ Generation (SNSD)!  I’ve been following these girls for about seven years now and never once I regretted stanning them. Non-fans may think they’re fake, arrogant or whatever (I used to think so too when I wasn’t a sone), but when you give them a chance you realize how an amazing group of talented, hardworking and lovable women they are. I could write lines and lines of texts about how they not only broke the status quo by becoming a successful girl group with a huge fandom in a sea of boy groups but also became cultural icons in South Korea (which is one of the reasons so many younger girls have them as their role models), but instead, I’ll just say you should check their reality shows (like Hello Baby, Channel SNSD or their appearances on Running Man) and their albums, especially their japanese stuff. No way you won’t fall for them - I mean, there’s a reason they still have so many fans after a decade in the game, after all :) Useful links: SNSD Variety Show IndexList of SNSD’s Records and Achievements

My favorite group name is Seventeen. Why? Because it throws people off. jkjk I actually love the idea behind it. Seventeen was originally supposed to debut as 17 members, so the name would’ve made sense, but after four members left before debut, they changed the meaning of the name. “Thirteen members, three subunits, one family. 13 + 3 + 1 = 17.” That’s what Joshua (i think, I’ll have to check that later) said their name meant. Honestly, it’s a really sweet way to look at a name that throws everyone off.

Depends on which artist and/or group got you into K-pop in general. For me, I didn’t know Psy was the start of K-pop growth in the U.S. Because Gangnam Style came out when I was in 7th-8th grade. But any group you enjoy their music, learn about the group, watch variety shows they’re featured on, etc…learn about each member, choose your bias (favorite member), and keep on listening to them. So, in summary. All of the active K-pop groups that are growing internationally, are the best. Learn why they’re making such an impact on the world. Learn about what are they doing and what makes them so unique.

BTS Bullet Boy Scouts, is a very modernised, 21st century name. The concept behind it(I think) is very rare in many K Pop group names. Blackpink Vocalises that pretty is not everything and the name stands for feminism. EXO Initially its refers to EXOPLANET, as planet that is way out of this solar system. The letters (E and X and O) and the imagination behind the group name appeals me a lot. NCT I just like the matching of the 3 letters…. EVERGLOW Has a magical vibe to the name. DREAM CATCHER A very fancy and rare name for a group. TXT The meaning, “Tomorrow X Together” is a forever together kind of thing. TWICE A simple but rather posh name in different views.

That depends on what you mean by best. Are you talking about vocals? Visuals? Rap skills? preferences for those things vary from person to person. That being said, overall I personally believe that Shinhwa holds the title of very best, but that’s based on what I consider the best. If you meant vocals then I think Stellar is pretty well good in that category. I don’t listen to Exo, but I think they would probably take the award for most attractive. If you mean best by being all around good, then either A.C.E or Monsta x. But these are all groups that I consider the best, everyone has different preferences, and every group has different skills, so there really is no such thing as the best group.
